seeker: So I did as instructed and got the message on the website thanking me for verification.  The following week I got a physical letter saying I was approved and the award amount per week.

seeker: Yeah, it's pretty cool.  For example, if I hit DRAT in one stroke, then "Did there come a time" will appear in English on my machine's  LCD screen.
supporter: Wow that is crazy, I don't understand how that works, is it preprogrammed or does it go by how the word sounds?

seeker: Each stenographer has their own "Personal Dictionary" which is a list of words in English along with how you in particular write out those words or phrases in steno.  This dictionary is present within the actual steno machine after you transfer it from your laptop to the machine via cable or wifi.  Thus your machine then knows how you write out words in particular and how to translate those words from steno to English - each stenographer writes a little differently.

supporter: That sounds difficult and stressful. What do you do when you see it happening?

supporter: It sounds like you are avoiding things you enjoy because of their actions. I think documenting it is a good idea! Have you tried reporting them for harassing you?

supporter: That must be very frustrating. Can you tell me if you’ve tried other things to get them to stop?

supporter: You tried to do the right thing and they are having a difficult time letting go. The ongoing comments through social media sounds like they are wanting your attention. That can be exhausting for you. In my past, I had to block someone who did something similar to me. If my friends mentioned seeing something from my ex about me, I asked them to keep it to themselves or consider blocking them,too. The people who were closest to me understood what was going on and I realized that people who didn’t know me, didn’t matter. Would you be willing to suggest this to friends or family if it would help to remove the ex from your interactions?

seeker: I have encouraged my friends to block them as well, but a new account always pops up. My ex really will not give up.
supporter: I see. How long has this been going on and is this a daily occurrence or does it happen at certain times?

seeker: It has been happening for at least 6 months now and it usually happens every weekend
supporter: I can sense your frustration. It must be overwhelming at times and make you dread the weekends. It sounds like it has become a habit for your ex. It might help if you write a letter to them explaining that you are ready to move on and are asking them to do the same. Explain that you are giving them the opportunity to stop harassing you in the following ways [list some of the details you have documented]. Inform them that if they do not stop, you are considering taking it further regarding harassing communications and that this letter serves as your intention to no longer tolerate their actions. Send it via certified mail and keep a copy. This will give them no way to immediately respond and would be the first step of official documentation should they decide to continue.  Do you think that might help?

seeker: I think that is an excellent idea! That is a good way to end this once and for all.
supporter: I sincerely hope it is a step toward you regaining your control  over how you are able to interact with people. I wish you the best in dealing with this and hope you begin to feel better about it soon, especially entering into a new year!

supporter: yes, there is a lag in the system. it takes a while for the response to upload

seeker: Ok fine , it's so hard to get over someone after a breakup like this.
supporter: Yes, I agree. Sometimes it just takes time to process all the emotions.

seeker: I mean logically , I know it's not. If we were gonna break up, then we were gonna break up
supporter: Yes, that's a good point. It sounds like you are thinking this through in a good way, but the emotions are hard to process. Letting yourself feel the emotions is an important part of getting through a difficult situation.

seeker: But I want to keep his photos. And how would I even distract myself that much that I'd stop thinking about him completely.
supporter: It is understandable to want to keep photos. Distracting yourself might not be the solution; that could stop you from processing the emotions. There is a stage of grieving for a lost relationship that happens when a relationship ends. There will be grieving for the person, and for the relationship with that person. That is what has to be processed in order to move on.

seeker: Ok, I mean , I can try, But it's just, I don't want to leave him behind. I miss him
supporter: That makes sense; you care about him so you miss him. This is one of those things that will take time. Accepting and acknowledging the emotions, even when they are painful, will let the emotions evolve and over time they will become less painful.

seeker: But he's gone. I know it hurts so badly.
supporter: Yes, it must be a painful experience. The end of a relationship is a loss, and there is a grieving process to go through. That is a painful experience. I am sorry you have to go through this. I believe that you can manage this experience and end up a stronger person.

supporter: I can understand being stressed if you think you are not doing well in school and have a lot of work. How are your grades now?

seeker: I still have decent grades but I feel like I am not prepared for big exams currently and they are worth a lot
supporter: Yes, that can be tough. When I had a lot of tests coming up and a lot to study for, I wrote down goals to study -- like I broke down the classes and made certain goals to study a bit in each class. And then if I did that, I could go out with friends or some reward like that.

seeker: Yes, I think you have excellent advice about organization. I feel like I lose track of what I have and when to do it. I also bounce between classes, feeling stressed because there is so much. Do you think doing one class at a time is best?
supporter: Yes, stick to one subject at a time. For example, if you think 1/2 hour is good enough to study, then stick to that. When done, your done until the next time it is on your schedule.

seeker: Ok. Thank you so much for the ideas. It seems like you have had similar experiences with stress from school.
supporter: Procrastination never makes us feel good. If I keep putting something off, I then feel guilty. If I make a goal, and I reach it, I can put a reward. For example, if you study 3 subjects 1/2 hour each, you can go out for yogurt with a friend. So you reward yourself for sticking to that goal.

seeker: Yes, that was my other question to you. It sounds great to just do a little time for each class but I often get overwhelmed and need a break
supporter: Definitely you need a break, so schedule them as rewards. You can even do 15 minutes in say 4 subjects, then take a walk, take a cup of tea, or call a friend, then back to the books.

seeker: I have 6 classes
supporter: That's a lot but it is totally doable. Here is a good example, If you plant seeds in a garden today, you have to weed it a bit tomorrow, the next day, the next day, you have to wait for rain, then weed some more, the harvest comes and YAY! You are happy. But if you lie on your bed, never planting, never weeding, you procrastinate, you get nothing.

seeker: Yes haha. That is a good comparison. You have been super helpful. I will for sure try to use your advice. Thank you!
supporter: You are quite welcome! God bless have a great day!

seeker: Hi sorry
supporter: Ah! I remember my thesis, a lot of work. One thing for certain, I have a lot of pride over my accomplishment, it was well worth it. When is it due?

seeker: In about a month.
supporter: I'm sure you will be able to finish it, sometimes we find ourselves in a slump and need some fresh air blown our way.

seeker: Yes, but I've been really bad about keeping her in the loop. I feel bad when I fall behind, and then I'm fearful of getting back in touch with her.
supporter: Whenever I have a large project and lose motivation, I set my goals on paper, then break it down into smaller bites. For example, I will make sure I work one hour on certain days, or call a friend, I generate ideas to keep me on track.

seeker: That sounds like a good idea regarding putting it down on paper.
supporter: It has always helped me. For example, you can break it down into 4 weeks, then each week write your goals -- maybe put call Advisor or go stop by every week, but I would put that first for the first week.

seeker: My other problem is that I'm a perfectionist. I tend to over-analyze and get bogged down, especially when doing research.
supporter: Another idea is rewards, when you finish one goal, perhaps put a reward for yourself,  a yogurt with sprinkles or something like that

seeker: That definitely sounds reasonable. Putting micro deadlines in might be what I need to do to keep me focused.
supporter: I do this with EVERYTHING in life because I tend to go on and on too focused and lose track of everything. lol For example, I clean each room for 15 minutes a week. If it needs more, I do more, but I set the timer and you would be surprised how well that works, otherwise, I will spend all my time perfecting one room and the rest is a mess.

seeker: My advisor is a tough woman, I'm not going to beat around the bush. She tends to make everything miserable.
supporter: Tough advisors are TOUGH. lol But You sound intelligent and you obviously WANT to do this, it is a goal of yours, I'm sure you can take it!

seeker: I'll try to keep that in mind. It's something I do feel like I need to finish for my own sake.
supporter: It is only one more month of your life. If you buckle down, it will be over and done with before you know it. And I assure you, you will look back in pride at your accomplishments!

seeker: That sounds like a wonderful feeling. But so far away.
supporter: My Graduation Day was amazing.  This is what life is about, working NOW for rewards later. It's like a garden, you sow, you weed, you wait for rain and weed some more. You keep waiting and weeding, then later harvest come. It takes time to work a little each day, then time passes whether you lay on your bed or whether you are in the garden working. If you lay on your bed, you get nothing, if you work a little every day, in time, you reap rewards.

seeker: That's a very poetic way of putting it.
supporter: Not much in life is easy or free, if we keep working little by little, as time passes, you real a lot of rewards, in fact, you will reap rewards of finishing this thesis for YEARS even decades. It is a great goal and a worthy one to keep at.

seeker: I'll keep that in mind as I move forward. I really appreciate your help.
supporter: I commend you for doing the thesis and I also know it can get weary as time passes, but with some goals on paper a visit to the ADVISOR (hee hee) will set you up right for continued success.

supporter: I am sorry to hear that. What precipitated that, had you been having problems for a while?

seeker: She was in a psych ward for a while and when it was time to discharge her, my mother didnt want her back. She was going to send her to a foster home so I volunteered to take her in.
supporter: Ah, so you feel as though your mother could and should have helped and you were put into an impossible position you were not prepared for?

seeker: Pretty much.
supporter: I can sympathise with you having siblings with extreme mental health problems - I have been there too and I know how difficult it is.

seeker: I tried to have  my mother take her back, but she still didnt want her there. So I sent her to my grandmothers and she turned that side of the family against me.
supporter: Mentally ill people can unfortunately sometimes be manipulative, though they do not mean it. Have you had any contact with her since?

seeker: Only once and she was just telling me that I was a horrible person.
supporter: That sounds very toxic. Is it possible to persuade her to seek medical help? I realise she might be reluctant to

seeker: We have tried to get her into therapy again. But, COVID put a block on that.
supporter: Ah yes, it is a terrible time at the moment isn't it? I think a lot of people are not getting the medical help that they need because of the virus

seeker: I would hate to see that happen, but Im at my wits end.
supporter: I can tell that you feel really bad about this just from your  tone of voice. Please remember that you can't fix everything in the world.

seeker: Now my dads side of the family hates me because they say Im "mean to her". All I asked her to do was to clean her room and maybe socialize every once in a while.
supporter: Socialising can be hard for people with mental health problems. It might have been best if you did not press her too hard to do that though I know you did not realise.

seeker: I understand, but I think it would have better than sitting in a dark room all day.
supporter: Does she suffer from depression also? That might account for her trying to shut herself away

seeker: Yes, but she denies it whole heartedly.
supporter: I understand that it can be very difficult to make people take medication if they refuse to recognise that they have a problem.

seeker: I just wish she could she what I see...
supporter: Unfortunately that is not likely to be possible. All you can do is be kind to yourself and know that you really did try to help her

seeker: I was afraid she was going to ruin my family with her attitudes.
supporter: I hope that I have been able to help a little. I really appreciate that you felt that you could open up to me

seeker: Thank you. I feel better being able to rant to someone.
supporter: You're welcome. Have a lovely festive season! I feel that all will be better in the coming year.

seeker: I need someone to talk to, I am sad.
supporter: I am really sorry to her that. I hope that I can help you a little. Would you tell me what the problem is?

seeker: I really love my wife, but I also like other women.
supporter: Ah - so I hear you saying you are tempted to be unfaithful to your marriage vows?

seeker: Yes.  I tried to see if she would let me sleep with other women from the Internet, and she is not allowing it.
supporter: Well I must say that as a woman I would not allow it either ;)

seeker: Yes I would agree with that.  I guess I wanted my cake and be able to eat it too.
supporter: It does sound like it. Are there any other problems in your marriage that might be making you unhappy or is it generally okay and you just want someone else too?

seeker: I am trying to get my wife to spice up our love-making and she is unwilling to do so, and that makes me super sad.
supporter: Have you considered getting some sort of marriage guidance counselling? There are people out there who might be able to help you both

seeker: Why would we need counseling to spice up a love life?  That should come naturally, is it hard for women to make that change?
supporter: I think it sounds as though you might be pushing her into things she is not ready for though. Have you considered that you might be the problem?

seeker: That is what makes me sad, I know I am the problem.  I am a piece of trash, she is way better than me.    I hate myself.
supporter: No, I do not think you should say that! At least you recognise that you are not behaving well, which is the first step on the road to making things better.

seeker: Maybe I have a sex addiction.  I think I watch too much pornography and it gives me weird ideas for sex.
supporter: Perhaps you could consider individual counselling to overcome your own problems before you think of couples' therapy?

seeker: Just for me?  I hope I get a male counselor because if it was a female one, I would probably want to sleep with her.
supporter: Well, perhaps it would be better for you to learn that you can't just do that even though you want to :)

seeker: Yes, I can't control my impulses.  I am picturing what you look like now and imagining what we would do together.  I think I have a big problem.
supporter: I am forty five, fat and married :). I do recommend talking to someone though.

seeker: I am forty one, fat and married.  I actually prefer heavier ladies, but I get your point.  :)
supporter: I am glad you were able to confide a little in me and hope it is the first step on the road to a happier marriage. I do recommend not giving into your urges and remembering how much you love your wife. I wish you all the best for the future and have a lovely Christmas!

seeker: Thanks, you too.
supporter: (you need to end the conversation from your end - I can't )

Well first off that is normal to feel that way. I think most of us do but just don't speak up about it. Also being away from your friends and family can cause feelings of doubt because you may not feel like you have trusted ones to lean on.
However

supporter: Meditation, yoga, a warm bath these things can also be soothing as well. SOmetimes using kinectic energy up can help as well like going for a brisk walk to burn off the adrenaline that causes anxiety

supporter: Yes! Heck go all out and do both is you have a treadmill ha ha ! do what makes YOU happy even if just for a moment

supporter: How long have you been working there?

seeker: I am very sad about this country and my work situation.
supporter: I understand,  I have been in a similar situation recently. COVID-19 really has got us all down.

seeker: What a great nation we live in.....a future 3rd world one.
supporter: WOW, I'm sure that is a big change for you...

seeker: Yeah, I have not told my wife about it just yet.
supporter: I agree, this country has got some issues but we can get through them

seeker: Yeah, I am not sure.  I better wait to break the news in 2021.
supporter: The good news is that we are on an incline for unemployment so there are a lot of opportunities out there.

seeker: And I am not the only one who is losing my job. Seems that all of accounting is going to be getting the axe. It makes me sad....
supporter: You could maybe tell her at the very end of this year so you can start fresh for the new year. Do you have a resume?

seeker: Plus, I have a 50 dollar a day spending habit on lottery tickets to one day hit it BIG
supporter: Sometimes that will help to get a better perspective on things... taking some time away from everything in order to catch a breath.

seeker: Maybe I can spend some quality time with my kids without them knowing I will be out of a job as of 01/15/2021
supporter: I hear ya, I feel like that quite a bit. Like if isn't one thing it's another. I'm sure your wife will understand how the economy has gotten and that she knows that it isn't your fault.

seeker: Maybe, but we have a huge mortgage and two BMW's. We spend lavishly....
supporter: Sometimes it's hard to see the other door opening when we run into tough times, but remember all the good times you have had. Those would not be good times if it were'nt for tough times.

seeker: True, but the Office was my home away from home.  I need to figure out how to deal with my sadness.....
supporter: Well try and think of maybe only spending half of that on lottery, maybe that will help to conserve some money in these tough times.

seeker: Yeah, that is a good point.  Should I change careers?
supporter: I don't think a huge change like that is neccessary, maybe just looking into options. Unemployment and government help until something else comes up.

seeker: Unemployment doesn't last forever; plus, I have pride in my work.  Americans are suppose to be strong.
supporter: Exercise also  releases endorphins that can make you feel happy.

seeker: Any other suggestions? I was thinking about becoming an Uber and Lyft driver.
supporter: I like to hear that, I am a proud American myself.

seeker: Well, thanks for your input.  I think this chat has been helpful.  I am a proud American!
supporter: It does wear off, but if you get into a routine of doing it, it will help to alleviate some of that sadness

seeker: I'm really upset about a break up I just had with my boyfriend.
supporter: I am sorry, when did this happen?

seeker: It happened two days ago.  I can't believe he led me on for almost a year knowing that I had two children and all of a sudden decided that he didn't want to deal with kids.
supporter: I can understand the pain you must feel and the betrayal, that is absolutely awful.

seeker: I do.  I don't understand why he was fine with my kids for almost a  year and all of a sudden it changed.  I'm completely blindsided.
supporter: How are your children doing through this?

seeker: They don't know yet.  I didn't want to upset them right before Christmas.
supporter: What a terrible thing for him to do. I agree with you not to upset them right before Christmas.

seeker: I'm not really sure how to break it to them when I do finally tell them.
supporter: That is always a tough one. My suggestion is to not put him in a bad light since they do not have the angry feelings toward him that you do. Maybe tell them that he has made some choices in life that doesn't involve you, and unfortunately, we cannot control people and their feelings.

seeker: That is a good idea.  That would be good so they don't think it has anything to do with them because I'd never want them to feel bad about it!
supporter: Exactly, that is a burden that children should never have to endure. They are always the innocent victims in our personal problems.

seeker: Hopefully they don't ask me what choices he made and want details.
supporter: True! How old are they?

seeker: They are 6 and 8 years old
supporter: They should hopefully be young enough not to want details. Maybe if they ask say he didn't give you details because he apparently doesn't know himself what he wants. You sound like a very caring mother who wants the very best for her children.

seeker: thank you!
supporter: I have a daughter and we have went through something similar in the past so I can relate. The truth is, I have found over time that it is our children who get us through these tough time.

seeker: Yes, seeing their faces tomorrow when they open presents will help get me through this sad time!
supporter: You will get through this and come out ahead in the long run, just stay strong!

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hello there, how are you?

seeker: Kind of angry and disappointed.
supporter: I'm very sorry to hear that, did something not go as planned recently?

seeker: My friend created a group chat for planning activities and did not include me. She included people who are closer to me than to her. Almost like she is trying to steal my friends.
supporter: I see. So when she did this, it gave you the feeling of almost being replaced or abandoned by your own social circle?

seeker: In a way. I was disappointed by the rest of them but mostly angry at her. It almost feels like she wants to be the leader of the group and feels like I am her competition.
supporter: It's definitely frustrating to feel that your support system could possibly become a source of stress and competition anxiety. Especially since it's where we're supposed to feel safe and unjudged.

seeker: Exactly. They are supposed to be the people I can go to with my problems. Now I feel like they all had a secret which I wasn't privy to and it made me feel disconnected and untrusting towards them.
supporter: It sounds that you're a person who really does care about keeping the relationships they've invested in healthy and open. That care level can definitely cause natural anxiousness in situations like this, when the place you stand with them and what they're thinking suddenly feels uncertain.

seeker: I am a bit of an idealist. I like for everyone to be in harmony, to be nice, supportive, caring, open and honest. I don't know how to move on from this.
supporter: Right, and there are endless possibilites the mind can create outside of ideal. But funnily enough, the imagination of an idealist that lets them visualize great things can also create equally strong fears before getting answers. And thankfully those fears can be addressed outside of the head where they're made.

seeker: I talked about it with one friend. He felt bad but what I couldn't understand why he was secretive about the chat too. If he thought we were close why hide stuff?
supporter: Right, it can seem a bit confusing since you naturally would expect to feel comfortable with so much between each other already.

seeker: Do you think it is asking too much on my part?
supporter: On the contrary, I think you might not be allowing yourself to ask enough!

seeker: Sometimes I question if it is even worth talking to them about it. People often don't want to say what they really think. Instead they just say whatever to avoid confrontation.
supporter: Some people express themselves best through their actions. Have you tried suggesting a meeting for something you'd usually do to see if they're willing to hang out just as always?

seeker: I'm very stressed.  Virtual school is so hard.
supporter: So you are having trouble with Virtual school being so hard and it's causing you stress, am I understanding correctly?

seeker: Yes, that is correct.  I need to be in a classroom to really grasp the material, I think.
supporter: I remember being in your position

seeker: I just want to quit school because I can't seem to do better.
supporter: I know you said you want to quit, but hang in there!

seeker: I wish I knew how long we would have to be virtual.  I don't think I can last another semester teaching myself from home.
supporter: It sounds like you have always done well with school, this virus has made it to where so many people are struggling. Just chatting with you, I can feel how stressed and anxious about it you are!

seeker: Yes, I was always an honors student so this is a huge change for me.   I'm afraid it will reflect on my GPA forever.
supporter: I know that the situation with virtual learning is out of your control when it comes to how long it will last but is there anything you could do to relieve your stress while you are trying to learn things yourself?

seeker: I tried exercise to see if that would help.  It hasn't really helped because the time I spend exercising I just think I could be studying.
supporter: When you start feeling stressed maybe you could try deep breathing for a few minutes to relax again. Or take a quick break and get some fresh air?

seeker: I could try deep breathing. Fresh air is hard because we're in the middle of a snow storm!
supporter: Oh wow that would make things complicated! But yes the deep breathing would definitely help, I'm sure!

seeker: I will try the deep breathing more often.
supporter: Maybe you could reward yourself with a spa trip ever so often, since you enjoy it?

seeker: That's a good idea.  Maybe I could make it a reward for a good grade on a test.
supporter: Yes, please do! I am almost certain that could help you!

seeker: I think it might too!
supporter: Yes, please do! I am almost certain that could help you!

seeker: Hello. Feeling low today.
supporter: Thank you for reaching out. Tell me more about it.

seeker: I've been remote working for the entire pandemic. At first, it was great. I didn't go into the office very often before, so I felt relief from feeling any obligation to do so. But now I wonder if I am presenting myself well if my clients and coworkers have so much less personal interaction.
supporter: yeah I agree. This pandemic has really been weighing on us. As it pertains to work, you feel like the lacking of personal interaction has distanced yourself and colleagues and you feel like there is an increasingly large barrier given the physical constraint?

seeker: Yes. I can be terse and maybe even come across as confrontational online. But when I interact in person, we share so more - body language, facial expressions, we don't have as much of a time constraint. I feel like a lot of my value may be overshadowed by unfavorable impressions.
supporter: Can you tell me more about your work responsibilities - is it of a customer service nature? It would help me understand your situation better. I can relate to words vs. the combination of facial expression, body language, etc. The single channel of communication has stripped a lot of meaning and value and has made performance a lot more difficult. The transition is challenging and the uncertainty of the future also adds to the stress.

seeker: Yes, it is of customer service nature. I provide expertise and technical products.
supporter: Thank you for sharing that. I have a better understanding now.What you feel is very valid, and I am sure it is shared among a lot of people this year.

seeker: Thanks. It helps to know that I'm not alone.
supporter: My current work is in the finance section. Prior to pandemic, the touch base with colleagues are rather pleasant. Now the workload has decreased and we are rigidly arranging for meetings in 30 minute time slots. It is challenging in a sense that it is harder to fill the gap.

seeker: So, perhaps limiting meeting times can help the team focus on issues?
supporter: I would personally suggest more happy hours, in case you haven't already done so.

seeker: Ah, something more casual?
supporter: Holiday care packages would also be a good common ground for folks to gather around over something that is not work.

seeker: That's a great idea! I would love to get a care package, actually!
supporter: Yeah maybe also virtual meditation sessions can help concentration mind and body. It doesn't have to be hobbies of our own, but doing it as a team virtually can bring people together and boost morale.

seeker: Thank you! I will suggest that my organization arrange these. We can even ask all the employees to showcase their hobbies, or some such.
supporter: That is good to hear. I am aware that the other team in my company all read a book called How to Be Antiracist. It can serve as both learning and bonding purposes.

seeker: I need support to feel ok during the pandemic
supporter: Hello.

seeker: HI there
supporter: What type of things are you worried about during the pandemic?

seeker: That I may not find a job soon which is making me depressed
supporter: So just to make sure I understand, you are anxious about possibly loosing your job due to the pandemic

seeker: I am not working at the moment, I am looking for a job but it has been really difficult to find one
supporter: Have you looked into a hiring agency? They are great at helping find people jobs, especially in these hard times.

seeker: I have but seems like there are no entry level jobs currently and also some employers have ceased hiring
supporter: After interviews have you been following up to show interest again in the job?

seeker: Yes I have emailed every employer where I was interviewed. Also I follow up with every hiring agency I have signed up to.
supporter: Have you networked with any previous co-workers? They might be able to help you find something as well,

seeker: They all suggest to wait for a few months till things are bit normal. They also advice to keep trying.
supporter: Just from chatting with you for a few I can tell this is making you very anxious/

seeker: Yes it indeed is
supporter: I have also been worried recently about finding another job because of the pandemic, but I found that getting back into my hobbies has helped keep me distracted and get my mind off of it.

seeker: It is very difficult to stay home doing nothing, it is very upsetting
supporter: I think painting more would be very helpful!

seeker: I should try doing that, thanks
supporter: No problem! If you have any other issues just chat in!

seeker: No issues other than this at the moment. Have you found a new job?
supporter: I have! I went through hiring agencies and got one. It did take a while, but it was super helpful.

seeker: Glad to hear, Congratulations!! Hope I find a job soon
supporter: I know you will find something soon!

seeker: Thanks!!
supporter: You're welcome!

seeker: Hello.
supporter: hell, sorry

seeker: A little down. Kind of broke for Christmas.
supporter: I totally understand how you feel

seeker: Yeah, it's pretty tough because the year went really well until the summer. I was hoping for a strong close.
supporter: If you don't mind may I ask you a few question? Are you trying to find gigs?

seeker: Yes but with the pandemic, people are just doing small work themselves instead of hiring out.
supporter: Sorry. I guess you have to change your plan so much.

seeker: That's what I've been doing, but it's a lot of running in place trying to generate any income.
supporter: I meant you had to change your plan

seeker: Yes, and the changes I've made to the plan haven't lead to a whole lot more.
supporter: I am also looking for more gigs and because of Covid, I'm only looking online jobs

seeker: Like "work from home" style jobs?
supporter: yes just like this mturk

seeker: Hmm, maybe I can look into these type of jobs. I don't have a great computer but it could do for some stuff.
supporter: Jobs are super competitive these days. Have you thought about becoming a YouTuber or a live streamer?

seeker:
Yes, I've tried both of those. It's mostly luck based. You just have to hope that enough people get interested to make it work and a lot of wasted effort goes into self-
promotion.
supporter: I believe after Covid is over more onsite jobs will be available. I hope you will be able to comfortably spend your days until then.

seeker: I agree with that. I just hope
supporter: Oh I see. I see you have made a lot of effort to get additional income. Wonderful, I believe you are a great worker when you work, whatever you do. You have passion and motivation.

seeker: That is true, I am a hard worker, no matter the job.
supporter: I would brush up my resume, make it more noticeable, change your LinkedIn profile if you have one. So that future employer will be able to find you, such a great candidate.

seeker: Hmmm, my resume could use some work, that is true.
supporter: About resume, one of my friends added his picture wearing a Trump tie on his resume  lol . I thought it was weird but whatever it makes it noticeable could help.

seeker:
I never thought about adding a picture to my resume, but it would help show that I'm a profes
sional.
supporter: Me either, I had never seen a resume with a picture. Yes wear a nice suit and look good.

seeker: I will try that.
supporter: Oh I see. Woodworking sounds cool! I would do the same and start my own business as a side at first.

seeker: Well I think I'm going to go work on my resume and maybe buy some new tools.
supporter: I hope you'll find something perfect soon and enjoy your quiet Chrismas

seeker: Yes, thank you for the ideas. Goodbye.
supporter: ok it was great talking to you. Good luck. Bye

seeker: Hey, how are you doing?
supporter: Hello, I am doing well. How are you doing today?

seeker: I'm doing alright, I'm facing a lot of academic pressure from my program and I feel trapped
supporter: Oh, it sounds like you are stressed from the academic pressure that you are facing right now?

seeker: Yes, I have a lot of coursework but I have no help from from my advisors. A few of my peers feel the same way. Not sure what to do. I don't believe remote learning is helpful in a master program because the professor/advisor are not always available.
supporter: I see how this can be stressful for you and your fellow peers. Have you tried other steps besides the one's you tried before by contacting the professor?

seeker: I tried, but the coursework is difficult and the other solution is tutorials on youtube but there is so much you can do on your own. Plus I have a job as well, so limited hours
supporter: I can relate to this because it is hard to work and do school as well. I can tell it makes you feel concerned about your schooling and you want to do the best you can.

seeker: I wish so, do your best and hope for the best I guess.
supporter: You are doing great I believe and really trying hard to do your schoolwork right.

seeker: I just need to deal with the stress so it doesnt effect me
supporter: Why do you think that might be?

seeker: I feel that the stress is effecting my sleep and my work, because I constantly worry. Any tips?
supporter: I would try to have a regular to set a goal for each day by stating to yourself today is a new day, remain focus on the task at hand, try not to worry about all tasks at once, and lastly try to find a relaxing sleep schedule that fits your needs.

seeker: I see, I think making a schedule and breaking task into little ones will help complete them. I guess I will stress less.
supporter: Yes, It will be hard at first because you are not use to it, but once you get started your life will be so much more relaxing. Your stress level will become more less than what is was before. Also, You will be able to have a clearer mind to concentrate on your schoolwork more by having this new schedule.

seeker: These message is really helpful and I will start doing what you have told me as soon as possible. I just want to live happily but thank you for this conversation.
supporter: I am glad to hear because you can do it. I believe in you. I am happy that this really help you and you are so very welcome.

seeker: Thanks for the distressing tips and other tips as well, I wish a happy holiday. I do feel a lot better.
supporter: I wish you a great school semester because you deserve it. I am glad you feel better and continue keep this motivation about yourself to bring out the best you can be. Never settle less. You are so welcome, and I wish you a Happy Holiday as well.

seeker: Hi there
supporter: Hello, Merry Christmas Eve

seeker: And to you
supporter: How are you today? I am buried in cookie dough, lol, but happy and wwell.

seeker: That sounds like a cozy scene :)
supporter: Yes it is nice. Are you doing anything festive today?

seeker: No, nothing much. Same as always, on and off work, having a meal with the girlfriend, that sort. (It would help if this system shows us if one of us is typing..)
supporter: I understand that times are rough lately. Sounds like there is some time to figure it out, take full advantage of all the time you can. I hope it works out and a new position becomes available, I know your story is shared by many right now. What a crazy time we are in

seeker: Ah fair, that's good to know
supporter: what are cv's? I see, I am getting by by dping a billion a day lol

seeker: I get what you mean about other lines of work. I'm trained as an academic research associate and had to spend a few months last year working in an Amazon warehouse. I feel like I've wasted enough time outside of aimed-for career to go back to doing manual labour.
supporter: well the title sounds legit, lol, but yes i see and understand. Did you do the trainging in the warehouse for the research job?

seeker: No, completely unrelated jobs. It was more of a "really need a job right now" situation, and they were hiring quite unassumingly.
supporter: oh i see.

seeker: Are you working in such a role? I doubt my qualifications translate THAT well haha
supporter: I make a good case right so you might think I was but no, I am not I only wish to be. I wish to be much more than I am but ya know I work with what I can find to do. Id savd the world every day if zi could knowing my efforts were toowrads a good cause.

seeker: I do like that idea. I might actually go and give that a shot and see what happens.
supporter: as we were told growing up the worst they could say is no,

seeker: True, but a lot of no's can take a toll on one's psyche
supporter:
yes for sure
dont go on like that for too long.

seeker: Sure, let's call it here.
supporter: ok nice chat you too

seeker: Hello.
supporter: Hello! How are you today?

seeker: I am doing so-so. I just found out that my company was going to be using the new round of the paycheck protection from the stimulus to pay us. Now that didn't get afford and I think we will be laid off on Monday.
supporter: Ok. You are making some assumptions on information you have about your company. Remember that you may not know the whole story.

seeker: Well they sent out a email letting us know of the situation. SO I am also sure it is going to happen. I'm not sure how to let my family know.
supporter: Ok. Have you thought about a plan? When you tell your family, it may help to state your planned actions. This may help with feelings of uncertainty, both theirs and yours.

seeker: Yea I just hate to do it today or tomorrow with it being Christmas. We do have a saving so that is good. But it will only last about 2 months.
supporter: I know. This is the worst time of year for this news. Surprisingly, it happens very often.

seeker: Yea. We have been saving snice the start of Covid. I knew this day would come it just hard at this time.
supporter: Do you anticipate any roadblocks to finding new employment in your industry?

seeker: In my area yes. I can find some in bigger cities but I don't want to move.
supporter: Do you think that outlining a plan of action, and sharing that with your family will help turn this around a bit? Perhaps, think about as looking forward to a better opportunity in your future?

seeker: Yes I am thinking on Sunday would be good and maybe by gods help we will have a stimulus deal.
supporter: The stimulus has helped a lot of people get through this tough time. Sounds like you will feel much more secure knowing that you will have some income, and not have to use your savings that you worked so hard for.

seeker: Yes and that will allow me to keep working as well. Which I want to do. I love my job.
supporter: It's a wonderful thing to love your job. I love mine, as well, and would feel bad if it were put at risk.

seeker: Thanks I'm so glad I was able to chat with you. I feel so much better already.
supporter: Your hard work and savings will get you through, no matter what happens or the gods decree. You have demonstrated that you can take care of yourself and your family.

seeker: Thank you. So much for your help and kind words. You saved my Christmas spirt.
supporter: I can say that many friends of mine have found new jobs, most have left their old ones willingly for new opportunities. There are out there.

seeker: I may start looking on Monday to see what's out there
supporter: Consider making your plan of action, regardless of what happens with the stimulus. THis is an unprecedented time. There may be ways to...use it to your advantage.

seeker: Hello.
supporter: hello how may I assist you today?

seeker: I am just so upset
supporter: I am sorry to hear that. I know how you feel.

seeker: Yeah...
supporter: What have you tried in the past to turn things around?

seeker: Hm. I tried moving on. And it just appears she gets worst
supporter: So you are missing your mom?

seeker: Not really...
supporter: Oh I see my mom has also done this in the past. Sometimes I wonder who raised who?

seeker: Yeah. I get that
supporter: That is the worst. I ended up having to cut my mom out of my life.

seeker: I wonder if I should do the same...
supporter: Sometimes it is for the best to set clear boundries.

seeker: But who knows. Apparently my mom said she'll put the house in my name for all these things I did for her.
supporter: Is Grand mother ashamed of you or her daughter? I feel it should be her ashamed of her daughter.

seeker: My grand mother is ashamed of her daughter
supporter: At least that is a good thing to come out of a bad situation.

seeker:
Only reason she has a house is because I helped. And if I leave it. Everyone in my family said I would be irresponsible
 to let my mom lose it.
supporter: I do not think that would have a reflection on you. It should only reflect on your mom.

seeker: Yeah, they said they already know my mother is irresponsible.
supporter: It may be nice to have a bonus house for the future. But even that comes with headaches. In the end you have to do what is best for you.

seeker: Yeah. I guess boundaries are good.
supporter: Or sell it now and pocket the money to recoup what was lost.

seeker: I would but it isn't even my property
supporter: So she is just talking circles and not accomplishing what she says?

seeker: More like she keeps talking about doing something crazy like have a police chase
supporter: Some people do choose that life to be free of responsibility.

seeker: I tried to baker act her after she tried to call the cops on me randomly
supporter: Often police officers are not fully trained in helping mentally ill people, they only access if the person is a danger to themselves or others.

seeker: yeah it sucks
supporter: A good first step is taking her to your local mental health provider. Or ask at a major emergency room where this is located as sometimes the places are hard to find.

seeker: That was about 30 years ago
supporter: Without treatment she may just be getting worse.

seeker:
I've heard she has a lawyer trying to straighten up the whole disability and tr
eatment thing
supporter: That does make it difficult when a partner encourages you to engage in unhealthy behavior.

seeker: Yeah. If it was up to me I would probably just be dead silent
supporter: I suggest talking to your girlfriend about how it makes you feel when she insists you continue a relationship that causes so much pain.

seeker: Yeah. That's a good point.
supporter: It was nice talking to you.

seeker: Hi
supporter: How are you today?

seeker: Not good
supporter: I am sorry to hear you are not doing do good. Can you tell me how this feeling came about?

seeker: I can't do anything correctly in my life
supporter: It seems as if you may have some doubt and may feel unwanted and because of this you feel sad.

seeker: Yeah , i am in sad mood
supporter: Yes.

seeker: .good family and good friends too.
supporter: I have been were you are right now and i know you may be hurting at the moment.

seeker: Do you have any feeling like me now are before
supporter: You mentioned you feel sad and unloved but you have a good family. Do you feel as if you lack a good support systems within your family?

seeker: My problem is i have a good job. But i want to follow my passion . I need my job at the same time i want to follow my passion. But my parents said don't quit my job
supporter: No, not any more. I have to reflect on what was causes my feelings to be so negative and i corrected them.

seeker: Yes you are correct
supporter: From listening to you it seems as if you love your family and they also love and for sure want nothing but the best for you. The only thing is, is what's best for them seems like it is not best for you. What would you say?

seeker: Hello, I have been feeling very anxious and stressed recently.
supporter: Why have you been feeling stressed and anxious?

seeker: I failed my first exam earlier this week and I have 2 more later on in this week. I am already disheartened about my first failure and I am scared that I will fail again.
supporter: I'm sure you tried your best on that test, as long as you study hard I believe you can ace those next 2 exams!

seeker: I have been too stressed about my other exams, it's making it hard for me to focus on studying and I don't know what to do.
supporter: I've heard that meditation can help with stress and focus, maybe you could try meditating for a bit before you study?

seeker: I have never tried meditating before, I have no idea where to start.
supporter: Meditation is essentially focussing on breathing, you could start by closing your eyes and slowly breathe in an out.

seeker: I feel like a failure and I am scared my parents are going to be disappointed in me
supporter: From what you're saying to me, I feel that you don't believe in yourself very much.

seeker: I guess you are right, I need to believe in myself and my abilities more.
supporter: I've struggled with the same thing before, whenever I doubt myself I look back at all i've accomplished and look at myself in the mirror and tell myself that I can do it. It has worked well for me.

seeker: What if I fail another exam this week? I need at least an 80% to pass my class, I am so worried.
supporter: Psychologies studies show that spacing out your studying and relearning helps you remember more information, you could try to section off your studying and then reviewing information before the exam!

seeker: That seems like a good plan, hopefully I will be able to get the score I need to pass.
supporter: I'm sure you'll do your best and pass that exam with flying colors!

seeker: Is there any other piece of advice you have for me before I get to studying again?
supporter: I have two actually! 1. Do not procrastinate as that will only cause you more stress and 2. Believe in yourself! I know you can do it, you should too!

seeker: I appreciate you helping me, I am feeling much more confident!
supporter: Of course! I'm glad you're feeling more confident!

seeker: i've been feeling really depressed and lethargic lately
supporter: Can you explain to me more in depth what events are making you feel this way?

seeker: the fact that there is a pandemic and travel is restricted, normally i would spend the holidays with my family but i will be alone this year
supporter: I understand exactly how you feel since I am also unable to go fly out to see my family this Christmas.

seeker: Hello, is someone there?
supporter: Hello, my name is Jonathan. May I ask who I am speaking to today?

seeker: Hi Jonathan, I'm Keri.
supporter: Hi Keri. How are you today?

seeker: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately.
supporter: Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately?

seeker: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married.
supporter: Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two?

seeker: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick.
supporter: Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours?

seeker: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.
supporter: That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.

seeker: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.
supporter: I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.

seeker: Haha, watering my own grass. That is a good way to put it. Thank you for talking to me for a few minutes. It makes me feel a little bit better to have someone agree that it is okay to spend time working on me, instead of thinking that it is sad or pathetic or an excuse. I really appreciate it.
supporter: Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.

seeker: Have a good night, Jonathan. :-)
supporter: Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!

seeker: It's alright. Definitely not as cold as last year which is something to be slightly thankful for.
supporter: Well let's be grateful for small mercies :). How are you feeling in yourself though? Is there anything you'd like to talk about?

supporter: But do you really think that you would have been admitted to the class if you were not up to the standard? Do you think that maybe most of your classmates are secretly feeling the same?

supporter: Then I think it is probably just a general self esteem issue and nothing academic!
