seeker: Hi, I need to vent about an ongoing situation.  Can I talk to you?
supporter: Of course you can talk to me, What would you like to vent about?

seeker: I am that friend that everyone can count on, I put everyone before me.  But lately even though i volunteer to help, I have been feeling used and very angry.
supporter: So you are feeling kind of used by your friends and/or family?

seeker: Yes, very used and very angry.
supporter: I can understand how you feel, I have felt used at times by family and friends myself.

seeker: It is like they could care less about what I need to do, they show up late to get their kids, or think nothing of running errands and not coming early.
supporter: Why haven't you said anything to them?

seeker: I hate confrontation.
supporter: I understand, confrontation can be quite stressful.

seeker: exactly, do you think I should just stop saying yes to them.
supporter: There may not be an alternative unfortunately. In order to avoid involuntary and messy conflict later you may need to have planned/structured conflict now.

seeker: That was what I was thinking also.  i will try to not be available.
supporter: I think it may be important to make sure you have an end goal in mind in order to have a chance to  resolve the conflict in peace.

seeker: My end goal is to be respected.  Perhaps I really need to have a conversation and see how that goes first,
supporter: I think that is a wise first step.

seeker: Me too, thanks for listening and helping me come to a decision.
supporter: I am grateful to be of help.

seeker: hello!
supporter: hello there

seeker: I'm stressed about my finals :(
supporter: When is your finals?

seeker: They are in 1.5 weeks.
supporter: Have you reviewed all of your materials?

seeker: I'm just getting started with doing that for three of my classes. One of my other classes I have already been studying for about a week.
supporter: As long as you prepare, you shouldn't be too worried about it

seeker: Yes but I'm still anxious that I won't prepare enough and I'll get bad grades
supporter: You are only 1.5 weeks away from the exam, the only thing you can do right now is studying as hard as you can. There's no point worrying

seeker: That is true
supporter: So as long as you try your best, you already did everything you could

seeker: I will try and study really hard the next couple days then
supporter: Howeve, i would use the last day before the finals to relax and avoid overwhelming your brain

seeker: ohh that's a good idea. thank you! I'll do some relaxing activities that day
supporter: with that short of a time, maybe you should ask your friends and go over main points together

seeker: that would be smart too. I can do that for two classes but not the other two because i don't know people in those classes
supporter: then do it as much as you can, as for the classes that impossible, you can study by yourself . If you pay attention and study hard, i have no doubt you'll ace this exam

seeker: thank you! i really appreciate the help you have given me
supporter: I'm glad I could be some help

seeker: Hello, i am good, how are you??
supporter: I am fine as well, thanks for asking. How may i support you today?

seeker: I have been feeling very depressed and i don't know what to do.
supporter: I understand. May I please know what is the cause of your depression?

seeker: I think the state of the world and not being able to go to work
supporter: Yes. The world is in a pretty bad place due to the pandemic. It has caused infinite sufferings to numerous people.

seeker: How do I handle that/
supporter: We are all in this together. With proper emotional support, each of us can overcome these turbulent times.

seeker: Any suggestions on things I can do? I feel so overwhelmed
supporter: It may seem pretty bad now with the cold weather setting in at many parts of the world. But there is a vaccine coming soon.

seeker: I really do hope so, it's a glimmer of hope
supporter: Think about the positive aspects of an effective vaccine. Do not stress too much about factors outside your control.

seeker: That's true!! The masks and social distancing are very ehlpful. It's good to feel like i am doing my part.
supporter: I agree. Family is our only an true source of strength. Being away from them can be really hard. But atleast, thanks to technology, they are only a video/phone call away.

seeker: My business has been really busy but i am happy to have the distraction
supporter: Oh that's good to hear! I apologize for the assumption earlier.

seeker: Thank you for all your help today!!!
supporter: I appreciate your feedback! Just hang in there and we shall overcome this :)

seeker: You too !! have a great day.
supporter: Yes, a lot of times! You are not alone in this.

seeker: I need some help with my friend group. I feel they do not like me anymore.
supporter: Ah I understand how you feel. That must not be good. I understand how you feel. Things will be okay. Why do you feel this way?

seeker: I feel this way because they do not want to meet me and are cold to me.
supporter: Ah I understand. I will try to give some advice.

seeker: What should I do?
supporter: I think you should try to talk to them to get to know what is going on. Have open communication.

seeker: What should I say?
supporter: You should tell them how you feel. Tell them what you told me. Friendships are important.

seeker: I have known them for a long time so I want to make sure we stay friends.
supporter: Yes of course, friendships are important. Especially if you have known them for a long time.

seeker: I will try to talk to them. Any other advice?
supporter: Yes, try to be honest with them. It helps a lot.

seeker: Yes honesty is good. I will try to share my feelings.
supporter: You are a good person, sharing feelings is good.

seeker: Thank you for the compliment. I feel a bit better now.
supporter: Great, anyway I can help. I am happy to assist you.

seeker: Thank you so much. I will try your advice.
supporter: I hope everything works out. Anything else I can help with?

seeker: No I think that will do it. Thank you.
supporter: Excellent. Thank you. Goodbye.

seeker: Bye.
supporter: Remember to stay positive. Have a great day.

seeker: Hello, I need some help with this.
supporter: I'm here to help you

seeker: What should I do about my break up?
supporter: When it was happened

seeker: It happened yesterday. She broke up with me.
supporter: Oh.. It's really sad. But don't worry. You can explain feelings to her. She may change her mind

seeker: I will try but I don't think she will want to listen. I do not think she likes me anymore.
supporter: I understand your feelings. If it is a true love, she will also understand your feelings.

seeker: I think I will call her later, I will try to follow your advice. What should I do to help my bad emotions?
supporter: To escape from negative thoughts keep engaging yourself in your favorite work. Listen to your favorite music.

seeker: I feel bad about the whole covid thing. I think there is a lot of stress about it with my ex girlfriend so she feels stressed about that.
supporter: Hello Are you there?

seeker: Hi
supporter: your school doesn't offer remote learning?

seeker: It does, but typically we have study groups in person which I find very helpful
supporter: you can still do that online instead of in person

seeker: My am anxious I will do poorly with out the study groups
supporter: I understand how you may feel that way, it's easy to feel anxious when something you do so frequently  gets taken away

seeker: The school is expensive and I dont want to have to redo a class if I am not passing.  I ended up stopping school last time because Covid started, but its been almost a year, and I feel that I will never finish if I dont go back during spring semester.
supporter: Your worry is very understandable, have you talked to your professors about that to see what they can help?

seeker: I have not because I am not currently enrolled.  I have talked to admissions who said I can wait or restart when ever I wish.
supporter: that sounds great. I find that your mindset is very important, you can only finish great if you feel at ease. Why don't you just wait and study on your own first, and officially start when you feel reassured?

seeker: My only concern on waiting is how long do I wait?  It does not seem like COVID is going away any time soon.  In fact the number of cases in California where I live are rising substancially.  I cant advance in my career if I dont get a degree, so its such a double edged sword!
supporter: How about create an online study group with your friends if you need to get a degree in time. Either Zoom or Skype is user friendly

seeker: Dont you have to pay for those?
supporter: Oh no, you don't even have to install Zoom. I have been in a lot of Zoom conference where I simply access through the link they give me

seeker: well that sounds reassuring.
supporter: yeah, so don't be too pessimistic. There are always solutions. Other than group study, are there any reasons you worry about school?

seeker: Well money of course, but thats what financial aid is for.  My biggest worry was how to collaborate and study in a world where we cant get together
supporter: if you prefer to be able to discuss in person, how about do an in person meeting at the park or open space? That way you can keep your distance

seeker: Thanks for your input, it gives me a different perspective to think about, and would present some options I hadnt thought about.
supporter: No problems, I'm glad I could be some help

seeker: Hi there
supporter: hello! how are you?

seeker: I am good, thanks. I hope you're well also.
supporter: Is there anything bothering you or upsetting you right now?

seeker: Sure, one of the biggest concerns I have right now is the pandemic
supporter: What city are you in?

seeker: I live in Canada on the east coast.
supporter: That must be difficult living in such a big city with the pandemic going on.

seeker: yes of course.
supporter: I've had similar feelings also. People can be very selfish right now. That's normal to feel that way!

seeker:
yeah. Like I am scared of being sick at anytime. It could h
appen anytime.
supporter: It sounds like you're scared of the virus is that right?

seeker: well, I talk with my friend daily on the phone. I also stay sane by staying at home. I work out when I have time, but not so much as before.
supporter: It sounds like you're doing a great job adjusting though! Good for you. Talking with people will help a lot.

seeker: I can only stay safe for so long but it takes cooperation from my citizens and also the leaders here to be responsible in lockdowns etc.
supporter: It's hard when we live in a divided world. Some people want this...and some people want that. I would suggest just letting go of the things not in your control, even though that is hard.

seeker: yeah I will try and I know what you mean
supporter: Do you go to therapy?

seeker: It does feel like I am in an apocalyptic world and self isolated in my safety bunker. And a few months ago, I felt more lonely and claustrophobic. I feel better now. I guess the best and safest place now is my home.
supporter: You do what's best for you, that is what is important. Don't worry about others.

seeker: No, I believe in it and I talk openly with my close friends about issues but have only gone for medical therapy a few times. I will try to have my usual health checkup once the pandemic is more in control, and so then I might consider getting a referral
supporter: Have you heard of teletherapy? I do that and you don't have to worry about leaving your house!

seeker: not that I have an active and huge problem, but that I don't think it's so bad, as mental illness is so stigmatized. You can go for therapy and talk things over even if you don't have that big of a problem.
supporter: Exactly! I totally agree. I love just talking to my therapist. It's so nice just to have someone listen and give feedback that isn't a friend.

seeker: I will once I get some more done for my work at home.
supporter: Therapy is shown to really help so I strongly suggest doing that if you have the time and money. It really will help.

seeker: Yeah I will definitely keep it on my list and won't rule it out
supporter: Yes that is important. I'm sure it is safe there!

seeker: due to the pandemic
supporter: Hopefully this conversation helped with some of your anxiety and stress!

seeker:
Hopefully. And then any mental support can be done via teleheal
th like you said.
supporter: Sounds like a great plan!

seeker: yes it sure does, thanks for listening and I see that we are pretty much on the same page.
supporter: Thank you! I hope you have a nice night.

seeker: i am really very depressed
supporter: Is there a specific incident that caused you to feel this way?

seeker: it was the incident that is break up with my partner.
supporter: When big life changes come, it is natural to feel sad or upset.

seeker: but i feel very stress ful in that suitation
supporter: Since the breakup, have you found a safe place to live?

seeker: i have rented seperately
supporter: Knowing you have a safe place to live is one positive aspect of your life!

seeker: yes i am safe
supporter: I know it is hard right now,  but seeking out others will bring small moments of joy to the day.

seeker: yes ,but hard to over come that problem
supporter: I love to walk too!

seeker: it  is a nice climate too
supporter: Let's focus on accomplishing one small goal for the day.

seeker: i have to divert my mind by focusing my thought from other suitaion only
supporter: Wonderful! I hope you enjoy the fresh air and change of scenery.

seeker: yes really .
supporter: Make the most of your beautiful day!

seeker: yes it is really wonder ful day
supporter: Knowing that you are seeking to have a great day makes me confident that you are going to overcome your challenges and thrive!

seeker: yes i will and have to over come
supporter: Take care!

seeker: you also take care bye
supporter: bye!

seeker: Hi.  I am worried about my exams.
supporter: Exams are a stressful time. What seems to be the problem?

seeker: I do not feel like I am properly prepared, even though I have studied.
supporter: I can assure you that countless students including myself have gone through the trials of studying for exams and do feel overwhelmed but it passes.

seeker: I have studied.  However, I still feel like I am not prepared.  One big problem is that I have no quiet place to study.
supporter: I get it, distractions can be challenging to overcome at times. Have you thought about going to a library, or a book store?

seeker: I have not.  Both of those are great suggestions.  I wonder if I should take the time to walk to the library (30 minutes), or just continue to study?  Maybe, I know as much as I can know.  The anxiety is too much.
supporter: If it helps you study then the library may be worth the time and effort. Sometimes we can stress out over worrying about not having enough time to study. But trust the work you have done and you will know if it is enough.

seeker: This is very good advice.  Have you completed college?
supporter: Yes, and it wasn't easy but with hard work, it is completely doable. And you have the power within yourself.

seeker: What do you think will happen if I fail this test?
supporter: Sometimes it is not about the amount of studying, but the way you study. I like reading my textbooks and highlighting the important parts and then rewriting them so they become ingrained in me. But let us not jump the gun, you haven't failed anything.

seeker: Very true.  Thanks for reminding me.  I think I worry more about the outcome than I need too.
supporter: Don't forget to breathe. Exams are stressful but I would suggest don't cram everything to the last minute. Usually the hour before the exam, I do something else.

seeker: Very good advice.  Any suggestions on what I can do?
supporter: Stay calm, believe in yourself, start your studying early so you are not cramming everything in the last few days.

seeker: Great Advice.
supporter: Walk outside, away from the students waiting for their tests.

seeker: Wonderful suggestion
supporter: Is there anything else I can help you with?

seeker: No.  Thank you.
supporter: Goodnight and good luck.

seeker: Hi.
supporter: im here

seeker: Hi. I'm anxious and a bit depressed.
supporter: what made you feel this way?

seeker: The pressures of Covid and taking care of my disabled sister are just getting to me.
supporter: i see how that could make you a bit anxious. I get the same way also.

seeker: Thanks. I'm just tired of the Covid restrictions. I can't wait for things to get back to normal.
supporter: i feel the same. being on lockdown could make anyone a little crazy

seeker: I do. My other sister is always a big help. Maybe I should text her more often?
supporter: yes! that would always be a good idea. its always comforting to hear from a loved one.

seeker: That's true. I tend to stew on my thoughts.
supporter: hows the weather where you are?

seeker: It's not too bad. Cloudy and 40 which is pretty good for this time of year. How's your weather?
supporter: i live in the south . not cold yet. but your weather sounds like it would be nice for a lovely walk.

seeker: Exercise does always help. I walk/jog five miles every day. I generally feel my best right after that. Don't you find that true too?
supporter: yes! although i probably couldnt walk nor run 5 miles a day. i love getting out to enjoy nature. it always helps to keep mind off things. does that usually work for you?

seeker: Yes, I love nature but I live in a congested suburb. It would take me awhile to get out to the country. That's why Covid is so tough - I can't travel which is my main form of relaxation. What do you do to relax?
supporter: i see, for me to relax. i find sitting back in my recliner reading a nice book always relaxes me. i also love yoga. its a refreshing relaxtion

seeker: I should try yoga. I sometimes do breathing exercises when I get really stressed. Maybe I should go back to it. What do you think?
supporter: actually that would be a good idea. i find yoga and breathing deep help relieve stress & let go of the negative.

seeker: I think I'll try it. Thanks! It was good talking to you. I think we completed the requirements. Have a good Thanksgiving and stay safe out there. Bye!
supporter: you too always :-)

seeker: Hi, not a good time right now. Really concerned
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that . How can I help?

seeker: I just need someone to listen. I want to know everything will be ok
supporter: I understand. Tell me what's going on.

seeker: Since CORONA I have had to quit working my second job and become a full time stay at home parent. This is causing our family a loss of considerable income and with everything going on right now in the world it makes it even more worse.
supporter: I understand. It is a scary time right now. Things will not always be this way though. We will get through it.

seeker: I'd like to think this will be over sooner than later, but it's hard to really think about it. I was a merchandiser for retail stores.
supporter: Yes our country is in a lot of uncertainty right now. And having a second income always helps. Have you considered possibly finding a work from home job? Perhaps look at what skills you've developed, and update your resume to reflect the skills you have that will transfer over to a work from home job.

seeker: I'm always concerned about scams. There are so many untrustworthy places that I hate putting myself and my information out for others to get who aren't honest.
supporter: I understand. There are always companies or jobs out there that are scams. What I found worked best was looking at reputable sites like LinkedIn, GlassDoor, etc. Right now is a good time to find a work from home job from reputable companies. I've found that a lot of companies have transitioned over and developed jobs that can be done from home. I actually work from home myself.

seeker: Oh thats really encouraging. I will definitely look into that.
supporter: Another suggestion I can make is contacting your local workforce department  (department of unemployment) as they can make suggestions too.

seeker: I never thought about the unemployment office. I know so many people are worse off than me that I almost feel guilty to reach out. I really appreciateyour trips
supporter: You already have a lot of skills you didn't think about. As a stay at home parent, you are like the CEO of your own company. You manage day to day operations. You also do scheduling, finance management, etc.

seeker: That's very true!
supporter: I understand feeling guilty for asking for help.  But don't worry that is what they are there for!

seeker: Hi, my work situation is stressful
supporter: Hi, I'm sorry to hear that. What's been happening?

seeker: They barely acknowledge my presence and don't really talk to me except for an occasional hello
supporter: That's not very fair. You deserve to feel valued at your workplace and it sounds like you don't feel that way.

seeker: I know, I don't know why they act this way. is it something I have done. I'm stressed.
supporter: You haven't done anything wrong. I have felt that way at work before too. I went to therapy to deal with my difficult work situation.

seeker: therapy, is it maybe me, or should I bring it up with my boss.
supporter: You could bring it up with your boss. That would be a very brave thing to do.

seeker: I am worried that he would bring it up to my coworkers and I'd feel left in the open. I don't know the best course of action.
supporter: Usually, bosses are required to keep those sorts of things confidential. You could request to speak to someone in Humane Resources, who is trained to help workers.

seeker: I might just do that, although I am worried about escalating above my boss and above my coworkers. Maybe it may best to speak to my coworkers,
supporter: You could speak to your coworkers and let them know that you would like a friendlier, more open work environment. Do you think that might help?

seeker: It might, I don't know what set them off in the first place.
supporter: That might be a good place to start when it comes to approaching them. Let them know your side of the situation and maybe they will understand.

seeker: I think I will. Would you recommend me buying coffee and doughnuts?
supporter: I think buying coffee and doughnuts sounds like a wonderful idea. It seems like you are really willing to help create a healthier work environment.

seeker: yeah for my sanity. Thank you
supporter: Of course. It's been nice to speak with you. I hope everything goes well for you.

seeker: Thank you, goodnight
supporter: Goodnight to you as well!

seeker: I can't believe it I just got layed off.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that. It is a tough time right now for people working. Do you want to talk about it more?

seeker: I know. It's going to be nearly impossible to find something good now.
supporter: I understand that it is frustrating and scary to lose a job. But depending on what field you work in, there are actually quite a few places hiring right now because of the holidays.

seeker: I live in a small town. The mill is pretty much all we have that pays good.
supporter: Do you have access to any areas outside your town that are in driving distance or a bus can reach?

seeker: I have my car. No bus's go through here.
supporter: Well if you have a car, maybe you would be able to find something a little outside your area that would pay more. Try taking a look on indeed.com or even craigslist for open positions. You may be surprised by what you find and a change in career can sometimes be a positive thing

seeker: I just got out of the Air Force. I really need a steady paycheck right now.
supporter: The only way you are going to be able to get a job is by looking what is out there. If you can work retail, it is a great time for that because of the holidays. Even if it is a temp position, at least it is something.

seeker: And the holidays are just about here. This is going to suck.
supporter: It is a difficult time in general for a lot of people. I think most people are going to be understanding this year when it comes to gift giving. I wouldn't worry too much about that and instead focus on what you are able to do about the situation.

seeker: This is the first time in 3 years i will be home for Christmas I was hoping to make for not being here.
supporter: Perhaps think of you just being home as the gift. Having time to spend with your family and friends is likely to mean more than something you can buy.

seeker: My luck we won't be able to leave the house.
supporter: Then make it a great experience in the house. Make decorations and do holiday things. There is a lot people can do this time of year without going outside that is fun and meaningful. Try to be optimistic even in tough times. Sometimes it is all we can do to get by.

seeker: I was thinking about learning how to make my own beer. Two birds one stone.
supporter: Yeah! That is a great idea. I know people that started doing that and ended up opening their own local brewery. You never know what could happen when you try new things!

seeker: That is true.
supporter: I hope I have been a little helpful for you today. It is tough right now but we can get through it.

seeker: Thank you and have a great weekend.
supporter: You as well.

seeker: Hi, how are you?
supporter: Good thanks, so what's troubling you?

seeker: I'm so mad at my boyfriend for not taking any responsibility.  I'm about to break up with him.
supporter: Responsibility in regards to what?  Like in what area of life do you mean?

seeker: We've been dating 4 years, meeting in high school.  Now we're graduated and I've gone to college.  He doesn't have a job yet after 1 year.
supporter: Hmm, has he been looking for work, or just laying around playing video games and shit like that?

seeker: I've been away at college and just came home on break so I'm not sure.  He tells me he is looking but I don't know how it's taking a year to get a job.
supporter: Well, I suppose it's possible that he's been earnestly looking and just not having any luck.  Is he kind of a loser in general, or is he a stand-up guy?

seeker: He got average grades in school but didn't really miss days from school.
supporter: Ok, so it sounds like you're kind of fed up with him in general, and not having a job is maybe just a part of the bigger issue?

seeker: That's probably correct.  He hasn't been in contact with me as much since I left for school.  I just expected more.
supporter: Well,  it sounds like you're both in kind of a transitional period in life.  It's pretty normal for relationships to not necessarily survive through things like this

seeker: That's so sad since we have so many years together, but I feel like I'm moving forward and he is staying in place.
supporter: Yeah, I mean it's never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren't necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time.   Also I think it's important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one.   Just because it didn't last until one of you died doesn't mean it wasn't a success.   I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.

seeker: That's true, it can maybe just be a stepping stone to build other relationships.  Thanks for the wisdom.
supporter: Well I've got a couple decades on you, so I've been through this a few times before.   Actually I'm still friends with pretty much all of my exes.   I mean just because I'm not romantically involved with them anymore doesn't mean that they aren't still terrific people.   Hell, I hung out with two of them just today.

seeker: That's great you have maintained positive relationships and were also able to move  forward.  Thanks for the advice. I appreciate it.
supporter: You bet.   So what do you think you'll do from here?   I mean do you know you want to move on for sure, or do you think you'll see if you can work through this patch?  I don't know that there's a wrong answer .

seeker: hi. my friend told my ex boyfriend he was an idiot for dumping me. it made me feel uncomfortable since i was in the same room. now he is talking to me again. i think he might want me back
supporter: What are your thoughts on the relationship?

seeker: my feelings fluctuate. i resent him that he ended it. it confuses me he still wants to be in my life. he said he wanted to be friends but then asked me out again. i think he is trying to work his way back in. i know i can't keep it up unless he makes it clear he wants to be with me. i don't have time for games
supporter: That does sound hard that he is giving mixed signals.

seeker: yeah i don't like that. neither does my friend. why she told him he is an idiot for letting me go
supporter: Do you think he took your friend's comments seriously?

seeker: yes cuz that's when he wanted me to be around him more
supporter: It sounds like your friend got him thinking.

seeker: it seemed like it did
supporter: Do you feel his change is genuine?

seeker: to a degree. i think he has ulterior motives too.
supporter: What would he have to do to prove himself?

seeker: say he wants me back or something to that effect. i'd like him to be more direct in what he wants from me
supporter: It sounds like it would help if he were direct with you and not sending mixed signals.  Is that correct?

seeker: yes that would be nice. he tends to beat around the bush then lets me know
supporter: Have you talked to anyone else besides your friend about your concerns?  Do you think your family or other friends could give some additional support to you?

seeker: yes i've talked to them about it. they've given me some insight into it. i know they want me to be careful. they don't want me to be hurt
supporter: That's understandable that they want you to be careful.  My parents and friends watched out for me too.

seeker: we are lucky they look out for us. they can't all be wrong if they're guiding us a certain way
supporter: I think you hit the nail on the head that it's helpful to have that support.

seeker: absolutely. i appreciate your help! nity nite
supporter: Thanks.  Can I assist you with anything else?

seeker: nope. im good
supporter: Have a good night.

seeker: Hi there, I badly need someone to talk with!
supporter: hi what’s on your mind today

seeker: My partner left me after fifteen years and I simply do not know what to do.
supporter: wow. that had to come as a shock. when did you find out

seeker: Things had not been going well for a while but I had not realised just how bad it would be.
supporter: i'm so sorry to hear that. how long ago did they leave?

seeker: About two weeks. I have barely left the house since then. I just do not feel that I can go on.
supporter: not leaving the house is the new normal for many of us right now. are you not leaving because you have nowhere to go or because you are feeling bad

seeker: I think mostly the latter. I just do not want to face the world any more . I feel that everyone must know that I've been dumped and be laughing at me.
supporter: you havve already made it two weeks by going one day at a time

seeker: I did not really have any choice though .  I do not see any future for myself now that we are separated.
supporter: do you know brene brown and her work

seeker: No I do not, who is that?
supporter: she studies vuneraility and shame. please look for her TED talk and there's a great youtube video on empathy

supporter: I can tell that you're really struggling.

supporter: After my breakup, I found that the best thing to do was to involve myself in other activities that I enjoyed in order to take my mind off of the negative feelings that I was dealing with.

supporter: You seem very kind! I appreciate your willingness to be here for and to listen to me as well!

seeker: That sounds really smart. I've been trying to do that. Of course with a pandemic going on it's more difficult.

supporter: That sounds like a great idea! I love the fact that it helps you to stay connected, especially considering (as you already mentioned) that it's difficult to connect right now since we're dealing with COVID-19.

seeker: Yeah, and you're right. There's something therapeutic and cathartic about hand writing that typing does not replicate.
supporter: I couldn't agree more. Dealing with COVID on top of everything else has been extremely difficult for me. Honestly, I think it is part of what caused a lot of the issues that I'm currently dealing with.

I've gained weight back that I couldn't really afford to lose to begin with, I've been more motivated, etc. It really was for the best even though the breakup itself was really difficult.

supporter: In my past I have been able to try and look at each  relationship as a chance to grow. To figure out what worked with that person and what didn’t. I have them used this as a tool for the future.

supporter: It’s so important to love yourself. Self love breeds confidence and confidence is not only attractive, but powerful in so many ways

seeker: I chose a past experience so this will be hypothetical. But I'm looking for ideas for other resources for this course since my professor isn't helpful
supporter: I see you are looking for some resources on a course that your professor isn't helping you with.  What kind of questions do you have?

seeker: What other ways can I get help to perform better? Who should I talk to?
supporter: Are you looking for help to perform better in a certain subject in college?

seeker: Yeah I am, it's differential equations. Are you able to see the situation description I wrote that has more details?
supporter: I didn't see all the specifics but I remember taking that class.  I went to my counselor and got a tutor which helped so much.  It was offered for free at the college.  Do you think you that is something you'd like to check out?

seeker: Yeah that could be useful. I'm not sure if my school offers that - the math department isn't very good. I'm an engineering major. I wonder if an engineering professor or student could help instead
supporter: I had a student who was a genius (by my standards) helping me and he was so patient and understanding.  This lessened the pressure and helped me move forward successfully in the class.

seeker: Yeah that would be helpful. I think I need to hear things a different way. The professor is very confusing, but when I have gotten help from other students the concepts don't seem hard. I just don't do well with his teaching style I guess, it's not that I'm not smart enough to understand. Does that make sense?
supporter: Yes, I understand that sometimes being able to interpret things from someone who can communicate well can make the difference in understanding things.

seeker: Yeah, it can be very stressful when I don't understand though. I'm normally a very good student so it's easy to be hard on myself. But it's good to hear that this is a pretty common experience
supporter: Yes, I had a 100% average almost in high school and still struggled with the class.  I kind of wish they videotaped the classes that I could rewind and go back to at the time of college.  When I got to grad school, I ended up being able to audio record sessions and understood things so much better because I could reference the books while listening to a lecture.  That made so much difference.

seeker: Yeah that sounds really nice. One of the hardest things was that the professor would never go back and explain what he did, so a problem might be 20 minutes long and if you got confused 3-4 minutes in you were just lost for the rest of it
supporter: Lots of research also has shown that getting enough sleep is important for performance as well.

seeker: That is actually one thing I'm pretty good at. I'm miserable when I'm tired, so I almost always get 7-8 hours a night.
supporter: It sounds like you are making efforts to do your best to sleep and understand the materials.  You can give yourself a pat on the back for all the great efforts!

seeker: Thanks! It's reassuring to know other people felt the same way with this course. Sometimes I felt like I was dumb or lazy because I didn't understand, but it sounds like it's just challenging and those feelings are normal
supporter: Sometimes you have to give yourself more credit because you are doing a good job.

seeker: Yeah, that has always been hard for me, but I'll try to be deliberate about that
supporter: Do you feel better about the situation?

seeker: I do, thanks!
supporter: Great, I hope you keep encouraged and working hard toward your goals because you deserve the very best with your hard work.

seeker: I am, thank you. I feel good, and I think we have completed the requirements of the study, so I am good with wrapping up our chat now if you are
supporter: Great!  Have a good day.

seeker: Hi there, are you free to talk?
supporter: Hello, how can i help you today?

seeker: I have been feeling terrible about the death of my dad. It would have been his birthday last week and that makes it even worse.
supporter: Oh no... I am sorry to hear that. It must be devastating. Was it an accident, illness or natural old age?

seeker: He was only in his early sixties but he suffered a number of health problems, including early onset dementia.
supporter: That is rough, both for you and him. I know it's meaningless to tell you not to be sad, however, you can think that he's not in a better place

seeker: I presume you mean now and not not ;). Though I simply am not a believer. It just made me think how meaningless life was.
supporter: oh sorry, yyeah I mean now. Life is... fleeting isn't it? I sometimes think it's meaningless too

seeker: I do not really know what to do about my feelings. They are not going away.
supporter: I feel you, coping with losing your loved ones is never easy. In fact, it's confusing when you grieve and even when you recover and move on

seeker: Do you think that people ever really recover from a significant bereavement?
supporter: I don't think people can completely get over that, you just get used to the pain of not having them around

seeker: Whilst it hurts to think about him being dead, I think that it would hurt more if I had totally forgotten about him and did not think about him every day.
supporter: I just need you to know that whatever your feeling is, it's completely normal and you shouldn't feel guilty for having it

seeker: It is just - very hard. I keep thinking about all the times I disagreed with him or did not appreciate him enough and I never got to tell him how much I loved him.
supporter: Your dad wouldn't want to see you grieving everyday either. You should live the way you know he'd love to see

seeker: I know that he did :). I had just not expected to lose him at such a comparatively young age. He did not get to enjoy his retirement!
supporter: That's sad when he spent all his time taking care of the family and yet could not enjoy his free time

seeker: Yes. I think it would have been easier to deal with had he not immediately descended into very bad health as soon as he retired and had had time to have some fun.
supporter: have you considered seeking therapist? We almost never think of that service, but in a lot of case, people actually need help from professionals when grieving

seeker: I can't really afford to have therapy at the moment. Also I know that my dad was just have considered it to be a waste of money - he was very careful with money.
supporter: he seemed to be a great man. Instead of regretting what happened, celebrate how great of a person he was

seeker: That is a really sensible suggestion and it cheers me up to think of it. You have been a really great help to me.
supporter: I'm glad I could be some help for you

seeker: I've lost my job due to COVID and I'm really worried.
supporter: That is so difficult because you lost your job. What are your goals at this point?

seeker: I want to look for a new job, but I'm worried about being out with COVID.
supporter: I see that you are worried because working in an environment while dealing with COVID is scary.

seeker: I don't know where to begin.
supporter: Are you interested or open to looking for a different career path?

seeker: Not particularly but I am open to it.
supporter: I can see that it is stressful looking into another career path, but you have work experience which will help you on that path if you choose that.

seeker: Where do I begin to look for new jobs?
supporter: Often times career centers can help you to find job opportunities or perhaps online college could be an option if you want to further your education.

seeker: Those sound like great ideas some of which I hadn't thought about before.
supporter: I had a college degree but found out my career wasn't working out financially.  Online college became a lifesaver because I could have the flexibility of being at home.  You don't have to be  exposed to COVID when doing online work or college options.

seeker: Yes, that's true.  Maybe that will help me pass the time too when it is so hard to be at home.  I would be working toward a long term goal.
supporter: Some people share their concerns with family members or friends.  Are you open to discussing the problem with others to get some support?

seeker: I think that would be a good idea.
supporter: I think that the support of family can be so helpful especially when in this difficult situation.

seeker: Thank you for the help.  I feel a lot more comfortable thinking about the future.
supporter: I'm glad to hear this.  Is there anything else I can do for you?

seeker: I think that I'm okay now and can move forward in a positive direction.  Thank you.
supporter: You are welcome!

seeker: I have an issue in that coronavirus and all the news is giving me a lot of anxiety. I really don't want to leave the house and start to panic at the thought.
supporter: I totally understand. The pandemic is once in a lifetime event and it has turned all our lives upside down.

seeker: Yes. I watch the news and it's everywhere these days. There seems no end to it.
supporter: Yes, there seems to be some credibility to the claim - the effectiveness of the vaccine. So I would say even though it seems a lot difficult, there is some hope early next year.

seeker: What of his vaccine doesn't work. Even the thought of leaving the house still feels me with worry and I start to feel panicked. It's like my mental Outlook has completely changed.
supporter: I understand your concern. In fact, a lot of people have questioned the effectiveness given how fast it was developed. Are you anxious because you have to provide for your family besides yourself?

seeker: In fact I have been on sick leave from work since it started. My partner is understanding to a point but yes, I'll need to provide once this is all over. I'm starting to think I'll be scared of leaving the house, even when Covid gets managed and we gather back to 'normal'
supporter: I too, have been working from home for the past 9 months. And I am the sole provider for my family. So I understand how frustrating this can be.

seeker: it's great that you can relate. how are you managing those frustrations?
supporter: The key, however, is our mindset and how we approach the problem. If you are afraid about going our during peak hours, you can step outside during non-peak hours. This is just an example. Everybody's situations and preferences vary.

seeker: so you mean maybe leave the house when it's really quiet to begin with? then slowly build on that over time. isn't this called exposure therapy. I think I have read about this
supporter: In essence, I know the factors under my control, and I try to control them and work them in my favour. I make it a point not to worry too much about factors outside my control.

seeker: I suppose it makes no sense to worry about things you can't control. I think from my perspective that's exactly the problem, not having control. I don't know why this has affected me so much?
supporter: Because it's a new situation to most of the world's population! People take time to adjust.

seeker: yes I know about all the guidance and it would help to follow this. I see my friends dealing with it just fine. I wonder what is making it so hard for me? perhaps I'm overthinking it and just worrying about it excessively.
supporter: Ya, that might be the root cause. Talk with your partner and try going out when you and them feel it is safe to do so. Start cautiously, then slowly return to your "normal" outdoor times.

seeker: yeah I think I really need to give that go. if that doesn't work maybe there are some support groups out there?
supporter: I am sure there are, but make sure those groups are social distancing as well. We are all in this together and we can definitely overcome it :)

seeker: So true! also I think I need to stop watching the news and obsessing about this
supporter: Yes. You can distract yourself with music or comedy shows. Or a long lost hobby. After all, one good thing about COVID is, it has put more time on our plates.

seeker: the one thing I do have is time. Thanks for talking through this with me.
supporter: It was nice chatting with you as well. Take care and stay safe

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hi there, how are you doing?

seeker: Ok Kinda, my back is just hurting so bad today.
supporter: So you have an issue with your back, are you experiencing constant pain?

seeker: yes, it is like a real Charlie Horse that just won't stop.
supporter: Have you been doing an activity that has triggered this? Or have you woken up and felt a difference?

seeker: It has been going on for over ten years now. I can't hardly walk and I can't hardly sit still.
supporter: Ok so to confirm you have constant back pain and this has been going on for over 10 years and you just want a solution to mitigate that pain.

seeker: Yes, I have had back surgery, tried Yoga, and chiropractors, and physical therapy. Nothing has worked.
supporter: I know that constant pain is definitely up there with one of the most difficult things a person can deal with. It can also affect your mental health over time but there are solutions out there that can help.

seeker: It is just hard, waking up in the middle of the night with pain and not being able to go back to sleep. It drives me nuts some days and I just stay away from everyone.
supporter: from what I can tell you have tried many Solutions. I can see that you are committed to finding something that can work for you. personally I think it is only a matter of time until you find the right combination for you if you can stay positive.

seeker: I try to hide the pain from my family because the man of the house is suppose to be strong and provide for his family. I have a very loving wife and a set of twin boys that just turned 13. I am blessed in so many ways but I still seem to have to suffer to enjoy it.
supporter: if I'm being honest I can relate to this. I have a young son and a small family myself. I have had problems with my hearing and tinnitus that is manageable at the moment but constant. in feels like nobody understands just how difficult this can be.

seeker: I feel your pain, I have came a long way in managing the pain mentally. I try to block it out and keep my mind busy to not think about it. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.
supporter: ok so I assume you spoken to many medical professionals about this. have you had a diagnosis?

seeker: I have sever spinal stenosis and a deteriorating bone disease. The surgeon said it was worse than he thought and he done all he could. He was afraid to go any deeper because I might not walk again if he did.
supporter: you have clearly been through a really tough time and my heart goes out to you at how well you are dealing with this. you seem like a very positive person and I appreciate how hard this must be a times. you also care great deal for your family and they're helping you to get through this. I think you are strong and can continue being positive!

seeker: Thanks for the words of encouragement. It makes me feel better knowing that people in the real world still care about others and how they feel.
supporter: if I am being completely honest I think you are incredibly strong. Have you seen a pain management specialist that can help you block out pain? also there may be new advances in pain relief so it would be a good idea to keep up with advances in managing pain. You may be able to take part in studies for new developments.

seeker: Sounds great, I will check into it with my doctor. Have a nice day.
supporter: take care it was nice talking to you

seeker: Hi there, I am desperate to get some help for my ongoing depression, is there anything that you can do?
supporter:
Hello, I am certainly gonna try to help! What triggered the depression tonight?
\

seeker: Well, it's not really any worse tonight than it has been for years. I just don't know how to get out of it and I suspect that I might never be able to.
supporter: Not that I'm typically a fan of this, but there are certain justifications and it has its place. Have you sought professional help?

seeker: I have been prescribed some medication by my GP but I cannot really afford professional counselling.
supporter: There are a lot of programs in place to assist those who're in need of psychiatric evaluation and treatment but dont have the financial means to pursue it.

seeker: I am sorry for the delay, I had a personal emergency. What sort of things are you talking about?
supporter: Do you live in the US>?

seeker: No, I am British. There are limited resources available here but not many and there's a waiting list.
supporter: Have you placed your name on the lists?

seeker: The trouble is also that I have tried a variety of medications and none has really been all that helpful.
supporter: Medication isn't always the best solution. I speak from personal experience. Also,  its better to be inching up a list than reluctant to be on it at all.

seeker: Why do you say that medication is not the best idea? I am aware that it is not a panacea but it can help to take the edge off, as it were.
supporter: It absolutely can take that edge off, but often so can many other things, like painting, writing, talking to a friend or a stranger even. I don't mean to suggest you stop any medication without medical advising. I simply mean to say that there are advantageous methods of therapy that dont involve a pill.

seeker: I think that there are some conditions where medication is necessary but I do take your point that there are other things that we can do to alleviate symptom. Maybe it is best to do these things in tandem?
supporter: You're absolutely right that sometimes there is a need for medication. My mother suffers from depression as do I. She has to take Effexor everyday for her condition. I,  however went through COUNTLESS combinations and never found a relief as helpful as when I write and talk to people.

seeker: I also went through a lot of different combinations before ending on on Prozac. I think that different things work for different people. I do not find it very easy to talk to people.
supporter: Have you explored other theraputic avenues to synchronize with the medication?

seeker: No, I am rather way of 'natural' or homeopathic medicine. Are there any kinds that you could recommend?
supporter: You're doing VERY well talking to me! Had you not said anything, I would have assumed that to be the best  choice! But if you're an introvert, then my first suggestion is to journal.

seeker: I do do a lot of that but I would feel too shy to show anyone my journal. Your help has been invaluable though and I do feel more receptive to other forms of treatment now.
supporter: That way you can reflect on what you've written and possibly learn patterns, triggers, moodswings and other information that would help the problem.

seeker: I often do go over things that I've rewritten but there can be long periods where I just feel that I have nothing to say. Thank you so much for your help though, I do feel a lot better! I hope to see you again soon.
supporter: Anytime

seeker: Hello, how are you?
supporter: Hi there! How may I support you?

seeker: Well, I'm really upset with my friends.
supporter: I am so sorry to hear that. Did something happen?

seeker: Yes, they aren't taking COVID seriously.
supporter: Oh that is so hard. I have family that isn't taking COVID seriously as well, and its so frustrating to see. Are you able to talk to them about your concerns?

seeker: Yes but they get angry with me. I don't know how to get through to them,
supporter: Some people express their frustrations in certain ways. Do you think there is another way to communicate with them? It's also okay to stand up for yourself and stand by what you feel is right.

seeker: I really don't know I just haven't been seeing them at all but I see through social media that they have large parties but I do feel left out.
supporter: It sounds like you're finding it hard to balance the isolation you feel during this pandemic, while you know it's the safest option, with the social gatherings your friends are having. Does that sound right?

seeker: That's exactly right.
supporter: that is such a hard position to be in. it sounds like you are doing your best by choosing to be safe and keep your distance.

seeker: I'd like to think so but I wish they would too. It's hard to know what is right.
supporter: I have found that having vitural movie nights, or going on socially distanced walks with my pals has been so helpful with staying connected. Is this something you think your friends would be willing to try?

seeker: Yes, but they'll have their BBQs and parties anyway. They are having a group Thanksgiving and there will be a lot of people there. My husband and I feel bad that we aren't going, but we also know it isn't smart.
supporter: I think a lot of people are going by the notion that you can't live your life in fear, and that they're going to have these big family gathering regardless of what is happening with COVID. The stats have shown that after holidays the cases have surged, for example, memorial day, 4th of July, labor day. But I think its important to remember the bigger picture that peoples lives are literally at stake and the people that disregard need to be more aware.

seeker: We feel like after this is all over, they will still remind us that we were standoffish during this time.
supporter: Can you tell them that that just isn't the case? You and your husband are making the right choice by staying home for the safety of yourselves and others. If I am correct, it has nothing to do with the fact that you don't want to see your pals and family!

seeker: Yes that's totally accurate.
supporter: I hope your friends can see how important they are to you and thats a huge reason why you're not seeing them.

seeker: I think they do. They just think that this is a hoax.
supporter: I know a lot of people that think the same thing. I have one friend who thought that, and they ended up contracting COVID. Thankfully she was ok, but after she got it she definitely didn't think it was a hoax anymore. I hope they understand the risk they are taking.

seeker: That's scary.
supporter: I am proud of the choices you are making and I hope you can take some comfort in knowing that you are doing your part in helping keep things under control. There is a strength in numbers and the more people who understand that the faster it can be controlled.

seeker: Thank you. I hope it gets better. But anyway thank you for giving me the chance to open up.
supporter: Yes of course, I hope this was helpful. You are doing the best you can and take pride in knowing that. :)

seeker: I'm disgusted with my professors that they don't see me as a human with real emotions and feelings.
supporter: I understand that you are feeling like your professors don't see you as a person with feelings. What happened to make you feel this way?

seeker: I have testing all the time and study non-stop, but the professors don't seem to encourage or support me.  They just see me as a number I feel.
supporter: That's hard to feel like they are treating you like a number when you are working so hard.  Have you talked to them about it?

seeker: It's hard to trust them when I'm seen as 1 of 100 people.  If I am struggling they don't flinch or ask me how they can assist.  I just am expected to
supporter: I had a similar experience in my college days. It was very difficult to have so much pressure to succeed and feel so alone.  You can do though because you are working hard and want to succeed.

seeker: Thanks for the encouragement.  Where do I start to help myself feel better?
supporter: I see you are anxious about this when talking to you, but have you thought about getting some support from other students in your position?

seeker: That sounds like a good idea.  Maybe they are feeling this way too.
supporter: Also sometimes just stepping back and taking some deep breaths can help to alleviate some anxieties. Have you tried that ever?

seeker: I will have to give that a try.  I've done that in the past and had forgotten just how much that helped me before.
supporter: That is reassuring that it worked before for you and  can work again.

seeker: I'm so worried about failing because I just don't feel the support from my professors to care either way for my successes.  It's so different from high school and home when my parents encouraged me and supported me full-heartedly.
supporter: College can be quite a change from the protective atmosphere of home.  Have you tried any support groups or religious groups for encouragement?

seeker: I am religious so perhaps I could seek a group out and they could help with encouraging me.
supporter: I was a  part of a religious group in college and they were very supportive even praying for me on exam days.  I felt they helped me with my success by planting seeds of positive feedback to me.

seeker: I used to be part of one during high school years, and that sounds like it would help.
supporter: Are you starting to feel better about the situation?

seeker: Yes, I do thinking about other people filling in the gaps and supporting me when others won't or can't. Thanks for chatting.  This was helpful.
supporter: You are welcome.  I wish you well.

seeker: Hi there, I am currently going through a kind of job crisis and I'm not sure how to move forward.
supporter: I can totally understand how frustrating a job search can be. I was recently in the job market as well, as my contract was not extended due to budget reasons!

seeker: I actually have a job, but I made a mistake and I think I could get in trouble and I'm not sure how to approach my manager about the mistake I made.
supporter: Ok, apologies for my earlier assumption! May I please know more details about the nature of your problem?

seeker: Thats ok! We had been given a deadline for end of day this upcoming monday to have a number of projects completed. Some projects take only part of day to complete while others take multiple. I made the mistake of prioritizing the ones that take less time to be sure I was able to get as many done as possible. I in turn, forgot to start the other projects that take a couple of days until friday (yesterday) so now these couple of projects wont be done by the deadline.
supporter: Ok, if I understand correctly, you prioritized some work to be done later, which unfortunately had an earlier deadline, is that correct?

seeker: Yes essentially. They all had to be done the same day, but I prioritized the work that took less time in order to get more of them completed. So now these ones that take longer (with the same deadline) wont be finished in time.
supporter: We all make mistakes, don't we? Don't worry too much about it. Just be honest to your manager regarding what transpired.

seeker: We do, and its my first mistake in the 8 months I've been working here.
supporter: I am sure it's a honest mistake and let your manager know that you will be better at time management and prioritization moving forward.

seeker: Oh thank you thats kind of you to say.
supporter: You tell him that this has been a valuable lesson and you have learned a lot from it. And that this mistake would not happen again.

seeker: you are so right!!
supporter: I have been in similar situation a lot. All the best :)

seeker: Thank you again, have a great evening :)
supporter: You're welcome. Take care!

seeker: Hi there, could you please give me some advice?
supporter: Hello, would you like to explain your situation and we can go through  it together

seeker: I feel that I am blowing my future because I am just not scoring well on tests these days. I just don't feel motivated to work as hard as I know that I should.
supporter: So you don't feel motivated and you are not scoring well, have I understood that correctly?

seeker: Yes. I know that the two things are probably related but I just do not know what to do about them.
supporter: What are you currently studying?

seeker: I am studying microbiology. I do not know that I have the passion for it that I once did though.
supporter: Your motivation and how you are studying is probably related, you are right. What attracted you to microbiology in the first place?

seeker: I have always found it fascinating and have an uncle who is a microbiologist. But these days I feel I made the wrong decision. Is it too late to change?
supporter: It is never too late to change anything. However, i hear that you have always found it fascinating,have you considered talking to your uncle and seeing if you can find what you loved about it again?

seeker: Yes that does sound like good advice. I do not want to turn by back on my studies of the past years. But my grades are really poor and I am not sure what to do about that.
supporter: Studying can be really difficult , especially when you are half way through. i struggled in my studies and found that talking to my tutors helped and approaching student support. Have you tried anything like that or has your motivation held you back?

seeker: To be honest I have been a little afraid to approach them about the subject because they might accuse me of just slacking. I know it might look like that from the outside.
supporter: Just from chatting to you, I can sense that you are anxious, however, as many students feel this way, they will have a whole lot of help they can provide.

seeker: I do feel that part of my problem is that I am afraid to really open up about it. You are the first person I have really felt able to talk to.
supporter: I am pleased that you have been able to open up to me, it is the first step towards you finding your path. Do you find it easy to write things down?

seeker: Yes, it is really much more easy to write my problems down than to actually talk to people about them face to face.
supporter: One suggestion is for you to write down all the reasons that you love microbiology. It can be any format, I love a bubble chart (mind map), it could be in list form or just doodles, would this be something you would find useful?

seeker: Yes, that is a fantastic idea! Maybe I can find a renewed interest in the subject. I hope that I can because I really do not want my time studying to have been wasted.
supporter: It would be a really good place to start. Then you could be really kind to yourself and take some pressure off. Would you like to talk through some ideas to help with the work itself?

seeker: Yes I really would. I already feel more motivated! Half an hour ago I felt that I had no place left to go and felt defeated.
supporter: That's really good, sometimes it is about finding a direction and small steps. Often when we are studying the work seems really big, especially essay questions. One thing that helped me was to break it into really small chunks, sometimes physically covering up some of the question. Would that be something that would help?

seeker: I have not really tried it but I ought to. I often feel that I am just overwhelmed. Then I know that I got something wrong for definite and I just want to give up.
supporter: It could be something you can try, remember , it is not always about ought to, simply how can I make it easier for myself. It is okay to get things wrong too. If you decide to write your list of reasons why you love microbiology, maybe you could keep it in a place you see every day, a mirror or fridge and keep seeing where you are trying to get to.

seeker: I have already started making a mental list and feel much more optimistic. Thank you very much for your conversation and your help, it has been very valuable to me!
supporter: You are more than welcome and it has been lovely chatting to you. Is there anything else you would like to talk through?

seeker: feeling really stressed out and exhausted trying to find a job in a small town
supporter: I understand how frustrating it can be, especially with COVID turning our world upside down!

seeker: yea that has really put a damper on a lot of my job searches. currently im in the medical field. i serve as an in home health care provider. but that is only part time.
supporter: First fall, I tip my hat to you! It is because of people like you, our frontline heroes, that we are at least able to put some fight up against the corona demon!

seeker: thank you for that. i just wish i either had more hours or made more at a time. working part time just isnt cutting it.
supporter: I understand. Part time or reduced hours can be a source of concern.

seeker: and i desperately need to move out of the situation that i am in. but cant do it with my current level of income.
supporter: We just need to trust them to bring the vaccine to the public. I hope in due time they will publish their detailed research and development papers.

seeker: in the town where i live there are no services like uber eats or door dash.
supporter: Ok. I suppose you can try online jobs. One of my friends lives outside the city and is a part time online order taker for Pizza Hut.

seeker: online order taker? how do you sign up for that?
supporter: Great! You can search for "Pizza Hut online order taking job". The first result will lead you to the company that manages these jobs.

seeker: highly possible, have a phone and a high speed internet connection.
supporter: Once you complete training, the pay is good especially during weekends, where peak load hits.

seeker: thank you. i had not even heard of this. i will apply in a min when we are done talking. i apprecieate it.
supporter: I am glad I could be of help. I wish you all the best!

seeker: Hello i am okay
supporter: I'm well. What's going on?

seeker:
I just wanted to talk about my
 recent heartbreak
supporter: What happened?

seeker: My boyfriend cheat on me with my close friend
supporter: OMGoodness! That's awful. I've been through the same.

seeker:
but typical men, they would still disrespect you 
with anyone in skirts
supporter: Unfortunately men have earned a reputation as jerks for that reason.

seeker: Its crazy
supporter: Good for you! I know that it must've been painful, but I don't think anyone deserves to go through it on repeat...

seeker: really though.. was a stressful time
supporter: Well,  they probably deserve an equal percentage of that anger...

seeker: after being caught slipping, he tried to lie his way out of it
supporter:
However,  YOU deserve to have the freedom of choosing to forgive and forget them both. The resentment that's building inside you is just like a poiso\
n that YOU'RE drinking in hopes that THEY get sick from it.

seeker: Im moving on. I have refused to let that define me or my moods
supporter: Revenge is a dish best served  to the trash! There's no relief in bitterness. Might as well let it go, move on an move up from there!

seeker: right on that
supporter: I think you're handling the whole thing well. You're very intelligent and emotionally mature. It's his own dumb loss and hers too!

seeker: right about that
supporter:
Ha! well said about revenge
\

seeker: yes yes
supporter: Certainly he's just a punk and probably has some underlying issues that he needs to deal with. Her too, really! Punk and all lol, But you? You're strong, resilient and capable! You have a great grip on this whole adulting thing here, and its admirable how well you've handles the ordeal

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hello, how are you today?

seeker: My friend has passed away and I'm having a hard time dealing with it at the moment.
supporter: I'm so sorry to hear that. I've had a close friend pass away years ago, and I understand it is a hard thing to deal with.

seeker: Yes we were close, the funeral was a few weeks ago. I miss him
supporter: Do you have other friends there for you to help you through this tough time?

seeker: Yes I do have a few friends, actually we have some friends in common but I don't want to burden them with my sadness. Maybe I'm being soft?
supporter: I doubt if they would see you as being soft. Maybe your mutual friends would like someone to talk to as well? You could perhaps share some stories about your friend and cheer each other up.

seeker: I think it would help to think of the good times yes. the only problem is this could leave me feeling a lot more sad. I know my friends miss him too so maybe we could link up?
supporter: That's a great idea. You could help each other and celebrate his life, keeping his memory alive.

seeker: I was thinking of starting a Facebook page but I know that trolls can Target those.
supporter: That's a great idea. Maybe have a Memorial Service in his name at a place he frequented often, this way, no trolls and all the people who knew him could share their personal stories about him.

seeker: yeah that's not a bad idea. also may be speaking to somebody about it might help, I'm just reluctant at the moment as I don't want to appear weak.

supporter: Have you talked with your friends on how you feel? When was the last time you all connected?

supporter: I understand it is tough to bring up what is bothering you, especially after getting to hang out with all your friend over coffee. I'm sure this was not intentional with not inviting you to the club.

seeker: Sometimes in the past I have turned down invitations to go out clubbing, admittedly. Could it be that they just did not think that I wanted to go?
supporter: From what I have experienced personally, I am not a fan of clubs and didnt want to go with my friends. After turning them down a few times, they stopped inviting as well. I think they thought that was not my thing.

seeker: The thing is though that this is not the only thing - they have been to rock concerts without me too. I just feel I am no longer a part of the group.
supporter: I feel how this is hurting you. The best thing would be to talk to them about feeling disinvited to group activities. Let them know you are still free and really want to spend some time together. Do you think you can open up to them on whats bothering you?

seeker: I don't know. I don't want to come across as just being paranoid or whiny. Sometimes I think it would be better to just forget them and not have any friends.
supporter: It sounds like this situation is really bothering you. Its hard and overwhelming to feel isolated. The bonds of friendship are worth the confrontation. If they don't know what is bothering you, it will be harder to mend the relationship.

seeker: It is making me really depressed and is badly damaging my sense of self worth. I feel as though I am not worth anyone's time.
supporter: You are worth every precious second of time and should not let this diminish your self worth. Find common ground, an activity you all enjoy and invite them to hang with you.

seeker: Thank you that is helpful. What if I reach out and they all snub me though?
supporter: We all have busy hectic lives at time. True friends make time to be with one another. This world is full of beautiful people to bond with. Keeping a closed circle of friends is a blessing.

seeker: It's not really so much that my life is hectic. On the contrary, sometimes it feels as though it is rather empty and not having the support of friends does not help with that.
supporter: I hear how this is making you sad not feeling supported in the way that you need to be. Know that you are worthy and will find a way to connect with them. I hope this has helped.

supporter: If I were you I would not wait! It may not be the best option for your learning style, and it will certainly prove a greater challenge. However, taking on that challenge will bring on SWEETER rewards when you succeed! Adopt a "Can-Do" state of mind and grab the bull by the horns!

do you have a friend who has been through a similar situation? sometime that helps.

supporter: Hello how are you feeling today?

supporter: I am very sorry to hear that. Breakups can be rough. I'm great! Thanks for asking. Was this a mutual agreement?

seeker: Well technically it was a mutual agreement but i feel like I dont want this to happen
supporter: Was there a reasoning behind your decision? Sometimes we let our anger and emotions make our decisions for us.

supporter: I see trust is a very important key factor in relationships and without it the relationship stays stagnant. Have you tried reassuring her that your intentions are pure and maybe gave her some words of affirmation that would let her know how you truly feel about her? Just because you guys are best friends all she sees in her head is that you're talking to another female. Maybe she also has her wall up and some insecurities that you can help her with.

seeker: I tried in many way to help her with that and proving her that my feelings toward her was pure. I basically stop talking to my best friend to gain her confidence. But it did not work
supporter: How long have you two been together? Sometimes moving on from a relationship and staying single from some time can give you time to reflect and work on yourself for yourself. You never know the two of you might come back together stronger than before cause space might be all that your relationship needs at this moment.

seeker: We were together for two years
supporter: You're doing the right thing by talking to someone about it. We are not meant to be alone in our thoughts because it can be a scary thing. Bottling up emotions is also never good so for you to reach out is very good and the first step to maybe feeling a little better. I've been in your same shoes and trust me it doesn't feel good so just know I am here for you and you can talk to me in confidence.

seeker: Well thank so much. You really help me a lot with every single word
supporter: Absolutely! You have an amazing day and keep you head up!

seeker: Hello there, would you be able to give me some advice?
supporter: I would be glad to. What is troubling you?

seeker: I have run out of coping mechanisms!
supporter: I completely understand and had similar experiences. What were some ways you tried to interact with people last shut down?

seeker: I use facebook quite a lot and it helps but it cannot compensate for face to face contact. I really need to be able to see people.
supporter: Digital contact does have its limitations. Could you meet with people outside at a distance?

seeker: Well, part of the problem with that is that I am not sure what the rules are any more! We have been told so many different things that I am out of the loop.
supporter: I understand. Try sticking to the basics to make it less stressful. Wear a mask outside at a distance.

seeker: I always do wear a mask.. I think we legally have to :). I really miss little things like going out for coffee or to the gym though. It makes me feel like will never be the same again.
supporter: Have to talked about this with friends? They may be feeling the same way. Just talking this out with the may be reassuring.
