supporter: Or constantly terrified.

seeker: How do you comfort yourself that it's not that bad?
supporter: Well, I don't try to deny the seriousness of the situation at all.  But I do try to keep myself and my family healthy, physically and mentally, and maintain my close friendships via text/video.

seeker: Thanks for your insights. It is helpful to talk it out.
supporter: And I schedule my day, even though I'm working and going to school from home.  I schedule breaks to go out and enjoy the fresh air, dance like an idiot to some music, play with my dogs, or whatever is refreshing.

seeker: Now is the time to focus and be disciplined.
supporter: A routine has been really really helpful.  I also make sure to get plenty of sunshine.  As the winter comes in, we have shorter days and it feels suffocating.

seeker: Yes, the short days are a major depressant
supporter: That must be frustrating.  I've learned there are just some people I can't trust with my vulnerabilities.

seeker: I may overtrust
supporter: But again, you cannot control how they react, you can only control yourself.  And that's not to say you can turn off your emotions or anything, but once you let go of the idea that you can control someone else to your liking, you will feel better.  Less out of control.  Because that's a lot of what is disturbing about the pandemic.  We have zero control over it.

Usually for me, that means moving to the living room, or to the back porch. As silly as that sounds, it really helps to switch up where you are trying to get things done.

between that and creation, i love to express myself. art, mov
ement, building something.....its all just me expressing myself, getting my head into the world

supporter: I am so sorry to hear that. breakups are definitely hard to go through, especially in the times we are in right now.

seeker: We were together for almost 5 years and we were living together he had all the money in his name and I have nothing now
supporter: Oh I see that was a very long relationship! I actually just got out of a 3 1/2 year one myself, so I understand how hard it is. Are you still currently staying with him until you find your own place? Or are you staying somewhere else?

seeker: I am currently trying to find a way to get to my mom who lives about 150 miles away. Im staying with my friend for now but she said I can only stay for 2 more days
supporter: I'm glad to hear that you are with a friend right now during this hard time, and that you have a place to go! But I see the struggle is finding a way to get there.

seeker: Yeah she is a good friend im happy that I can stay with her for the time being its just stressful trying to get to my mom
supporter: If you are struggling on finding a way back to your moms house, it might be a good idea to loan or borrow some money from either friends or family, or open a credit card just for the time being. Then once you get back to your mom's, you can start focusing on yourself and get yourself back on your feet! IT's important to not overwhelm yourself right now, so focus on one thing at a time

seeker: Yeah I definitely agree. I am waiting to hear back from capitalone about getting approved for a credit card and my friend said she can loan me 70$ but the bus ticket to my mom is 150$ so I'm almost to my goal I'm working on it though.
supporter: That is great to hear! I know that you are probably also hurting from the breakup itself too, but I'm glad to hear that you are focusing on getting yourself to a safe place first. It's going to take a long time to fully heal again, but as long as you make sure you are stable, you will be able to get through this

seeker: Yeah thanks I appreciate that. I feel a lot better I hope you have an awesome day!
supporter: Yeah that's great. I have confidence that you will get over this bump in your life, and good things will come to you. Keep focusing on what you need to do! You are doing great!

By surviving, it is more of a personal situation
 or an outside dilemma affecting you.

supporter: I see what you mean. Finding work in this environment can be stressful as well. In any case, I can say that a good way to start is to account for all transactions you make.

supporter: Are you also pressed for time? Time management can be a predicament as well.

supporter: Wow, it's slightly uncanny the way our situations are similar. For someone who is also not in the best place financially and just making the bare minimum, it can feel hopeless sometimes.

seeker: I get to a point in my day where it feels like I've done everything I can for that day, and then I just have to try not to get too stir crazy.
supporter: I feel that if you can focus on using your extra time as an investment into yourself (whether by reading, picking up a hobby, or working out), you can feel more accomplished and at ease with what you are doing in life.

seeker: I've been trying to look ahead, but this year has already set me back so much from my intended career path that it's frustrating. I just want my life back.

supporter: And if these "improvements" can also make you money/increase your worth/ease your mind, then that can be called a success. In my opinion atleast.

seeker: I wish someone was interested in buying my art! That would be a huge confidence boost
supporter: Yeah, but imagine how it would if you had days like that knowing it isn't a bad thing to relax. You have already put in the work in being comfortable before, allowing to enjoy your time however way you wanted.

seeker: yes, I miss being able to actually relax. When you are financially behind it feels like everything is just making it worse.
supporter: Yes, the tension and pressure only seems to mount on, but there will always be things like that in life. It is important to remember whether such problems are in your control or not. If they are, you know for sure that you can change how you are presently.

seeker: Hi, I have been feeling a bit down lately. My levels of stress and concern have been higher since the pandemic began.
supporter: Sorry you have been feeling down. What are some strategies you have tried to help you cope?

seeker: Well, I have tried to get my mind off of it by activities at home. Spending time with my family.
supporter: Those sound like positive ways of handling stress. It is natural of course to feel stressed out by the pandemic so it can be useful to think of ways to help manage that stress.

seeker: Yes, but I still seem to struggle with feeling a bit more down than I'd like. Not sure what to do.
supporter: Have you tried meditation and/or deep breathing exercises? I know I find that helpful when I am worrying.

seeker: I have tried meditation before, but quite a bit back. Do you have any activities you could recommend, without risking my health? Maybe in my own home, so that I can social distance.
supporter: One exercise I find helpful is lying on my back with a pillow under my head. I keep my legs bent and put a pillow under my knees for support. I then put one hand on my chest and one on my diaphram and slowly breathe through my nose feeling my stomach press against my hand. I then exhale slowly through my nose and repeat for about 10 minutes. It can be very calming.

seeker: Okay, I will give that a try. I don't feel I'm at a level that I need therapy or medication, so this might be a good way to calm my nerves when I am feeling apprehensive or stressed out.
supporter: Good, I hope that helps. I would also trying to reach out to others who are experiencing the same. It is harder nowadays with covid but there are many online groups. You could even start your own group!

seeker: Yes, I do find that there are times when I am on a social media outlet that it does seem to make me feel better. I can feel humor. But, it can be a bit depressing too. Maybe I should block the ones that have mostly negative posts?
supporter: I hear you on that. Sometimes social media can also be negative. I think that blocking negative posts is a great idea. It is a way of taking control

seeker: I wished I had some more ideas on some fun, interesting or things to fill my time at home. I often feel I get in a bit of a rut with the same thing. Since we are home more now.
supporter: Are there any hobbies that you have been interested in but never had the time for? Or perhaps hobbies that you used to do but have not tried in awhile?

seeker: Well, I used to read quite a bit more, but I have slowed down on it. Maybe I should go and grab a few books. Thanks for the idea!
supporter: You are quite welcome. I too find reading to be a most welcome escape. It takes one's mind off of day to day worries.

seeker: Yes, let's us escape to another world. I'm glad you got my mind on that. I feel better!
supporter: Perhaps you could look into book groups as well. There are probably quite a few online these days. Glad I could be helpful!

seeker: I will do that! Thanks again.
supporter: You are welcome. I am glad I could help you find some ways to help manage stress levels. Is there anything else you want to talk about?

seeker: Hi good afternoon, I am seeking support for my anxiety related to my job
supporter: Hey there, please do share! I would love to help!

seeker: Wonderful! My job is causing me some stress and anxiety. Everything is usually good except for my one coworker who tries to boss me around. She is very unhelpful and hypocritical
supporter: I see, so you have difficulty dealing with a co-worker. Let ask, Is there anyway of talking to her about her behavior? Also does she behave this way with others?

seeker: Yes, I believe she has an aggressive personality and there wouldn't be much of a difference in the way she acts or speaks to others. She never listens
supporter: What I do recommend is contacting a mediator or someone from HR and having a sit down. Since clearly this is affecting you at work and outside of it. Talking to HR should help.

seeker: That is a good recommendation, I have tried to relax and relieve stress in other outlets and not let it get to me or take it personally
supporter: Honestly don't let it stress you out, don't bring issues at work back home. I also recommend finding ways to destress, listening to music, lightning candles or starting a series on netflix.

seeker: Thats true, it is good to put it in that perspective and to have another opinion on the subject
supporter: Glad to help!

seeker: Thank you very much!
supporter: No problem, I hope enjoy the rest of your day!

seeker: Thank you and same to you. I appreciate your support!
supporter: Personally, I spend time with family. Then I have a can of seltzer, watch something on netflix and unwind.

seeker: Netflix and seltzer have solved many of my problems
supporter: Haha it's a winning combination. Maybe a salty snack or something sweet depending how stressful the day was.

seeker: Hello.
supporter: Hello! How are you doing today?

seeker: I'm not doing very well unfortunately.
supporter: I am so sorry to hear that, I'd love to understand more about what you are struggling with?

seeker: I'm almost near gradution too.
supporter: Oh no! I am so sorry to hear that. Academic probation does seem very scary. When did you learn you failed your finals?

seeker: I learned yesterday. Because of the pandemic the semester is shorter.
supporter: And how long do you have until graduation?

seeker: I should be graduating in June.
supporter: I see. Well it's nice that we matched up! I actually work at a college and now a couple good strategies to get off academic probation, and or avoid it! What is it you are studying?

seeker: You're a great resource then! I am majoring in Psychology with a minor in Biology.
supporter: Oh that is awesome! So when do you find out whether or not you are on probation?

seeker: Likely in the next week.
supporter: Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can't overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health

seeker: That's great advice and likely would be my best option.
supporter: From talking with you so far, I can tell that you are stressed about this. But I want to reassure you that your mental health should always come first. It is the most important thing you can do.

seeker: Yes I am very stressed. I hate taking online courses and this pandemic is wearing me out.
supporter: You are definitely not a failure in the slightest! In fact, I would argue that you are the exact opposite of that. Being able to take such difficult courses in a pandemic, and raise a child shows how strong you are!

seeker: Thank you for saying that. It is tough, but I just want to finally finish my Bachelor's and do something positive.
supporter: And you will succeed in that goal. You have the motivation and the care for it, you just need to focus on managing everything at once!

seeker: hello
supporter: Hi there.  How's it going?

seeker: It's going okay. I'm just pretty worried about things.
supporter: What's going on?

seeker: I'm going through a divorce and it's just a lot to deal with.
supporter: Divorce is tough.  Have been through it myself. Especially tough, I would imagine, in these times.

seeker: Yes, it is especially hard because I live far away from all of my family and I am unable to visit with them.
supporter: Do you have any support in the area you live in?

seeker: No, I do not really have any support in the area I live.
supporter: I'm glad you reached out.  Having support is something we all need.  Zoom and being far away isn't the ideal support I'm sure.

seeker: Yes, it's not ideal, but it is nice to have support even if it is over the phone, Zoom, etc.
supporter: Most definitely.  I'm far away from my family too so Zoom and phone calls have been great despite the long distance.  Have you visited your family since Covid began?

seeker: I was able to visit them once over the Summer, which was great!
supporter: That's awesome!  I'm planning on going to visit mine next Summer.  Are you able to see them before years end?  If not, maybe early next year? Hopefully Covid will be just a memory.

seeker: I probably won't be able to visit them this year. But, hopefully things will calm down and I can visit them early next year some time!
supporter: What state do they live in?

supporter: Are you wanting to move back there?

seeker: Hi, I'm just wanting to talk about my sadness that happens every now and then. Sometimes at night, (and only at night) I get in these super depressive moods and have almost mental breakdowns about everything in my life. But it doesn't happen all the time... only sometime and I don't know why
supporter: That sounds like a really difficult situation to be in, I'm sorry to hear you're going through that.

seeker: Yeah it is, and I'm not sure why it happens
supporter: Especially when the sun starts going down sooner, it can seem like we have less time, and as if things are closing in upon us.

seeker: Yeah exactly. Where I live, we just had daylight savings so it gets dark around 5:30 PM and it feels like my days are just wasted
supporter: There are a few strategies you could use to combat that.  Personally, I try to soak in as much sunlight as possible before it goes down.  Sometimes that will mean moving your work space, maybe getting up earlier to have a cup of coffee in the sunrise, maybe it's scheduling breaks into your day where you specifically get some vitamin D.

seeker: Yeah that is good advice. I definitely need to work on getting myself up earlier in the mornings, I've just come so accustomed to my current sleep schedule.
supporter: That's an understandable fear.

seeker: Wow yeah I didn't even really think about that... And I'm sure there are ways to get in contact with therapists without having to be face to face? I just like the anonymous aspect of it. I feel like I come across as weak if people see me for me
supporter: Yes, BetterHelp is one of those I believe

seeker: Yeah that's true I have heard of BetterHelp. Maybe I should reach out on one of those platforms when  I feel like I am going into one of my depressive episodes.
supporter: It may be helpful!  As far as I understand it's exceptionally easy to switch between therapists on that service, too.  So if the first one is not a good fit, you can try someone else.

seeker: Oh yeah! That's true! I will try it. And also try to incorporate a better sleep schedule. And that is very helpful thank you. I do live in a small apartment, but I have noticed that when I get out of bed and at least move to the couch, it is a different environment even though it wouldn't seem like it. I never thought how that would help me though. I will totally do it more often when I am slumping
supporter: You sound optimistic and like you're open to trying new things to help, I think you're going to start feeling better soon.

seeker: Yeah I definitely want to try what I can! And that is awesome haha the vacation bed! Love it
supporter: Things may take some time, but every time you take action to get better, it will help.  You are very welcome!

supporter: hello there, beautiful day isn't it?

supporter: I know it is sooo hard. My mom lives so far away and I can't see her too because of COVID. the only thing that makes me feel a little bit better is that am not putting her at harm's way when I visit her

seeker: I have two boys and we used to see her at least once a week sometimes more
supporter: How are your boys feeling about it?

supporter: To be fair Roblox is pretty fun. Have you seen those videos on Facebook where family members visit their families from behind the window? What do you think your husband will think about that?

seeker: I need help
supporter: I'm so sorry, the alert sound did not play for me.

seeker: yes, she cheated on me
supporter: That is really hard.  Are you able to take some downtime and recalibrate, take care of yourself?

seeker: Yes, I am going to my mothers house to talk things over.
supporter: Oh dear, that's a long time alone with your thoughts.

seeker: yes, I know.  family is always important during time like these
supporter: That's really good that you have that kind of relationship with your mom though!  Moms are awesome for that kind of stuff.  They can really make you feel protected and safe.

seeker: yes, i can always count on her to be there for me
supporter: That's awesome.  Family support is crucial.

seeker: i guess i'll go make myself a drink
supporter: Just be easy on yourself and know that in the future, you will find someone new, someone much more suited to you.

seeker: yea, its hard because ive dated her for over 5 years
supporter: I'm sorry you're going through this.  I wish I could have been more helpful.

seeker: youve been a great help
supporter: It's very good that you have a support system though!  And that you have people out there waiting for you.  I hope you have a safe drive.

seeker: I have a friend who is an alcoholic and just can't seem to quit drinking.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that, that is a rough situation to be dealing with.

seeker: It is. I care for them a great deal and do not like to see them this way.
supporter: It's difficult for those close to an alcoholic to watch them destroy themselves.

seeker: He is a wonderful person when he isn't drinking, but is argumentative when they drink
supporter: You may need to take some time away from the friendship then.  To show him you are serious that you can't tolerate the behavior any longer.

seeker: I get that, but I am the person closest to him and he needs my support
supporter: That's understandable.  But if you continue trying the same solution over and over again, but are getting the same result...

seeker: true, but I do not think that not being here would help. it would only hurt him
supporter: In that case, you should be sure to shore up your defenses and be prepared, because it will be hard.  You are a good friend, but don't lose yourself to save him.

seeker: That is a good idea. I do worry that he would be upset if I shared this with others he might know
supporter: You should be able to find online Al-Anon groups, too.

seeker: I had not thought of that. I thought you had to go to the meetings and that would be hard for me to do.
supporter: It looks like they do offer online chats: http://al-anon.org/al-anon-meetings

seeker: And thank you for saying that I have things to give, I forget about myself in this sometimes
supporter: So much like this chat here, you wouldn't even have to give your real name, nothing identifying, just support for you.  Supporting an alcohol is exhausting, and you will need resources.

seeker: That is sooo true! Sometimes I just cry because I do not know what to do anymore.
supporter: Try not to demonize your own frustrations, be easy on yourself when it comes to feeling upset with the situation, and continue trying to let him know that he hurts you when he behaves like that.

seeker: Having a person to let me know I am not alone and give some support would be very helpful!
supporter: Absolutely :-)  I hope that it helps.  You sound like a very kind-hearted person, and I understand that your situation is complex.

seeker: And thank you for reminding me that I matter too!  It helps very much! I can't thank you enough!
supporter: I'm happy to hear that, I wish you luck and take care of yourself.

seeker: Hello.

I'm not happy with an ex friend who talks behind my back to my current friends

.

supporter: that's an option but I hope it doesn't go that far again.  Have you tried maybe a mediation with the ex friend and your current friend?

supporter: Seems like a good idea.  Steer clear of her and don't associate with her!  Sounds like you're doing the right thing. Keep your side of the street clean

supporter: I would if I were in your shoes.  You don't need two of the same person. Know what I mean?

seeker: yeah exactly. people need to realize who's side to stay on
supporter: LOL if only everyone had that thought process.  Some people don't get it!

supporter: I actually majored in communication and have a great deal of experience with public speaking.

seeker: That's interesting, I find public speaking to be especially difficult
supporter: Yes, the physical nervousness that can manifest is powerful.  I would highly recommend finding a quiet place to calm and focus your mind for at least five minutes before your presentation.  At least a minute's worth of breathing, and drink plenty of water.

seeker: That very helpful advice, I think another stressful factor is being able to field questions effectively
supporter: Ah, yes, that is a hard one.  You are expected to be an expert.  But you can only prepare so much.

seeker: Agreed, and there is always that fear that you won't know an answer
supporter: "That is a really great question that I've never considered! Maybe XYZ?  I can check on that and get back to you with a sure answer though!"

seeker: I can understand that, as a I try to prepare for the presentation it's stressing me out about all of the different types of potential questions.
supporter: Just feel confident that you have fulfilled the assignment according to the guidelines.     Extra questions from students are wildcards and you can only handle them within the scope of the assignment.

seeker: That's fair! I suppose I will have to accept the fact that there is no way to prepare for every eventual question
supporter: I think you will do great.  You sound prepared, and a small amount of worry is an indication you desire to perform well.

seeker: Great thanks, this was very helpful.
supporter: I'm so glad to hear that!  You have an excellent attitude and work ethic, you got this!

seeker: Appreciate your advice, have a good rest of your day
supporter: You too!

seeker:
Absolutely and I'm not sure how to broach this with him. I actually feel like it is damaging his reputation. 
Other friends of ours feel the same way. Not sure what to do?
supporter: Gotcha so not only are you frustrated with what he is doing, but you are also worried about his reputation! First of all, can I ask if he is just your friend online or if you hangout with him in person too?

seeker: That's correct. He is actually a close friend and I wonder what has changed recently to make him like this. I've known him for over 20 years.
supporter: Okay I see. From personal experience, the best way to confront someone who likes to do most of their confrontations online, is in person. Since he is so used to almost "hiding" behind a screen, his feelings will be more vulnerable and real if you discuss your concerns in person.

seeker: Actually I've never thought of it like that. Perhaps a couple of us can have a conversation with him in person. Honestly some off his views are disgusting. I think this needs to stop.
supporter: A suggestion I would make would be to hangout with him in person, and bring up the issues that you and your friends have been seeing. But it's important to not make him feel overwhelmed. Almost like he is being "ganged up on."

seeker: Yes that's good advice, I think we need to be tactful and raise it in the right way. Have you ever experienced something like this with a friend yourself?
supporter: I can tell that you care about this person as a friend, but you are worried that the way he thinks and talks may ruin that in a way. Make sure to let him know these concerns! It will show him that you guys truly are doing it out of love.

seeker: Ok sure please do
supporter: One of my best friend's and roommate, had a very hard time separating friendship and roommate issues. It caused a lot of issues in the relationships with our friends. She had a tendency to discuss issues over text and didn't like doing it in person. But we realized, the problem with that is that you can't tell the emotion behind messages on a screen. But once we talked in person, our issues were solved because we could hear the intended emotions behind what we were saying

seeker: Yeah that's useful. I think you are right in that the ambiguity of social interaction online makes him more inclined to say extreme thinks, perhaps to get a reaction. The more I think about it, perhaps this could be an indication that there is something he is dealing with and may be lashing out.
supporter: Yes exactly. It sounds like he might have other reasonings behind his actions. And you guys talking to him as friends in person, would show him that you care and that he is in a safe environment. He doesn't need to be so extreme

seeker: Yeah I think that's definitely the way forward. Listen this has really helped so thanks for the suggestions and sharing your own experiences.
supporter: Yes of course! I wish you the best in overcoming this hard time with your friend. I believe that you guys will be able to talk through it since it's a newer issue. :)

seeker: I hope so too. Nice to talk to you and thanks again.
supporter: Of course! Have a good rest of your day

seeker: Hi there
supporter: Hey, how's it going?

seeker: Not bad but I'm just getting fed up with work. working for a big corporate just bored me to tears. It's all I know and I feel trapped like I can't escape. I don't want this to be my life for ever!
supporter: What is it about your job that you don't like?

seeker: I think it's all the politics of working in an office, the endless meetings and the people trying to get one over on each other. I find it draining.
supporter: Bleh, sorry to hear that. I think I understand what you're saying.

seeker: Have you had a similar experience?
supporter: Perhaps it's like following through on your work goals is challenging enough, and then there's a bunch of unnecessary effort on top of it to work around the politics.

seeker: It does indeed, actually it's like you work in my office. I'm just fearful that if I try something new I won't be able to support myself financially, do you know what I mean?
supporter: For sure. It's true that you don't *have* to work there, but I'm sure there are factors in play that make it difficult to leave.

seeker: That is a very good question. I hadn't thought  about it like that. I think I want to try something new and you have helped me realise this. I don't think I actually want to be happier in my current position. The question is how should I approach it?
supporter: Small steps, I suppose. What do you think the very very first, small step would be?

seeker: I think maybe consider what I actually enjoy and how could I make that profitable.
supporter: Nice! That's a good first step.

seeker: I think maybe I could do something on the side while I'm still working until I'm sure of what I want to so. Finding time with a family and a full time job is hard though. That's why so many people get trapped.
supporter: Yep, for sure. It's not going to be easy.

seeker: Do you think it's even possible?
supporter: Most likely! The only thing keeping me from saying definitely is because I don't know all the info. But sure.

seeker: At least that's positive. I need to do something about this because I think it's starting to affect my mental health!
supporter: I gotta believe that switching careers is much more common nowadays than it was one or two generations ago. People you meet along the way will understand.

seeker: That's true actually. Yes that's how I feel right now. You get it. It's like I'm part of a meaningless machine. I think I'm definitely going to do something about it now.
supporter: Good to know. Because maybe that's something you could keep in mind when you think about new jobs. Does this job allow me to see meaningful outcomes from my effort, and so on.

seeker:
I've been better to be honest. I think I need to break up with my girlfriend but she moved in last year and I don;'
 know how to approach it. I think I'm going to be in for a bad emotional time
supporter: That seems like a tough situation! What feelings made you decide you need to breakup with her?

seeker: It's a bit of a mix. I don't find her attractive that much any more and I think that's important. Also since moving in she is difficult to live with. I can't see myself with her long term.
supporter: I completely understand that. I recently broke up with my boyfriend earlier this year, because I didn't feel like I loved him as much as I used to. Things like that are important!

seeker: It's good that you have had a similar experience and understand what I'm going through. We dated for a while. The thing is she is Italian and has moved countries to live with me. I feel so bad that this has happened.
supporter: Oh I see. That's a huge step to make in a relationship. So you are hesitant to break up with her because she moved just to be with you?

seeker: Yes that's right, I helped her get a job and thought I'd just see how it goes. Her family loves me and thinks I'm great which makes this even more difficult. We have talked about things yes but she sees it as a bit of a joke I think.
supporter: I think it's great that we got matched up, because I went through also the exact same situation. My boyfriend and I were long distance, and he moved across the country to be closer to me. So when I felt like we needed to break up, I was experiencing similar guilt that you are experiencing.

seeker: It's great that you understand this. I think being the man puts more pressure on me to look after her and make sure she
supporter: I want to reassure you, that doing what's best for you is what is most important! Your partner will understand this if they truly care for you. Things will be tough for a while, but you both will be able to grow from this experience. And just because you don't want to be in a relationship anymore, doesn't mean that you don't care about her!

seeker: To be honest, it's amazing that you have suggested this. It's really hard to balance my needs and feelings without breaking her heart. It's hard for the person that's dumped but actually I think it is equally hard for the dumper!
supporter: Yes exactly! It's so difficult for the dumper as well, because of course you still have strong feelings for this person. They just aren't romantic anymore.

seeker: That's exactly it. So do you think I should just talk to her and tell her how I feel? The thing is it's not like she can move out immediately. It's going to be a long drawn out experience.
supporter: I think talking to her and being transparent about your feelings is definitely the right move. In doing this, reassure her you still want to be friends and you aren't just "kicking her to the curb." Things will obviously be awkward for the first little bit, because continuing to live together will bring it's own difficulties. But the beautiful thing about that is, you guys are already used to it. :) So it's only hard if you make it hard

seeker: Yes, I think I need to emphasize the friends element of it and potentially support her to move on. I suppose I'm fearful that it will never end but I'll need to face into that and stay strong, and obviously avoid being intimate as this would really hurt her if I continued to sleep with her. I need to be careful about that I think!
supporter: Yes exactly. And from chatting with you, I can tell that you are a very caring person. You don't want to hurt her. I believe that you have the understanding of the situation, and you know what you should and shouldn't do in order to make it work. The hard part is simply getting the courage to finally discuss it. But I think you are going to be able to do that just fine!

seeker: I must say, you have been fantastic to talk to about this, we have had a similar experience so I think the advice is coming from experience. Thanks for that!
supporter: What I've gathered about you as a person, makes me confident that you probably chose a partner that will be able to have this talk with you and you both will come to an understanding.

seeker: Thank you for a great conversation. To continue as is wouldn't be fair on her and I see that now.
supporter: Of course! And it wouldn't be fair to her, just as much as it wouldn't be fair to you. Your happiness is just as important!

seeker: Yeah, I need to put myself first but also be considerate of her feelings. Thanks for that
supporter: Of course! I'm glad that you are feeling a bit better about everything! You as well!

supporter: Hello, how are you today?

supporter: I'm sure it will take dedication and hard work, but I bet you can do it!

supporter: I've been in your shoes and also feel that's a good way to add a little extra income. It can really add up if left to built and used towards a specific goal.

seeker: I agree 100%. Been spending it on new clothes and toiletries lately to stock up for the covid shutdown. the extra money helps alot
supporter: It definitely can help. Perhaps you could have a separate way of using some of the money to go towards some of the other bills you would like to pay off? Maybe designate a certain percentage for what you are using it towards now, and the rest to other bill concerns.

supporter: Yes, and I have found this can be a good way to provide for the extra luxuries we like, without taking away from money that's used towards household bills.

seeker: absolutely. i make sure all of my household bills are paid every month. i think it will get better once these debts are paid off. i needed a lot of new things at once since the old had worn out.
supporter: Have you tried to use some of the scripts that can be added that allows you to catch hits that are hard to get on Mturk? They can be very helpful. Also, there are forums that have all kinds of useful information for workers.

seeker: no i haven't tried those yet
supporter: You might find it useful to do a little research and add them as extensions to Chrome or whatever browser you use. They are free and pretty simple to use.

seeker: So I could make more money on mturk than I am now by using those?
supporter: They have helped me in being able to get a bit more extra income. The scripts will continually try to grab the hits for you and then put them in your queue if they catch them. It's easier and faster than trying to grab them over and over. The forums can a large amount of help too. Perhaps try MTS. They also can show exactly how much you end up making per hour, filter by monetary amount of hits, etc

seeker: oh wow, thank ya! I'll look into that
supporter: Of course, I hope it can be of use too you! One I use is Mechanical Turk Suite, which is an extension. I think you can look up as a search for extensions, scripts etc. Or Mturk forums and find out tons of help!

seeker: Thank ya! I'll check it out
supporter: You're welcome! Best of Luck!

supporter: I think you have it. You too.

When you had the conversation about this breakup were you honest about why you need the space and that your problem was not with the relationship but with maybe the timing.  I think with communication and after growth perhaps by keeping the door open with this person maybe you can have some sort of relationship in the future even if its friendship or maybe more.  You are doing what is right for yourself at the given time

I think right now the best thing you can do for you and the person is to stick with your decision and give them time they also may need space to process and deal with the breakup and growth for themselves without really letting go you won't be able to grow in time you can have a conversation and ask but it might be six months down the road wait for them to come to you they have asked for time as you did too soon

supporter: Yes, job applications can feel particularly demeaning to complete.  Personally, I get frustrated with all the repetition and then repetitive rejection.  It seems like I had no value.

seeker: It feels good someone else knows how frustrating and what a cycle it creates but I am also sorry that you do know how it is also.
supporter: No, don't think that.  I know of several employers that have actually said they don't want employees smarter than them.  It requires more money and more management, and quite a few people are very happy to not do either of those things for ostensibly higher quality workforce.

seeker: Hopefully I find an employer that sees a quality workforce over other things, its getting pretty discouraging
supporter: I see.  Maybe there are some qualification programs in your local area, or maybe at the local university or college where you could take classes?  There is a career development center at my local university that is open to everyone, maybe you could see if they would review your resume and give you some objective feedback?  Students love a good live subject :-)

seeker: Wow I have never thought about that! That sounds awesome and like it would be great help, also trying something new would feel nice instead of filing the same stuff into applications!
supporter: You should explore what resources your city/county/province may offer for job seekers.  It is in the best interest of almost every community that its members have have jobs and feel useful, so you may find some valuable information and maybe some connections.

seeker: My spirits are going up just having this conversation and looking forward to the community outreach. Hopefully it helps lift this gloom that has been over me for months. I loved my previous job but due to bad management it was taking a toll on everyone employed.
supporter: I am glad to hear you are feeling a little better!  Yes, bad management is so toxic.  Even with great coworkers in a job you love, horrible management can ruin it quickly.

seeker: I think that is truly when I started feeling down, productivity was high but it mattered not to those in charge it was never enough.
supporter: I was in a similar situation, nothing was ever good enough, and we were never given enough information to succeed anyhow.

seeker: I'm sorry you had to experience something similar by the sounds of it you are no longer in that situation, so that gives me hope for myself!
supporter: That is awesome :-)

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hello. How are you doing today?

seeker: Feeling pretty down to be honest.
supporter: Oh, I am sorry about that. Why are you feeling down?

seeker: I'm just really lonely. My friends are all very busy lately and I haven't been able to find a partner for a long time.
supporter: I can understand that. It is difficult feeling alone.

seeker: Yes. Normally it's not so bad but it's been such going on for such a long time. It's harder to deal with after so many years.
supporter: It sounds like you feel your friends are too busy for you.

seeker: Yes, but the biggest part is not being able to find romantic partner.
supporter: Why do you think you are having trouble finding a suitable romantic partner?

seeker: Part because of my low income and part because of my age. I live in a college town and most single women are 10 years younger than me.
supporter: Sometimes meeting people through mutual friends is helpful. Have you asked any of your friends if they could introduce to you people they know?

seeker: I've tried but my friends don't have very large social circles and most mutuals are already dating or are not interested in dating anyone at all.
supporter: I can see how that would make it difficult. What about internet dating or going to a single's night?

seeker: Internet dating is a cost issue, the most popular apps charge to meet the person, I could look at singles nights once the Covid issue is over. I don't even know if there are any locally.
supporter: It seems Covid is making dating difficult for everyone.

seeker: I hear that from people. I wish I had Covid as an excuse instead of just being confused about why I can't find someone.
supporter: It is reasonable to use Covid as an excuse. I am sure there are plenty of women out there who are also confused about why they can't find someone.

seeker: Possibly, I can see how that is possible.
supporter: I am sure after Covid is over, there will be plenty of possible romantic partners coming your way. :)

seeker: Well I appreciate the advice and support.
supporter: You are welcome. Good Luck!

seeker: Hello. I am so broken up and also disgusted from my break-up with my only long-term partner.
supporter: I am so sorry to hear that. I know how that feels.

seeker: Well, I suppose for him it came out of nowhere. But for me I just had slowly come to the realization that he was not the person for me. I fell out of love with him slowly and grew more annoyed by a lot of his behaviors.
supporter: Realizing someone isn't the same you fell in love with seems valid. Fighting over a salad is definately not something most couples argue over.

seeker:
I think I did the right thing, not just for me but for him. It isn't fair to keep dating someone just because being single is hard. 
I just still get weird lingering feelings wondering if he was right and maybe I am too much for a lot of people. I don't think he is right, and my friends disagree but it still hurts and I can still hear him tell me no one would ever love me.
supporter: I think I have said the same thing in a breakup so I wouldn't take that personal.

seeker: Yeah? I suppose people just say things when they are hurt.
supporter: People say things they dont mean, or just say mean things to hurt because they are hurting

seeker: Thank you. Hopefully someone who doesn't fight over whether salad is valid dinner choice!
supporter: Perhaps if you set up a dating profile have that be an intro question: is a salad a meal? you can weed people out that way!!!!

seeker: haha yeah!
supporter: It sounds like you are going to be okay, and I am sure you will find someone when the time is right!

seeker: Yeah. I think things will work out eventually.
supporter: I agree, and I wish you the bet of luck!

seeker: Hi.  I'm doing fine.  Just feeling a bit anxious.
supporter: Would you want to go further into whats causing this anxiety?

seeker: Well, I am retired, but in need of extra income to meet my financial obligations.  It is very difficult for me, however, to wear a mask for longer than a few moments.  Due to the mandates in my area, I would be required to wear a mask.
supporter: Well, have you tried online platforms like MTurk?

seeker: That is what I am currently doing, and it is helping some.  I have increased the time I work on there, so that will help some.  I would love a second source as well, however...just so I could really save some.
supporter: I hear you on that. I am disabled and the extra income helps a lot for my family. Unfortunately until the pandemic ends a part time job might not be in your best interest for now. Ebay flipping takes some time to get into as well but could help.

seeker: Yes, I have thought of that, actually.  I have quite a few items I would love to sell.  I have never done it, though, so need to research how to ship items, etc.
supporter: Its actually very easy now. You can print out the slips at home and they tell you how much it will be. I have done it a few times, the last time was only a couple months a go.

seeker: Well, I will definitely have to check that out.  It would serve two purposes : decluttering and making money.  I think I got anxious last week when I had a tire go flat and took my car in to get it fixed.  I found out I need all new tires and new brakes.  Not easy on a fixed income.  Plus I am widowed.
supporter: I am sorry for that. Yea having a nest egg is ideal, but i know how hard it can be. I think with the extra cash and space it may be a big help to those anxiety issues. Do you drive a lot as it is now?

seeker: I actually don't. Only to the grocery store, or to visit my daughter who lives about 20  minutes away.
supporter: Well at least you are not putting to much wear on them now. Have you checked with local governments for assistance? Even with things like medication?

seeker: I am not on any medication, which I am so thankful of.  I have not checked any programs for assistance.  I'm not sure if I would even qualify.  It wouldn't hurt to try, I guess.
supporter: Believe me never hurts to try. A penny you save on something else can be a penny that goes into your savings

seeker: That is so true!  I have been selling some items through my neighborhood online Marketplace and made $100 just this week.  I have also started a change jar.  Amazing how a bit here and there can add up.
supporter: Wow thats pretty good. Yeah it is. It seems you are very proactive about this which is really good.

seeker: Yes.  I am definitely one not to give up, which is a good thing!  I appreciate your help.  I feel more positive now.
supporter: I am very glad i could be of some help. I truly believe you have this handled.

seeker: Thank you very much.  I hope you have a blessed day.
supporter: You as well!

seeker: Hi
supporter: Hi there, how are you today?

seeker: So I'm sad because it is hard for me to find a job with covid and everything and no one is willing to hire me.
supporter: That is really hard. I know COVID has had a huge toll on folks. Do you have a good support system in place to help during this trying time?

seeker: I do I have my bf and family around
supporter: That's really great! Having a good support system is important right now. I understand it's difficult to find a job during these times.

seeker: I have but I am having trouble finding a call monitoring job
supporter: Where are you looking for jobs right now? Some of my friends have had some success by looking on LinkedIn or Idealist.

seeker: Hmmm Idealist would be another great source
supporter: How about Craigslist? Not my favorite personally speaking, but might be worth taking a look.

seeker: I will look into that as well
supporter: I'm confident you'll find something! Hopefully you have some great self care practices in place that will help you through this time

seeker: I do I hope u do too
supporter: I do - thank you for checking :-)

seeker: So how are things for u during this lockdown?
supporter: I'm an introvert / homebody so it's been fairly easy for me. I have a lot of projects at home that I enjoy doing (reading, puzzles, meditating, yoga, etc) that keep me busy. I was also, very lucky to be able to keep my full-time job so that keeps me fairly busy most days. But I like a change of scenery and do Mturk tasks for fun

seeker: I'm the same way
supporter: yes! not a whole lot honestly, but i like it.

seeker: I just want this to be over with I want to go back to normal
supporter: I agree! It would be nice to have more options of things to do. I do miss going to the library and reading or a museum. Hoping more people will start to wear masks and really start to take this seriously

seeker: Hello
supporter: Good afternoon!  What can I help you with today?

seeker: I've been feeling a lot of pressure and stress lately due to school
supporter: Oof, yes, school can be a tough situation.   Are you close to the end of the semester?

seeker: Yes, I am a little more than halfway done with the semester
supporter: Ahh, I see.  That is a great deal of time and work.  What are you studying?

seeker: It is... I am in psychology
supporter: Time management can be very difficult with a normal class load, that sounds exhausting.

seeker: It is!
supporter: Do calendars help you at all?  I am a super visual person, so calendars and planners are invaluable to me, as well as different colors of ink and labels so I can visually divide my attention

seeker: I do keep a physical and electronic agenda, but I feel like even if I write down my tasks, I find a way to procrastinate which is what I am having trouble with
supporter: Also, setting clear boundaries for your study/work and relax times may help.  I like to set a timer for, say, 45 minutes, and work/write/read/study for that long, then, I get a 10 minute break.  I'll go outside, refresh my coffee, grab a snack, dance to some music, stretch, then set another timer for 45 minutes, then another break for 10 minutes.  That allows my brain to take a second and refresh from the work.

seeker: That is actually very helpful, I'll take note of it
supporter: Or, like, today, I woke up and spent half an hour allowing myself to drink my coffee and scroll through Reddit.  Then it was time to work on my group project for 45 minutes, then a break, then I worked again, took a break, went to a class, etc.  Scheduling your breaks can be helpful too so your lizard brain doesn't freak out and go "WE ARE GOING TO BE WORKING FOREVERRRR"

seeker: I agree!!! That really is helpful, thank you
supporter: which, for me at least, is where the fatigue sets in.  You're very welcome!  I hope I was helpful.  You seem positive and willing to try new things, and I think you will be successful even if you are tired.

seeker: The pandemic hasn't really helped either
supporter: Definitely not.  Everyone's Maslow hierarchy getting knocked out from under them is extremely disconcerting.

seeker: Hahaha, Maslow, i like it.
supporter: Like how is a person supposed to study, self-actualize, when we literally don't know what will happen next?

seeker: I agree! I've also been turning to drugs a lot lately due to the situation. Procrastinating makes me feel guilty, and I end my day too early to smoke and focus my mind on something other than studying....
supporter: Are there aspects of your study that you dislike, or are you just ready to be done with school?  Little of column A + column b?

seeker: Hm, I think it has less to do with liking or disliking, and more with starting a very hard and lengthy degree online without any social contact
supporter: Ah, yes, that makes sense.  And working from home is infamously hard, again, for lack of boundaries, so in addition to just not seeing people and getting the casual affirmation and confirmation messages on a daily basis of like "hey Jim you did a great job on that spreadsheet" or "Haha Jessica you're so funny", we also are writing papers in our pajamas and bedclothes, which makes it seem interminable.

seeker: Ugh exactly
supporter: Listening to lectures while the doorbell is ringing and it's just so strange and we aren't set up to do it.  That's why I'm a big fan of specific spaces in my house since March.  I tried to sit in bed with my laptop and do things but 1. I'm old and it hurts my wrists and 2. my headspace is so completely different from being my computer chair and at my desk.  I try to be really strict about where I do my work., maybe trying to structure that a bit could help you feel a little more in control of the work load and your day's schedule.

seeker: I agree, that makes a lot of sense! Thank you
supporter: I am very glad to hear that!  You sound motivated to succeed and I think that you deserve to take care of yourself and stay healthy to complete your studies.  It will be hard but it will also be worth it, and you should be proud.  Good luck with everything!

seeker: Wow, thank you!
supporter: Thank you!  You too!

seeker: Okay how are you?
supporter: Im doing great thanks. Anything on your mind today?

seeker: Just pondering microcheating and wondering why someone who I do not like that way would be considered microcheating
supporter: And what do you mean by microcheating?

seeker: It is a new thing like having a man you like that you check up on on social media even though you are in a relationship, or eating lunch with the same woman or man that you like but you don't act on because you are married.
supporter: Oh i see, well i think overthinking things like that can lead to unwanted emotions. Or putting yourself in a situation with another person when you are in a relationship might mean there are other issues going on.

seeker: Yes i see that. No nothing else going on just thinking that the definition maybe shouldn't be as exact for the type of person that I do not talk to because of his reservations about it.
supporter: Well, if you are not talking to them then i see no harm. If you are talking to them with some sort of intention to for a relationship beyond friendship then i see issues arising.

seeker: That is what I feel. I am not talking to him. I had to the other day to get in contact with someone(medical emergency) but do not call just to chat and catch up. I even unfriended him. I just want to comfort him over it but I think it is best just to never speak of him again.
supporter: To never speak to your fiance?

seeker: No I am ending my friendship with him. That is what is best.
supporter: I think it might be as well if you cannot control it. I do have to ask though, are you happy with your Fiance?

seeker: Yes very.
supporter: Then i 100% back you on your decision. Id take this time to focus on you too. Strengthen the bond a bit.

seeker: Yes, I think that would be best. I thank you for your time.
supporter: I thank you for opening up!

seeker: It is okay see talking about this is actually microcheating. So now I am worried about that.
supporter: I really wouldnt even consider it cheating to have feelings. Acting on them or trying to strengthen them may be though.

seeker: Yes that is true. My fiance is over seas for work for the next 13 mos so I am here in the states alone. We get to talk but he isnt here with me so having no one to talk to is lonely.
supporter: I see that, have you tried to talk to your friends about this issue? Or even try a therapist? Maybe you and your Fiance can figure out more times to talk with facetime or zoom. Do a virtual date night.

seeker: Yes I don't have any friend that arent men so I think therapy is going to help. I don't talk to anyone anymore. But I thank you for your time. I just wanted to clarify why I brought it up. I hope you have a good day.
supporter: I hope you do as well!

seeker: Hi. I'm a little stressed out at the moment over losing my job in the coming months.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear about that! I can totally understand why you'd be stressed.

seeker: The company I work for is winding down. i'm on the old side to be looking for a job and i'm likely going to have to accept a lower salary, a longer commute and a heavier workload. In other words, I have a job I love, close to where I live that is very manageable. I can't sleep and I'm insanely anxious all of the time.
supporter: I can feel your anxiety, and I completely understand why you're feeling that way, but you don't know for sure that will be true. Have you started looking for a new job already?

seeker: I started looking for a job last week. I had a transition meeting today to pass on the little bit of my work that will be left to another person. I have 2 children; one who just started college this fall and another who is a junior in high school. my elderly mother lives with me also so I can't sell my house any time soon and move into something smaller and cheaper. I feel really trapped at the moment.
supporter: It definitely sounds like you're being overwhelmed with a lot of responsibilities along with your job loss. It's definitely a lot of things to deal with all at once, but it would help to break things down so they're more manageable. Do you have anyone close by who can help you out?

seeker: i have friends and family close by. i don't like to burden people with my problems. I know i also don't adjust well to change and that doesn't help.
supporter: I understand completely. I used to bottle things up too, but I've learned that the people who love you won't think you're a burden if you ask for help or just to have someone blow off some steam.

seeker: I've always been reluctant to ask for help or favors because i keep thinking there will always be a time down the road where i will need something more. it's helpful to have someone remind me that change isn't always a bad thing. thank you.
supporter: It sounds like you're very self-aware and I think your friends and family will be very willing to lend a hand.

seeker: i am  aware of many things including how truly fortunate i am to have my family, friends and health. I really appreciate your kind words and calming suggestions.
supporter: Yes, your family, friends, and health are all really important! I hope you stay safe!

seeker: You too.
supporter: I hope you get to enjoy the coming holidays with your family and friends!

seeker: and you as well.
supporter: You're welcome! Have a great day.

seeker: Have a great day too!
supporter: I hope I was able to help.

seeker: hi. i was discontinued from my studies due to some financial problem
supporter: That is a very tough situation to be in, I'm sorry you're having to deal with that.

seeker: i am staying with my parents.
supporter: That is understandable.  So you aren't having to discontinue your studies immediately?

seeker: i have discontinued it already
supporter: Okay, thank you for clarifying :-)  Your frustration is understandable.  Having a job while being in school can be tough, that is true.  However if you are discerning you could get a job that would have flexible hours, especially if you let them know beforehand that you're planning on getting back into school as soon as possible.

seeker: yes. thank you for concern
supporter: When I was in college, I worked for the school and the library.  It was not a lot of money, but in addition to a small check, it made me more indispensable to the university.

seeker: i think i can also follow this idea.
supporter: You should also explore any and all financial aid offers they can give you.  More than once I have been told that not as many people apply for scholarships and grants as you think.

seeker: I think i can cope upwith my situation with this advice of you.thank you
supporter: You're very welcome, I think you are capable of more than you think.

seeker: oh so kind of you
supporter: I actually am getting a second degree in religious studies

seeker: I am so embarassed and saddened.
supporter: what happened?

seeker: I met a handsome intelligent man.
supporter: how  are you feeling lately?

seeker: We dated for a month.
supporter: it's okay. we should learn from things like this.

seeker: That's true.
supporter: don't think much and keep yourself engaged in the activities you like the most.

seeker: Hey, that is great advice!
supporter: can you tell me how are you before this incident?

seeker: I was happy.
supporter: can you share me some happy memories which made you smile

seeker: Sure, I love going to the movies! How about you!
supporter: it's okay. i can understand.

seeker: Are you American?
supporter: I love traveling to new places.

seeker: Yes traveling is what we are made to do as humans!
supporter: yes, i am an american.what about you

seeker: Same
supporter: well, just think of some happy memories and try to spend time with people who value you the most.

seeker: Yes, thank you for the great advice!
supporter: oh, thats nice of you.thank you

seeker: You are very welcomed!
supporter: you too!

seeker: Well what are you having for lunch?
supporter: i had my breakfast just now. i am planning to cook some beef for lunch.what about you

seeker: Hi, I'm very depressed and sad.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that. Do you know why you feel depressed and sad?

seeker: I think it's because of my poor relationships in life
supporter: Have you tried taking some deep breaths to help you right now?

seeker: I'll try and see if that calms me down.
supporter: Tell me more about the poor relationships you have

seeker: My family doesn't like me because I'm bad at school. My friends don't really like me or talk to me much. I feel alone.
supporter: Are you able to talk to anyone about this? Someone who will at least listen to you talk?

seeker: Not really. I try to talk to my friends but they avoid me.
supporter: Maybe you could take one person aside by themselves and talk privately about your feeling?

seeker: That seems like a good idea.
supporter: Yes, just wait for the right time when the person is alone and ask if you could talk.

seeker: I'll try to do that, thank you.
supporter: Remember to take deep breaths, wait for the right time and see if that works for you. I know you can do it.

seeker: Thank you so much. I feel like I can talk to someone now.
supporter: I have faith in you. Is there anything else we need to talk about?

seeker: No, I'm okay. I feel a little better. I hope I'll be able to talk to a friend soon
supporter: Remember, the outcome may not be perfect but slowly things will come together. Take it one step at a time.

seeker: What step should I take after this one?
supporter: See if the conversation gives you some insight on how things could be better. Maybe you could see things from someone else's perspective.

seeker: Thank you so much!! You're helping me a ton
supporter: Would you be willing to give it a try?

seeker: Yes, of course~
supporter: Also, if that works, then build from there. Remain calm and little by little talk about your concerns.

seeker: That seems very, very smart. Thank you
supporter: Get some good sleep the night before you try having the conversation so you are at your best.

seeker: Yes, I promise I will. I'm going to go rest now. Thank you again.
supporter: You are welcome.

seeker: Hi, i've been feeling really depressed lately and I'd like to talk to someone about it
supporter: That is very understandable.  Depression is tough to deal with.

seeker: It's a bit of everything. I've recently lost my job and I'm just really worried about how my bills are going to get paid. I feel so tired, you know?
supporter: I totally understand.  Losing your job is a very rough thing to go through, I'm sorry that happened to you.  Feeling constantly at red alert is taxing both mentally and physically.

seeker: Yeah that makes sense but I've spent so much time thinking about my finances that I've sort of burned myself out
supporter: That makes sense.  You sound emotionally exhausted.

seeker: Definitely, I feel like I could sleep forever but with my kids to worry about I don't have that option
supporter: Gratitude is one of those things, I've found, that is self-perpetuating.  Even if you begin by doing it robotically, eventually your mind and heart will want to be more sincerely grateful.  I have in the past challenged myself to find five things to be grateful for in the morning and write them down.  Whether those things are "I have hot coffee and electricity" or "I won $1000 for free", they will begin to start a small fire of joy.

seeker: Messages could work, I could stick them around and I guess they coudl help not just me but my little ones too because I'm sure my moods been affecting them as well
supporter: That sounds like a great idea!  It sounds like you care a lot about your kids, I bet it's easy for you to be grateful for them :-)

seeker: Absolutely the little terrors are the reason I get up in the morning. I can't let them down, you know
supporter: Well that is an enormous amount of responsibility that has been placed upon your shoulders, but your attitude seems extremely pleasant and positive.  It does not sound easy, but you should make sure you build in some time for yourself if you can.

seeker: I'm going to try, the messages idea is a really good one so I think I'll give that a try. I mean I am grateful for my kids and I guess things could be worse I do still have some savings left and I can always try to get another job
supporter: You definitely have options, but your situation is still tough, and you deserve relief where you can get it.

seeker: I'll keep that in mind but thank you for taking the time to let me get things off my chest
supporter: Of course, I am happy if I was able to help.  You have a good heart and love your kids, you stay strong, you can do this :-)

seeker: Thank you and I'll be trying! I hope you have awesome day and thanks again
supporter: You're welcome, you too!

seeker: Hey, I'm doing good at the moment. How about yourself?
supporter:
Not too bad!
 It looks like a lovely day out.

seeker: Haha, I wish I could say the same. New York is depressing, cloudy and cold.
supporter:
Well
 make sure you're bundled up and warm!

seeker: I got the heater on and a sweater, working from home so it's not too bad.
supporter: Sounds cozy. Glad to hear that you're staying safe indoors!

seeker: Yeah it's a good benefit, especially with covid going on
supporter: Definitely! How are you dealing with the pandemic? It's been a long year.

seeker: Not too bad, still have limited work and all remote so wont complain. But the expenses are tough.
supporter: I'm not too bad, but cases are also going up here in California. Luckily, my family and I haven't gotten sick.

seeker: Thanks good to hear, New York was doing well up until the holidays season. Now we might get another lockdown.
supporter: I think that's true for a lot of states since cases seem to be going up everywhere, unfortunately. What are your plans for the holidays?

seeker: Mostly stay home with the family, try to save money and cut expenses this year. How about you?
supporter: We're planning on camping in the desert. That's a good idea to save money. How do you plan on saving money?

seeker: No gifts giving and going make a modest size home made family dinner for thanksgiving this year. Usually we go visit family out state. We just want to get out of debt this year and save for next year.
supporter: Those are all really good ideas, and it sounds like you know what's really important! It's definitely been a tough year, but it's also good to look ahead and plan for the future.

seeker: Yes, thanks for the chat. Love the positive vibes!
supporter: It's been great chatting with you too! Hope you and your loved ones stay safe out there!

seeker: Hi How are you today?
supporter: I'm doing fine today. How are you feeling?

seeker: I'm feeling a little bit anxious today.
supporter: Can I ask why that is?

seeker: I really dropped the ball at work today and I'm so worried that I'm going to get let go.
supporter: Would you like to talk more about it? What is making you feel that way?

seeker: I thought I had everything set up for one of my resident's at a new placement and I called today to confirm and they told me the bed was no longer available. My boss is very intense and I'm scared that when I tell her she will let me go.
supporter: I see. It seems as though you've done your best, but I understand your feelings. Is it possible you can speak with your boss about it and explain?

seeker: I can try that but my boss is very neurotic and I don't think she will want to hear my explanations.
supporter: I understand that, I also had a boss who acted this way. I can feel how stressed you are about this. Is there anything you think you can do to jump ahead of the situation?

seeker: I could call the facility and find out when there next opening is and try to see if I can have the client placed on a waitlist so that he can be moved sooner.
supporter: I think that would be a great solution to your problem. I also think you can try some breathing exercises to help you be less anxious.

seeker: That would actually be helpful. I always forget to do my breathing exercises.
supporter: Is there anything else you ussually do to help you relax?

seeker: I listen to music or watch a funny show on TV.
supporter: That seems like a great way to relax! I know that's what helps me as well.

seeker: Thank you. You have been very helpful. I think I'm going to listen to some music while I do some deep breathing exercises.
supporter: I hope that helps, and I hope everything goes great with your boss!

seeker: Me too! Thanks for the support.
supporter: You can always come back for more support if needed!

seeker: my boss/ director basically ignores me because I am female in a male domain, I work any time of day or night and I get nothing but grief from him
supporter: I can understand feeling neglected in a male dominated field. Is there any one that you could discuss with that is higher up or in HR?

seeker: No they are all male and he is the golden child anyway
supporter: Is this a family owned company?

seeker: no corporate
supporter: That is stressful, being a female myself I can completely understand the stress and pressure.

seeker: so what is the best thing for me how to handle this
supporter: i wouldn't quit if you are not prepared to, but i would weigh options of looking for somewhere that would appreciate your efforts in a work place. With 10+ years of experience any company would be more than happy to have a dedicated worker with them.

seeker: so you think i should at least look for something new ?
supporter: Or even inquire about transferring to another location if that would be a possibility?

seeker: I think that might be I would just increase my commute
supporter: if it would be more beneficial mentally it could help, and could never hurt to ask for a raise due to the situation. If there is an HR department, I would discuss with them while seeing what other positions may be opening in the area that fit your criteria employment. There is a lot of options that are becoming available that are more beneficial for employees than they imagined.

seeker: there is an HR department  maybe i should try talking to them, even though they seem not approachable.
supporter: unfortunately, most places of employment take advantage of their good workers cause they feel they can get away with it and they will leave. But, at the end of the day, your well being is important.

seeker: very true I think I will take your advise and see what happens
supporter:
Yes, absolutely! If they have an anonymous contact line that may be able to help ease into the conversation , I would start there. 
I wish you the absolute best of luck and be thinking of your well being!

seeker: Thanks for your advise
supporter: Of course. Have a good day and good luck!

seeker: hello
supporter: Hello, how are you today?

seeker: i am ok so far
supporter: What brings you here today?

seeker: i am depressed
supporter: Depression can be hard to deal with. What do you think is contributing to your depression?

seeker: Covid-19
supporter: Yeah, this has really been a hard time for all of us. How has it impacted you personally?

seeker: my mom and sister had caught the virus they are doing ok now but it was rough
supporter: I can understand how hard that must have been. I'm glad they are doing ok now though!

seeker: yeah me too
supporter: How have you been using your time during the crisis?

seeker: yeah mostly working and meditation
supporter: That's great! Meditation is also something I've picked up during this time. It's really helpful and can keep you balanced. Do you have a routine or do you just do it sporadically?

seeker: i mostly do it sporadically but i do need to do it more often
supporter: It's great to try to integrate it into your day. All of us tend to have at least a few moments each day to ourselves. Even if it's during a shower or bathroom break, you really can meditate anywhere! It's all about being in the here and now.

seeker: so true
supporter: When things get stressful, meditation can be difficult. Sometimes we get wrapped up so much in our emotions that trying to center yourself and focus on your breathing and the moment can be hard. One thing I've learned to be helpful when I'm stressed is to breathe in through my nose while internally counting to three and out through my mouth counting to three. The counting tends to distract my mind from whatever stressful thing I was thinking of before.

seeker: i like that thank you for the tip i must use that more often
supporter: You're welcome! Is there anything else you'd like to talk about?

seeker: no that will be thanx for listening to me
supporter: My pleasure! I hope things start to look up for you. This has been a difficult time for all of us, but we'll pull through together! Nice speaking with you. Have a great day!

seeker: I'm so depressed, I just got layed off.
supporter: I am sorry to hear that, did you apply for unemployment benefit? That at least can help you financially until you get a new job

seeker: Yes, it will take weeks and the holidays are just around the corner.
supporter: It sucks it happens so close to the holidays. I understand it's hard to accept but I 'd recommend talking with someone close to you like a friend and family member

seeker: I know, with all the other crap going on now everyone else has their own problems they don't want to hear mine.
supporter: I'm sure someone will be there for you, they know you need them the most right now

seeker: They're busy with other people's problems. I'll deal with it.
supporter: It's not gonna be easy, but at the same time not impossible. Try looking at it a different way. You can use this time to train your skills or do things that you've wanted to but didn't have the time

seeker: I wanted to travel but that's not a good idea right now.
supporter: You can still travel domestically or just around your city. I like taking a walk in the park or wandering downtown to clear my mind.

seeker: I live in a small town and were are suppose to self quarantine unless we have to leave the house for work or go to the store.
supporter: that really sucks. Do you have a garden at home?

seeker: I did, everything is gone now. .
supporter: what have you been doing lately?

seeker: I do like to cook. I'll probable do more of that now.
supporter: that's a great idea, cooking and doing crafts can be helpful for you

seeker: That is a good idea but nobody is suppose to go to other peoples houses.
supporter: you can do video chat while cooking. I do virtual happy hour with my friends right now too

seeker: I think I may start making my own beer. Two birds one stone.
supporter: haha good idea

seeker: Thanks for the help have a good evening.
supporter: you too, i hope things get better for yourself

seeker: Hello.
supporter: Good evening, what is going on?

seeker: Hi. I have finals coming up and I am so so nervous about taking these tests.
supporter: What about the exams is making you nervous?

seeker: Taking them. I'm afraid I'm going to do poorly and have to retake the classes.
supporter: What steps have you taken to make sure you do not do poorly?

seeker: I study and I have gone to all my classes but I feel like I don't know the information well enough.
supporter: That is understandable. Sometimes we feel like we do not know enough. Have you tried to have someone quiz you?

seeker: Yes. I didn't do well on my quizzes.
supporter: Okay, since you didn't do well, it seems you can pinpoint what you need to work on. That is a good starting point.

seeker: Yes, that is a good point. I need to manage my nervousness too because it causes me to make silly mistakes.
supporter: Depending on how far your exams are, you can create a plan. Practice what you don't know daily, until you do know it.

seeker: That's really good advice.
supporter: Just trying to make life easier for others. Sometimes we don't see our solutions because of our anxiety.

seeker: Yes and it's definitely causing me to not think clearly.
supporter: Its best to take deep breaths and talk to someone who will help guide you.

seeker: I agree. I just feel bad burdening people with my issues .
supporter: Don't be. You would be surprised how many people are willing to help. Websites like Reddit are filled with many people wanting to give advice.

seeker:
Okay, I will give Te
ddit a whirl.
supporter: I hope it helps for future endeavors

seeker: Thank you for taking the time to chat with me.
supporter: You are welcome :)

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hi. How can I help?

seeker: I've just really been experiencing a very tough time lately.
supporter: What has happened? I know that sometimes life can get tough and just know that you are not alone. Sometimes the toughest parts of life, make us so much stronger.

seeker: Well, it started with a break up. My boyfriend and I dated for 7 years and suddenly out of nowhere, he dumps me over text. I keep blaming myself and my body for this.
supporter: Why do you think it's your body? I am sure that your body is just fine! Have you thought about taking up a hobby or activity to get your mind off of it?

seeker: I have thought about it, but I don't know where to start.
supporter: I understand. What kinds of things do you enjoy? I have found that exercise is great for mental health and such a good way to take your mind off of things. Have you ever felt interested in any psychical activities?

seeker: I have been thinking about working out more, but I feel like I don't know where to start when I go to the gym.
supporter: Do you have any friends or family to help you? I know exactly what you mean. Starting a new activity can be so hard when you aren't familiar. One thing that you might find helpful is to join in a group class at the gym. Do you think you'd like that?

seeker: I do have a cousin who likes to work out. That's a great idea. I should ask her. I've been pretty lonely, so it might be good to get out and meet people. Maybe a class would help me meet people too!
supporter: That's great! Do you know what kind of class would be of interest? I think that you have the tools to be who you want to be. It sounds like you have a good head on your shoulders and I think you'll be just fine! You may even find a life long passion or friendship! You never know what is around the corner.

seeker: Maybe yoga? Or perhaps a hit class? I will look online right away! I am very excited for this. I feel a bit better and I really appreciate your help.
