supporter: If you didn't do any of those things ever, how would you feel about yourself?

seeker:
having a more active lifestyle , 
making new friends
supporter: Now imagine you achieve all of those things, and you do so in spectacular fashion. Would you be happy? Or would you find another reason to feel hopeless?

seeker: I believe those are the things that have been bothering me for a long time
supporter: It's important to remember that you choose what goals to pursue. You decide the criteria for success and failure. You are the final arbiter of your life.

seeker: those are all goals in my life that I need to reach
supporter: I understand. We all have goals. Goals can be helpful. But ask yourself why you chose those particular goals.

supporter: It sounds like you need someone to tell you what to do, or to give you permission to do what you want to do.

seeker: if I accomplish them it will feel like there was improvement
supporter: If you need permission, I hereby grant you permission to pursue what is meaningful to you.

seeker:
I want to do
 all those
supporter: I understand. Which one is more important. Which is the one you can do right away? Also: which one do you really *not* want to do?

seeker: I feel like all those goals will take some time
supporter: Of course. Anything worthwhile takes time.

seeker: I need to stay on top of those goals but I feel like I get side tracked
supporter: You feel compelled to pursue these goals. Why? If you don't, what is the worst that could happen? What if you only pursued one goal?

seeker: pursuing only one of these will not be enough to make me happy I will keep thinking about the goals I need to accomplish
supporter: You need to readjust your expectations, which are causing you to feel unhappy.

seeker: is there a technique that you can suggest I follow to feel self motivated and keep my goals organized and in check
supporter: Pick a small action, like making your bed. Establish a habit of doing it daily. It will be easy to build on that success, but you might first establish a habit.

seeker: yeah sometimes I don't make the bed I wait to see if my boyfriends makes it sometimes
supporter: Make the bed every day. Then pick another small goal.

seeker: I actually feel good about my self after making the bed
supporter: That is evidence that you should continue that behavior.

seeker: that sounds weird
supporter: What do you think sounds weird?

seeker: I need to make the bed more often since it makes me feel good after making it
supporter: That is not weird at all.

seeker: oh okay thanks
supporter: When we accomplish something, our brain rewards us with chemicals.

seeker: wow
supporter: It sounds like your brain just gave you a squirt of chemicals.

seeker: that explains that feeling after making the bed
supporter: You have some big goals. Break them down into smaller ones.

seeker: yes I think those are mostly big goals that's why I don't know where to start
supporter: Weight loss is quantitative. Pick a number.

seeker: pick a number?
supporter: How much weight do you want to lose? How much can you lose this week, this month? It doesn't have to be much, but it must be measurable. How much less do you want to eat? It doesn't have to be much but it must be measurable. How much do you want to exercise? It doesn't have to be much but it must be measurable.

seeker: that's really good advice to break down that goal
supporter: Great! I'm glad I was able to help.

seeker: you did
supporter: I wish you the best of luck with your goals!

seeker: thank you very much
supporter: You as well.

supporter: It sounds like your co-worker doesn't trust your abilities. Does the co-worker have a legitimate reason to ask for the report? Is it important to the company?

supporter: Ok. So you would like to have more information about his schedule and when you will be together with him. Is that correct?

supporter: Ok. He is socializing with his co-workers and you would prefer that he come home and spend time with you. Is that right?

supporter: Ok. Socializing with co-workers is sometimes part of the job. Of course, your relationship with him is much more important, or it should be to him. What does he say when you talk to him about this?

supporter: Ok. By the way, do you have friends that you could socialize with? I understand that you want to spend time with him, but what other people do you have in your life?

supporter: Ok. Do you enjoy chatting with people online? You seem to chat well with me, so I think that you could connect with others virtually.

supporter: Hobbies are a good way to connect with people. What do you like to do?

seeker: after high school it has been a struggle to meet new people to hang out
supporter: Ok. My suggestions is that you find a friend or two to connect with virtually or physically. Perhaps joining a club, a gym or a class would help. This is one way for you to gain control of the situation.

supporter: Passive entertainment is not bad, but it does not help you make friends. Zumba and other activities are great for health and can help you meet people. Is there a place in your neighborhood?

seeker: I feel like I have social anxiety and that prevents me from having a conversation with someone
supporter: You might want to see a medical doctor about that. There are probably treatments that would help you adjust to social settings.

seeker: I don't have insurance
supporter: Sometimes there are free clinics, and perhaps a university has programs so that their students can learn to help patients.

seeker: those free clinics usually have a long wait
supporter: True, but it is important to take steps toward changing your situation.

seeker:
I get im
patient sometimes
supporter: I hope that this chat has helped you.

supporter: Ok. You are not them. You are a different person. You can make your own choices.

seeker: I don't want to be like them
supporter: That is a good first step. Good for you!

supporter: Now it is time for more steps.

supporter: I am doing well, I am sorry to hear you are upset

supporter: wow, there is a lot going on for sure, I hope it assures you too know that tough times to pass.

supporter: there are many new money saving APP's out there, some make it easy to achieve a goal, maybe that is something you could check out?

supporter: I understand what you are saying

supporter: Opening themselves up to the opportunity to be hurt again.....

seeker: Not to be hurt again ..to be open enough to trust someone again..
supporter: that is the sad thing, you kind of have to accept that getting hurt will always be a possibility, maybe it won't sting as much when someone has to go an prove you right....

supporter: Yes! That is a great way to put it!

seeker: Thank you for the advice. I really appreciate it.
supporter: Just never forget you are worthy of love, happiness, and nothing but good things

supporter: Things will look up!

supporter: Hi there, how are you feeling today?

supporter: Well yes I can concur with that. I have often found work takes my mind off my problems.

supporter: Well that's not a phrase that I much like. But there's nothing wrong with liking your job.

supporter: It's okay :) I did not realise that it predated Hitler. On another note, tell me about your job?

supporter: Well, a lot of people have been made redundant due to the pandemic - but that is not a reason why people should be happy with a dead end job. Would you consider something else?

supporter: It's okay to coast for a while if it's paying the bills but in the long term it won't be very satisfying. What would be your chances of retraining?

seeker: There's no other positions at the company I work at, I would have to leave the company. I am at the top of my position being a supervisor.
supporter: What about a whole new career though? Something you'd never even considered before?

seeker: That would take a lot of motivation to change careers.
supporter: I know but think about how worth it it would be! Did you have anything you wanted to do as a child that you never did?

seeker: Not really. I didn't have those types of dreams. I went to college , got a job, make money. Pretty much achieved what I set out to do. Didn't realize it wouldn't bring happiness.
supporter: Could it possibly be some sort of mid life crisis? I am forty five and frankly am starting to question everything in my life.

seeker: Yeah I am a few years shy of a midlife crisis but I joke about it being a mid life crisis all the time.
supporter: heh it does creep up on you trust me :D

supporter: Hi, good afternoon.

supporter: Losing a job is always anxious.

supporter: Oh so your job is not protected and your short term disability will end soon? Is that correct?

supporter: Your department manager is not answering you?

No, I have sent them a few emails about it. It makes me nervous. I do not have a phone number to call and my psychiatrist
 really does not think I am ready to go back to the stress of my job.
supporter: Have you tried mentioning that to HR?

supporter: Yes that is how most employments work about providing personal information.

supporter: No you should not have to feel you made a mistake for the time you  are taking out of work for a necessity.

supporter: Hello, how are you today.

supporter: We definitely don't want him to hurt himself or someone else.

supporter: I can imagine, I'm worried now too and I don't even know your friend. I really hope you keep me updated on how things go.

supporter: You're so welcome.  So it sounds like you'll call the doctor office (once you get the number) but please let me know if I can help any other way.

supporter: you're so welcome.  glad I could help.

. Just have an idea about how to make it work.

supporter: Can you tell me a little more about your situation so I can better understand?

seeker: My friend's husband is spreading false rumors about me because my daughter moved up in soccer and theirs didn't.  He's telling people it's because I'm having an affair with the coach - who is married!  This is not true!  My daughter is a better soccer player.
supporter:
It sounds like your friend's husband might be jealous of your daughter, or embarrassed
 that his daughter did not get moved up also. Have you spoken to your friend about this?

seeker: I haven't yet.  I was deciding whether or not to talk to him directly or just her or both at the same time.  I am really upset and don't want to lose her.  I know people get all crazy about their kids and sports.  I agree that he's jealous but his daughter isn't really that good - didn't make the school team either.  Should I talk to my friend alone first?
supporter: It depends on the depth of the relationship between the three of you. How long have you all been friends?

seeker: About 6 years.  Our daughters are also friends, too.  I am single so I don't care about the husband but also don't want to come in between their marriage.
supporter: Yes, that is a difficult situation to know how to handle. It could be in your best interest to leave your friend out of it so she doesn't feel stuck in the middle or forced to take sides. However she could view the opposite as you going behind her back.

seeker: yes that's true.  I don't want to go behind her back but also don't want to get her involved.  I could have the coach talk to the dad maybe?
supporter: Yes, coaches are a great resource for life's dilemmas. Perhaps another option would be to casually mention something to him in passing, like at one your daughters games as to avoid any big blowups or emotional exlosions.

seeker: Oh that's a good idea - in public and not making a big deal about it - and before she moves teams and rumors get worse.
supporter: That is exactly right. Each person handles and avoids conflict differently and you have the important roll as leader in all of this. There is a chance he is not aware of the strain this has put on you emotionally and he could respond well to not being called out by someone else. Does that make sense?

seeker: it does - but doesn't seem that he cares about my strain on my life since he's the one spreading such lies about me.  I just hate him!
supporter: I can understand how you would feel like he doesn't care about the strain it's placed. Can I ask, are your daughters aware or involved in these rumor's? This could make a difference in how you could respond.

seeker: I did tell her because I was so mad when another mom told me.  She doesn't care.  She still likes the friend but not the dad.
supporter: Sounds like your daughter has a good head on her shoulders. Maybe there's something to be learned from her reaction to all of this. I understand how hard this has been for you so perhaps simply ignoring the rumors will allow you to heal quicker, by simply being the bigger person. Because rumors are just rumors, after all. You and your daughter know the truth and that's all that matters.

seeker: yes you're right.  I will try to just ignore.  And figure out what to do with my anger over all this?  Maybe go for a run and also avoid him?
supporter: If he knows you know and you rise above with a smile on your face, that could show him that you are more mature than his childish games, and that you mean business. By taking ownership of your own feelings and emotions, you might find that will squash your need to let out any anger towards him.

seeker: oh I like that and I am willing to try.  I am tired of wasting my energy being so angry at this man who like you said is jealous which is HIS problem and shouldn't be might, right?!
supporter:
Exactly. Let his problems remain his. You worry about you and your daughter and he can watch from a distance confused at his failed attempt to reflect his own dissatisfaction with life onto you didn't work. I think you will feel freed
 of any stress this has caused.

seeker: Hello
supporter: Hello! How's it going? How can I help you today?

supporter: We all have those days :/ what's bothering you?

seeker: I can't seem to get motivated.
supporter: It sounds like your having trouble giving yourself that little push to get the wheels turning. I've totally been there. What do you feel is the reason?

seeker: I don't feel like it is worth it.
supporter: I understand, I've been there before. You just have to take one step at a time and not overwhelm yourself . Have you tried any tools to help you get going?

seeker: What kind of tools would you suggest?
supporter: What I find that works is to make out a list of all the things you want to accomplish and the possible steps you need to get there. It also helps to let someone know how you feel like a friend or relative, you would be surprised that being open with people can open up new doors in life.

seeker: I can talk to my friends sometimes.
supporter: You feel like your friends don't listen or care? And trust me you are not alone. I am going through that as well. I messed up so you can say, but as time went on I realized that I can't live like how I was living anymore and I SLOWLY moved towards my goals. I just graduated phlebotomy school for example.

seeker: Wow that's amazing. I want to start my own business but I have no money to start with.
supporter: Thank you! Yeah money is tight these days especially with the pandemic going on. If your business has a good idea there are many venture capitalist that are willing to invest in your idea. You can search for websites and pitch it to them. But don't let anyone stop you, you can do it!

seeker: That is a great suggestion
supporter: Check out crowd funding websites. Like go fund me, indi gogo, kick starter, and just giving.

seeker: Well, my fiance and I "sort of" broke up recently. I moved out of our place and all, but we continued to see each other at least 3X per week. And we both said we're not 100% sure that we're ok with us being done for good. - We promised to tell each other if we start dating anyone. He said he wasn't interested in dating. Three days after that conversation, I come over unexpectedly to find him making dinner for a woman I've never seen before. Turns out it was his 3rd date with her. He met her on a dating app a week before our conversation about promising to tell each other if we start dating others.
supporter: I'm so sorry that happened. Are you mostly hurt because he didn't tell you he was seeing somebody else?

seeker: To be honest, I'd still be hurt if he told me. But now on top of that hurt, I feel disrespected... and everything I thought I knew about him is kind of crushed. We were together 6 years, and I always, ALWAYS believed he was the most honest, kind, "stand up guy" I've  ever known.
supporter: You must feel really torn up about it. I can tell that you care about your relationship.

seeker: Yes, that's true. The worst part is that he doesn't seem to think I have a right to be hurt. How do I even deal with someone who hurt me but doesn't care to take any responsibility whatsoever?
supporter: Maybe he didn't intend to hurt you. Its not like he invited you over to tease you. It is true that he didn't keep his promise, and that's his fault.

seeker: That's true. He didn't invite me over. I expected him to be at work that night. I was coming over to see our cats, which still all lived with him. I still had a key and it didn't occur to me that I could invade his privacy since I had been spending 3X a week with him, and he was fine with me using the key. The whole thing was a shock. I wouldn't have come in had I known what I'd find inside.
supporter:
That would definitely add to the distress of the situation to have a weird surprise like that. It doesn't really seem like your fault that you were there but it is unfortunate nonetheless. Have you tried talking to h
im yet?

seeker: Yeah. It's a long story to explain here, but at first he told me it was a first date... then he said it was a second date... then finally he said it was a third date. I had to figure out on my own that he met her through a dating app, which makes me feel extra icky because now I kind of feel like a stalker. (Don't worry, I didn't do anything illegal or immoral to figure this out at all. He left an easy breadcrumb trail for me to follow.... but it still feels gross that I felt compelled to research the situation because I could "feel" he was lying.)
supporter: That's ok, you have a vested interest in this person. It is natural to be interested in such things.

seeker: Yes. I'm not only invested in him. I have a SUPER close relationship with his two daughters. Some of the reason he wanted to see me after our "break up" is because he didn't want to tell his daughters that I might be out of their lives forever. He told me so much.
supporter: There are a lot of therapists out there that might be able to help you navigate this. It's OK to get some outside help.

seeker: That's a good suggestion. I think individual therapy might benefit me. I could ask him if he's open to couple's counseling--even if it's over, it could help with closure.
supporter: Considering how much time you've put in to this relationship, I can tell you have a lot of feelings about all of this.

seeker: I do. I appreciate your talking the time to listen to me. Sometimes just talking about an issue can help organize one's feelings and thoughts.
supporter: Really, it is no problem. It helps to let it out sometimes, I feel that. Make sure you take care of your own needs before starting to smooth things over.

seeker: That is good advice. I haven't been eating or sleeping as well as I should since this all started. I'll work on that. --- Thank you so much for your time and help and kindness. :) I wish you a great weekend!
supporter: Thanks and you too, stay strong!

seeker: Thank you!!! Take good care, stranger. I sincerely wish you the very best. <3
supporter: Fare thee well sweetheart, best indeed.

supporter: Accept that you are anxious so you can control it instead of it control you. Accepting actually makes you less focused on it, because you don't have to wonder about it.

supporter: Nothing special, just sit in my room in silence. Listen to tutorials on youtube to meditate

supporter: That's part of meditation! I too worry while meditating, but when i'm listening to the videos and following instructions all those worries go away :) If that doesn't help you, you can go out in nature to clear your mind off things. Being in the wild really motivates me to continue.

supporter:
Meditating absolutely does since the whole point is to clear your mind off things and concentrate on the task ahead.
And the wild? that's whole other experience because you either concentrate on things or you get mesmerized by nature :)

supporter: Please do! You can try it with friends or alone. With friends can be a more fun experience while alone can be more spiritual or calming

seeker: Hey, I'm doing well, how are you?
supporter: I am not so bad. Is there anything you'd like to discuss with me today?

supporter: Are you not happy in your current job? It's a bad time to be job hunting really.

seeker: I was unemployed all year but that is no longer an option.
supporter: What sort of work are you looking for? Would you be prepared to take something outside of your usual field?

seeker: I want to do avoid labor jobs as I have other talents, but I'm not totally against it.
supporter: Sometimes it is necessary to take a temporary job that you don't really like just to make ends meet alas.

supporter: Well true but if there's no work out there that will help build your career you kind of don't have much choice ;)

supporter: Hmmm well how are your computing skills? That's a great field to be in at the moment.

supporter: Well that would be an interesting thing to learn don't you think? Though I don't know much about them myself I must admit.

supporter: It would but if you've nothing better to do due to the pandemic it might be worth it

seeker: It would be nice to have something reliable long term, but I have done temp work in the past.
supporter: Me too. It can be a bit soulless but it does pay the bills when you don't have anything else to do.

seeker: Hi - I'm sorry. I stepped away from the computer for a moment while waiting...
supporter: That's quite all right. The wait times can be a bit long. How are you?

seeker: Well, my manager has decided that everyone in the office will continue to work from after the pandemic is under control. But I've found myself depressed from working from home all the time.
supporter: Working from home is not what people expected. Many have found themselves isolated. They miss the interaction of the office. How long have you bee working from home?

seeker: For a full year--since March 2020, when the pandemic first started. I was working from home just 1 day per week prior to that, which I liked. But I've found that 5 days per week is much too much. I miss people. :(
supporter: Have you and your co-workers talked to your boss about a hybrid schedule, maybe a couple days a week in the office? That might work.

seeker: That's where it gets awkward. It seems like everyone besides me are super happy that we'll continue working from home. I hesitate to share my feelings because maybe my manager will change her mind, which would be a big bummer for everyone else on the team (seemingly).
supporter: I see. That's a concern. So you feel that if one person goes in to the office, then everyone else will have to? There won't be any flexibility?

seeker: Well, it's possible that my manager will say we can be flexible. But if so, I think I'd end up being the only one in my office working... which would be just as lonely as working from home while throwing away the few perks of working from home, like saving on gas. Plus, I think my company will probably want to repurpose our office space eventually.
supporter: Hm. A bit of a dilemma. Can this situation go on forever though? Maybe the boss will extend the stay-at-home for a while, but when other companies go back to the office, the expectation will be there for all companies.

seeker: That is indeed a possibility. But my office is in a city that has a whole lot of high-tech companies, which were moving towards doing more work from home even BEFORE the pandemic. So it kind of feels like this might be a "cultural shift" in my area in general. Although there has GOT to be a whole lot of other people who feel like I do. Maybe we should start our own company, lol.
supporter: True. I don't think you are alone. Is there something that you can do to make working at home better for you? More frequent breaks? Better work space?

seeker: That's a good question. My state is still one of the ones that's mostly shut-down. Part of my depression surely stems from the fact that all evening/weekend activities ended a year ago as well.
supporter: True. It might be easier to work at home when you have a chance to get out of the house during your free time.

seeker: That's true. And your suggestion of improving my work space is a good one. I've been working in a modified walk-in closet. I've tried to make it inviting, but there are no windows/etc.... it's kind of a dark cave.
supporter: Most people didn't plan for the long term because nobody thought that this was a sustainable way to work. By the way, if your company wants you to stay home, then it might help buy the equipment you need to be productive.

seeker: That's a good thought. My computer is set-up on a folding card table. (I tried finding a desk a while back, but there was a huge shortage since everyone suddenly had to buy them for themselves, kids, etc.). I hadn't thought of asking my company to buy me one. Plus a more comfy chair could improve my attitude.
supporter: I think if you talk to your co-workers, they'll have ideas for upgrading your workspace.

seeker: That's a great idea. Maybe I should set-up a "virtual happy hour" where we can exchanged the tips/tricks we've learned to make working from home more enjoyable this past year.
supporter: I think that's a great idea! People probably want to connect without having to talk about work. Later on, they might want to do the same thing but face-to-face.

seeker: You're right! Well, thank you so much for your help.... and you TRULY did help me put this all into perspective. Sincerely, thanks! :)
supporter: Sure! My pleasure. Best of luck with all that! Have a great weekend!

seeker: Thanks! You too! Bye
supporter: Is there a quit/finish button on your end?

supporter: The pandemic has been hard on many people, those in relationships and those looking for new ones! Have you tried to develop a new hobby or interest that you can do with others once the pandemic is over?

seeker: Well, I've been writing enough poetry to publish a book, so I'll certainly do that. I know the pandemic has been rough for everyone. Hopefully my doctor will say I qualify for the vaccine soon.
supporter: That's great! Poetry is something you can share in person or over video link. What about physical activities? I think that yoga might be something that you can do by yourself and with others. There are a bunch of videos on sites like YouTube.

seeker: Oh, I took advantage of virtual yoga and zumba early on during the pandemic. Friends had virtual classes. Eventually they were able to go back to work. Being disabled is a poverty trap for a lot of people, not just me. I really want to find a girlfriend once I get vaccinated.
supporter: I have tried yoga myself, but it wasn't really my thing. I prefer walking and riding a bike.

seeker: Well, certain things don't work for every person.
supporter: True. I like trying new things, but I am happy to give them up if they just don't fit my style.

seeker: Technically, no, I don't HAVE to wait to get vaccinated, but then again, maybe I don't want a girlfriend. The only one I had ten years ago in college wanted to marry me and have a child and I wasn't ready for commitment. I fear marriage, actually.
supporter: Marriage is a big step, and any prudent person would think carefully before making the commitment.

seeker: That's a good point, I'm sure if my poetry is entertaining or full of truth about my experiences in a wheelchair, perhaps a woman will find that attractive
supporter: Are you concerned that things will move too quickly to that level of commitment (marriage)? You could make it clear from the outset that you want to take it slow.

seeker: Or I could just get an adult entertainer to be my companion for a day. I've done that before with women in that industry. It costs a bit, but it's worth it for companionship
supporter: Robin Williams talked about that situation.

seeker: Did he really? Well, it's sad how he ended up, I'm too scared to commit suicide like he did! I enjoy living life, even when I have months at a time without human connection
supporter: Adult entertainers provide one kind of companionship, but it is not complete. It feels like a stopgap to me. Is it fulfilling enough for you?

seeker: You're right, I just lack self confidence in my poetry....hopefully I'll figure out a way to spit it out on a blog or something
supporter: You could trade poems with other budding poets. "I'll show you mine if you show me yours."

seeker: Oh it's been very fulfilling for me when I've had the opportunity to use it. Most of them are genuine women. Only a handful have tried to take advantage of me.
supporter: Thanks. Ok. The pandemic is particularly hard on extroverts. People look down on sex workers, but I think that the world is a big complex place and people are trying to make their way in it. If everyone is consenting, I see no problem.

seeker: Well of course it's consentual. I would never NOT ask for permission to do things with a sex worker, or any person.
supporter: Sure! I'm glad we had a chance to chat. Best of luck with making friends/girlfriends after the pandemic!

seeker: Yes there is, and I am pressing it right now. Thanks so much, I'll be fine. Have a good night!
supporter: Good night!

seeker: I am very sada
supporter: What are you sad about? Perhaps I can help.

seeker: My girlfriend cheated on me with her ex.
supporter: Wow that is not nice of her. Have you talked to either of them about it? I would recommend that you do.

seeker: No I have not spoke to her. She is deaf she cannot hear.
supporter: Hmm do you mean literally or metaphorically?

seeker: Literally. She cannot hear. She was born deaf.
supporter: Well can you communicate with her through sign language?

seeker: I can, But I have no hands.
supporter: Gosh, life hasn't treated the pair of you very well, has it?

supporter: Well, at least you're putting it to good use.

seeker: I just want to tell my ex who cheated on me with her ex I still love her.
supporter: But with only a huge nose to work with - is this really viable?

seeker: I want it to be. But It hurts my face to insant message her on AIM.
supporter: You still have AIM? Wow, you are really out of date. I hate to say it but maybe she's better off with her ex?

supporter: Sometimes we just have to learn to let go *nods sententiously*

seeker: His hands are so big he could be a power forward in the WNBA
supporter: I do not know what that is but I can probably spend the rest of my life without finding out and still die happy.

seeker: her ex is like John wall and I look like Justin beiber with no hands. He tried to fight me and told me if i talk to her again I'm gonna "Catch these hands"
supporter: I don't know who those people are either. I live a very sheltered life.

seeker: I used to live a sheltered life. I was then unsheltered and cut my hands off in a bicycle accident
supporter: I thought you were born without them but perhaps they grew back.

seeker: I wasn't born I just showed up one day.
supporter: (and you just scrolled back to check, didn't you? :D)

seeker: I sure did it took a minute with this nose
supporter: :D Well, it's been interesting and, erm, I wish you joy in your future romantic endeavours. Maybe find a more trustworthy girlfriend in future?

seeker: of course
supporter: We all learn by our mistakes. Thanks for talking and spend that two dollars wisely!

seeker: Will do good Bot.
supporter: Oi! I am NOT a bot

seeker: I have had my babu for 15 years and have to give him up.  He is a parrot and so used to me.
supporter: I am so sorry to hear that. You have probably become very attached after that long, I can imagine.

seeker: Yes, I am worried that he wont be taken care of.  I am worried that he wont be happy.
supporter: Can I ask why you have to give him up? Do you have any other pets?

seeker: NO other pets.  I have gone leaglly blind, had to give up driving.  I have to move to a condo from a single famuly home.  He is too loud to live in a condo.
supporter: You are a very good caretaker for your parrot. You have given him a lot of specialized care.

seeker: Going blind is bad enough, giving up driving was teh worst.  But giving up my parrot is really hard.
supporter: You have been the best you could be for him and it has got to feel really sad to let him go. It can feel like a death sometimes when you lose someone or a pet.

seeker: If he died it would be OK, I would mourn him and move on.  But I have never had to give up a pet before.  I just think most people. wont take care of him like I do. Because he is still alive, I will worry about him
supporter: I understand a little bit of how you feel. My dog died recently and it was really hard when the vet had to put him down. I was really sad and would cry when I thought of him ort the things we used to do together.

seeker: Yes, I was depressed for 6 months after my parrot died, but eventually we move on.  I dont know that I can move on after giving him up
supporter: Would you ever consider getting a pet that is not as loud? I am not suggesting that you replace him.

seeker: No, except a seeing dog
supporter: I am concerned that if you don't have a pet to care for you may have a more difficult time to recover and thrive. Mourning is a process and it might be easier if you can hare your ;love with another pet.

seeker: No other pets.  I need to move and cannot take him with me.
supporter: A seeing eye dog is a great idea. You are trying to think of ways to help yourself and that is really important. You are also reaching out and sharing your feelings. Do you have any friends with pets that you can visit with from time to time?

seeker: It isn't about a new pet it is about worrying that he will not be taken care of.
supporter: I am sorry that makes a lot of sense. I am really thankful that you are sharing your feelings and expressing them.

seeker: Contacting a rescue place has helped me.
supporter: Rescue centers usually make people apply to adopt to insure a good home for them. You have made him into a wonderful pet.

seeker: I think that will be best for him
supporter: You are welcome. You are doing what is right and i am proud of you for listening to your heart and providing the best all these years.

seeker: I feel emotionally sad. It is unforgiving and hoping to find healing
supporter: Hi! Hope you are feeling better now. I will help you to find some solution

seeker: With this kind of pandemic situation, it is making me more upset as I am not able to go out to socialize with people to foget my problems.
supporter: The pandemic situation is tough for everyone, so don't worry

seeker: My boyfriend brokeup with me 6 months ago and without saying good bye face to face.....it is just making me wonder why?
supporter: I am sorry to hear that.

seeker: We were not able to see each other ever since the pandemic and we just ended our relationship
supporter: I would like to give some suggestions

seeker: that would be great
supporter: Please ask your boyfriend to discuss to me so that i can advice him

seeker: We don't talk anymore.
supporter: This pandemic is taking longer time to settle because many people do not follow the guidelines suggested

seeker: definately....
supporter: Please do not get upset.  Try to understand each other then only it is possible to reconcile

seeker: I don't want to see him or talk to him. I just want to get on with my life to start a brand new one. I am just feeling so sad and depressed.
supporter: Is my advice helpful to you?

seeker: no.  are not telling me how i can get my depression away
supporter: Don't be upset we all come across difficult times in life. This is one of the time.

seeker: thank you. i will forget and take it one at a time.
supporter: Please seek some interesting relaxation for mind. If you deviate your mind from getting upset then you can overcome this depression.

seeker: I will try....
supporter: Ok sure . Good luck.

seeker: thanks
supporter: Thanks for listening to my suggestions

seeker: Hi, doing OK. how are you doing?
supporter: I am not so bad. Is there anything you'd like to talk about?

seeker: I am having difficulty in controlling my anxiety and look for some support.
supporter: Ah I hear you, I have suffered bad anxiety for years. Have you been getting medical help?

seeker: Not really, although I got some medication prescribed, however, am very afraid of getting addicted and reliance.
supporter: Some anti anxiety medication can be addictive but if you're sensible with it you should be okay. Talk to your doctor?

seeker: Yes, she suggested so. But I am not convinced.
supporter: What about counselling .. would you consider that? There is some very good therapy available

seeker: I haven't thought about it...maybe not familiar with the circumstance.
supporter: True - I know different cultures do take different approaches to things and in some places talking about mental health is taboo

seeker: I have no idea what to do.
supporter: I would recommend giving counselling a go, even though you're not totally sure about it

seeker: what if it doesn't work and cost a lot?
supporter: Is it not possible to get it free? It is provided free in my country

seeker: very costy here in the US
supporter: Ah, you need to move here to the UK ;)

seeker: also varying by the healthcare providers.
supporter: We don't have to worry about the cost of medication or counselling as we have socialised medicine

seeker: can you please explain further about socialized medicine?
supporter: Sure. Everyone pays a small percentage of their income - depending on how much they earn - and it goes to fund the NHS. Everyone is therefore eligible for free hospital treatment etc and we pay a standard amount (about ten pounds ie fourteen dollars) for a prescription, no matter which drugs we are gettign

seeker: I see. That's how South Korea manage healthcare too.
supporter: Most of Europe do it that way. It works well :)

seeker: However, the US healthcare system is totally different, so commercialized.
supporter: At least you'd be sure you'd be able to get help for your anxiety!

seeker: sure thing!
supporter: Alas yes, it's a very scary system. Too many people suffer cos they can't get insurance or pay their bills

seeker: yes, it is so sad even if I have a health insurance from my workplace, but we have to pay from out of pocket, which is ridiculous.
supporter: Yes it really is - I can imagine that that sends your anxiety sky high. We just don't have to worry about that - we pay in advance and no more than we can afford

seeker: I am currently taking, but still not effective.
supporter: you need quite a large dose each day - regular won't do anything

seeker: How large?
supporter: I am probably not supposed to give medical advice :) But have a look online

seeker: I see.
supporter: It genuinely did help me though

seeker: good to hear!
supporter: Anyway thank you for talking and I wish you well!

seeker: Thank! I may try higher dose of Vitamin B.
supporter: you too!

seeker: I am feeling very sad
supporter: I am very sorry to hear that. What are you sad about?

seeker: My partner of 9 months cheated on me.
supporter: Oh wow that is really rough. Do you think you might be able to work it out or is it over permanently?

seeker: It is over permanently...
supporter: Maybe it is for the best - I have been cheated on before and although it hurt at the time it turned out to be the best favour he could have done me.

seeker: Yeah I guess, the relationship was a little toxic and she sometimes only used me for money.
supporter: Sounds like you're definitely well off out of that one!!

supporter: There will be someone else. I never thought I'd find anyone else but I did and we've been together ten years ago now!

supporter: Is there anything you can do to distract yourself right now? Plan a holiday or take a night class or something?

supporter: Save up what you make and buy yourself something nice?

supporter: I'll be around for ages if you want to talk some more on here!

seeker: I think talking to you has benefited me a lot so thank you for that
supporter: You're welcome :) I have a solution for every problem you know ;)

supporter: just wait till fifteen mins is up ;). If we quit before then we get less. So, um, tell me about your ex?

seeker: ok got it
supporter: ah! I met mine through OKCUPID. Online dating is definitely the way to go these days

seeker: yeah it really makes it easy to meet new people
supporter: Not like when I was younger when the internet was just taking off. Internet dating was seen as weird then

seeker: Bye
supporter: bye

supporter: Would you like to give me a few more details?

I expected my friend surely will help. But he did not. This has put me some anger on him. This was a situation that happened 1 year before. Now I recall this for chatting.
supporter: Well, are you sure that he could have definitely afforded to loan you anything?

seeker: Yes. That was well within his limits and he should have obliged.
supporter: Well, the thing is, just because you had lent to him does not mean he is obliged to help you

supporter: Is it possible to try to talk to him calmly and tell him exactly how he has made you feel?

seeker: Yes. I tried calmly of the situation. He told accepting as the situation has passed. I am not sure he has fully understood. As the situation passed, he says okay.
supporter: I think you need to decide whether you just just let it go or whether you cant' and won't be able to continue the friendship

seeker: However I continue the friendship not affected by this harassment.
supporter: Aren't you worried that it might rankle with you and surface again at some time to affect the friendship?

seeker: My behavior with him will not be affected because of this. But whenever I happen to think or recall of this I get to anger of it unavoidably. And cools off in some time.
supporter: It is understandable. I hope that I have been able to help you a little and thank you for talking it out!

supporter: Have you thought of trying any meditation exercises or breathing exercises... just to help you stay calm?

seeker: Generally I am cool, not an emotional person. If I need any special training, it should be only because of this. If there is some simple  way that could help.
supporter: I think you should give it a try - I have personally found breathing exercises very helpful! Thank you for talking, I must go now.

seeker: However it is not at all required. That anger does not affect me, just only feeling for some minutes. I let it go.

supporter: Yes I do but the task really is finished. Please press quit, I can't do it my end. Neither of us will get paid if you do not. Ten turns each and fifteen minutes .. we've done that.

seeker: If you are urgent, I do not want to delay you . Thanks, Bye.
supporter: bye!

supporter: I am very well. Do you have any problems you'd like to discuss with me?

He was often the driver not my friend.  Was he high when he was driving my daughter arround? Did my friend know he was on drugs?
supporter: Wow that is a tough one - I can see why you would be concerned about it. At least, though, you can be assured that she is safe and is never going to come to any harm as a result of his driving now

supporter: That would not make it acceptable though!

supporter: you're welcome :) (you need to quit your end; I can't from this end :))

supporter: That sounds like a challenging situation. How long have you had to deal with this?

supporter: That's some months that you've been out of work. What kind of work are you looking for?

supporter: That's good to hear. So you can manage for a while. What kind of work do you hope to find?

seeker: I was working in a distant location in a better job. Now I am trying to find a better one in a nearby location.
supporter: So many jobs would be acceptable if they are nearby and are in a related field.

seeker: Yes. Some job may be available, if to pick any one. I do not want to switch often. Better late to find a better job. I have attended few interviews. I hope will get one. Probably the date is the difference.
supporter: Do you have any contacts in industry that could be of help? That might give you more options.

seeker: I have contacts in the previous job location only. But not in my family location. Some of my friends in the previous location have given some idea what I can do. To find a job in my previous location is not an issue. I try to be nearby.
supporter: Ok. So in a way, you need to build a new network of industry contacts nearby. Is there an industry group or other club in the area?

seeker: I am worried if it will help or I have to switch to my distant locaion only.
supporter: How much time can you wait? Time seems to be the gating factor here.

seeker: Since my wife is working, I do not have a time limitation to find a job. My worry is whether I have to be distant again, while pandemic has not ended.
supporter: Ok. You think you'll have job opportunities, but maybe not ones that meet your location needs. Are you hoping to spend more time with your family?

seeker: Yes. Particularly in pandemic times.
supporter: It sounds like you have a good handle on your situation. Is there anything else I can help you with?

seeker: In your opinion, Am I in the right path?
supporter: Yes. Time will help you resolve this issue. You will gain perspective on what's out there.

seeker: We, I and my wife, also think the same way. Even if takes some time, better to wait.  But we were having an oscillation. After chatting with you, we feel supportive of our thinkings.
supporter: That's great! I'm glad I was able to help.

seeker: Now that we had enough discussion and had my worries clarified, Can I take a leave. Thank you for your help.
supporter: Ok.

seeker: Hi
supporter: Ok. That sounds like something that you should talk to someone about. How many classes are you taking at the moment?

seeker: I am taking 4 classes and I am struggling with all of them
supporter: That's tough. A full load of courses. Do you have to take all of them right now? Can you adjust your course load?

seeker: I have to take them all right now to make sure that I graduate
supporter: That's a challenging situation. Can you get help from the professor with the deadlines? Maybe you could look into getting a tutor.

seeker: My professors are trying to help they are actually being really nice. I am just having issues balancing it all honestly. I feel like I can never catch up on anything its just a lot on my plate
supporter:
Great! I think a tutor will give you some guidance on how to stay on top of your courses. 
Your situation is not unusual. Many students have difficulty trying to manage it all. Are you working a job as well?

seeker: I am just
supporter: Ok. No worries! Can you adjust your hours at your job? Do you need the money, or can you maybe take a short break from work until you catch up?

supporter: True. Once you're on the other side of this semester, you can put in more hours. Do you absolutely have to finish this semester, or can you put off a course until the next term?

seeker: I would like to finish this semester just because I have a job lined up for me right when I graduate where I can make a lot more money and not struggle as much financially
supporter: Is the job contingent on graduation? Maybe you could take one course while you do the job. Work full-time and study  part-time.

supporter: Do you have to get high grades in the courses, or just pass?

seeker: Luckily I just have to pass so it makes it a little less stressful
supporter: Ok. Do your best to pass. Try to cut back an hour or two at the job. Keep you eyes on the prize: the full-time job after graduation.

seeker: Yeah it all seems so far away but I just have to remind myself to look at the bright side and that something great is waiting for me at the end
supporter: Great! Best of luck with everything then!

t tried an email. I have only called her severally, sent her message via whatsapp and facebook.

It might be good to let her know that "I understand it's over, but could you help me understand why so that I can close this chapter" - perhaps she would respond to something like that.  If she doesn't, then you are going to have to make some hard decisions and try to process this.

Sometimes we do the best we can, and it still doesn't change the situation.  Just know that her decision does not mean you are unworthy, it just means that she is not worthy of you - but someone else is and then it would be time to go and find them.

supporter: Oh okay, well while looking for job try not to put yourself in position where you take deep breaths and let your mind at piece. Patience is everything. Sometime in life we all have our patience tested, but that is OK because at the end the results are better than anything.

seeker: That is true. Maybe it just isn't the right time. Maybe I need to learn something before I find a job that I need to do
supporter: Of course! Everything comes at a perfect time, and we have to learn to be patient, and while waiting we can indulge in other activities that we like.

seeker: I volunteer once a week with animals

supporter: nobody knows him better than you do, right now I do not think he is in a good place either since it wasn't his choice to end it, how do you think he would react if you started pressuring him?

supporter: frustration and anger are common responses in situations like this, perhaps you can try a softer approach and let him know how you feel, without pressuring him into a response

supporter: you can always ask him calmly if he would like to talk, so you both have a chance to express your feelings in a safe way, with no yelling or arguing, do you think that's something he would do?

seeker: I can try that, I think he might be responsive at first if I dont set him off. All of his friends hate me so I have nobody on my side right now. Should I try to get his friends to like me again? Is that an way  I could use to get him to want me again?
supporter: nobody likes to see that one's friend is sad because of someone else, I think this is an issue that only the two of you can resolve, if he takes you back then his friends will take you back as well, but you need to make sure you want him back

seeker: I can understand what you mean. I need to think this through.
supporter: what made you like someone else in the first place?

seeker: Well, we are in a small town and he was popular and the cutest guy in our town. I liked being with someone so popular. He wasn't always nice to me and is why I wanted to be with someone else for a short time. He used to leave me at parties and go off with his friends sometimes.
supporter: was it a common thing that he didn't give you the attention you wanted?

seeker: I really liked being with the popular guy who everyone looked up to. My parents don't like him at all and have wanted us to break up the whole time we were together.
supporter: it sounds to me like you liked the title more than the feeling of being with him, reflecting on your time together, would you do that again?

seeker: I have never thought of it this way. You are making a lot of good points that I never thought of before. When I think about him I miss the way I felt in terms of being popular. I don't really miss him as a person.
supporter: popularity in my opinion, it's just an opinion (I hope I make sense) but think about how you'd like to be treated and how you want to feel when you are with someone, because at the end of the day it's your feelings and your happiness, I wish you the best of luck.

supporter: There is government help available for people who are financially suffering I believe - have you looked into this?

seeker: administrative work.
supporter: Has she considered temping? I did that when I was between permanent jobs and it was quite good.

seeker: No we haven't yet. That's actually a pretty good idea.
supporter: It's not as well paid but you can choose your own hours. There's also online gig work out there too

seeker: Anything would help at this point. We also have a three year old to care for.
supporter: Have you considered going to a food bank? They can be very useful

seeker: We feel bad going to food banks. I make enough money to pay the bills and I know there are others out there in more need. It's just when the unexpected happens it makes things really tight and difficult. We have used up all our savings during the pandemic and I rely on my car to get to and from work.
supporter: You should not feel bad. Have you not donated to food banks yourself when times were better? I used a food bank in a crisis time and now I give back whenever I go shopping

seeker: Thanks for the reminder. We have donated to several places in the past. I appreciate the kind words.
supporter: Everyone needs help sometimes :) And you can pass it forward when things are better for you. On that note I suppose I had better go but I was glad to speak with you!

seeker: Likewise! Thanks again, I really appreciate your time. :]

supporter: Right! To be honest I suspect that it's far more their problem than it is yours.
