supporter: It sounds like you had to deal with a partner recently cheating and a breakup, is this right?

seeker: yes thats it
supporter: It sounds like this has been stressful for you and you are trying to figure out how to move on from this.

seeker: exactly, i can tend to focus because i have given so much time and affection, i never thought i would be called the fool after everything i did
supporter: It is incredibly difficult to get something like this off your mind and it seems like you are trying your best to move forward with your life

seeker: i want to move on but i dont know how, i tried to but i just cant
supporter: I have been through this, I learned how to keep myself busy and do things that I enjoy to occupy my mind and let time heal those wounds

seeker: i think you right, maybe i should renew my netflix sub, since i find great interest in movies so as to get some positive vibes and think less of this whole situation
supporter: Science shows that during a breakup sometimes you romanticize the relationship and view it as better than it actually was and missing something that wasn't as good as you thought

seeker: yh thats true
supporter: My suggestion is to focus on new hobbies, spend time with friends and family when possible, if you have work you can do in the mean time, if you like to exercise or go outside, all of this is a helpful tool.

seeker: this is really helpful, i really do appreciate this suggestions
supporter: Don't be afraid to express your feelings and confide in others about your emotions and mental health. It is still a loss and something you should feel comfortable grieving.

seeker: Thanks alot, i feel very relieved talking to you alone, i feel like something negative just left me, i know i will be a better person from this day onward
supporter: I am glad this was helpful for you and hope you will seek further advice if you feel the need to discuss with someone unbiased.

seeker: thanks, you are a life saver
supporter: Okay hope all is well and I can provide resources if needed for you.

seeker: i got all i need now
supporter: Thank you and same to you.

seeker: HI, how are you? I'm having a problem. It's making me angry.
supporter: What makes you angry. Can you describe

seeker: My friend has a new girlfriend. She's really unpleasant to everyone. I can't stand her.
supporter: Oh  thats so sad. I am feeling very bad.

seeker: Thank you. I would like my friend to dump this girlfriend. She's ruining the friendship!
supporter: Do one thing call her and try to talk with her. In our world no one is mean.

seeker: I've tried to talk to her. She's arrogant and insulting. She thinks that everyone else is an idiot. Talking to her just makes me angrier!
supporter: Take both of them to restaurant or call at home. Tell your problem directly

seeker: I would like to talk to my friend without the girlfriend around, but she seems to butt in all the time. I can't get him alone to explain how this crazy woman is ruining his other friendships.
supporter: Very first you have to calm down.Don't break your friendship so easily. Friends are like gems.It's my request not to give up

seeker: Thank you. I don't want to lose the friendship. I don't think I can stay calm with that woman around.
supporter: Tell me how you are feeling to leave your friend because of one girlfriend

seeker: I am feeling that it would be a shame. We have been friends for so long. I don't think the girlfriend cares about my friend's feelings or friendships. She just thinks about what she wants.
supporter: Make sure with me today that you won't break your friendship. Please reassure with me .

seeker: I will do my best to maintain the friendship. I might have to put it on hold for a while. Until he breaks up with the crazy woman.
supporter: Anything else I can help you?

seeker: No, thank you. I think I can try again to save this friendship and put aside my anger.
supporter: You are very nice!!!

seeker: Thanks. Well, have a good day!
supporter: You too!!!

seeker: It was good that we had a chance to chat. I didn't realize how angry I was.
supporter: Don't keep any hard feelings for those who like you more

seeker: Hi I am feeling quite sad today.
supporter: Ohh, sorry to hear that. Any partucular reason?

seeker: Yes I feel like my friends just don't care about me much at all.
supporter: You saying that your friend does not care about you any more. Is that correct?

seeker: Yes, when we get together all they want to do is talk about themselves. When I raise something that is bothering me they just ignore what I say and go back to what they want to talk about.
supporter: That's not good. You must be feeling left out.

seeker: Yes I feel left out and unsupported by them.
supporter: Any particular reason they are doing such thing?

seeker: Well I think they don't care about me and are just selfish about their needs.
supporter: In that case, should you consider them as your friends?

seeker: Well they are the only friends I have and I have known them a long time. Do you think I should stop being friends with them ?
supporter: If someone is not friendly they are not real friend. You need to find someone who will stand by you no matter what..

seeker: Oh well that makes me feel sad too.  I will be saying goodbye to some long friendships. Do you think that is the only answer ?
supporter: Ok.. how about hosting them in your place for a gettogether..

seeker: Ok how do you think that would help me ?
supporter: They might open up if you are hosting .. people are generally nice to the host..

seeker: Yes that is true, it's a good idea.  I could also take the opportunity to tell them how I am feeling.
supporter: Good.. let's try that.. Anythign else I could help you with?

seeker: No you have been very helpful and I feel much better now I have a plan of action to address my problem. Thanks.
supporter: Thank you .. have a good day.

seeker: I lost my job recently that's why I'm very sad.
supporter: Hello

seeker: I'm very sad about my situation
supporter: Okay so what kind of job was it?

seeker: I'm very sad because in this coronavirus situation its very difficult to get new job
supporter: Okay yes I agree with you I was also trying to find a new job since I had more time after graduating.

seeker: yes i now its very difficult time for everyone
supporter: Okay since you are trying to find a new job you could try to learn some new techniques online. So you could put that on your resume to keep you from feeling sad.

seeker: Now I'm waiting for to when government will opening all business
supporter: Oh that is good. That will make you different from other people so when government opens up it will be easier for you to get in.

seeker: Yes I have hope and i'm thinking positive
supporter: Yeah that is the best medicine for right now. Your welcome.

seeker: I'm still struggling to get new job that's why I'm sad
supporter: Yeah in this economy right now not that many places are hiring right now so it is hard. Or they are hiring but a lot of people are applying so they are looking at everybody and choosing the best canidate.

seeker: yes its very difficult time i know, Thanks for your support
supporter: Your welcome.

seeker: good to having you
supporter: You too

seeker: Im doing ok how are you
supporter: I'm doing alright. Why just OK?

seeker: im struggling with a coworker! He continuely talks down to me and is just mean
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble with him. That can certainly be frustrating. What types of things does he say that make you feel talked down to?

seeker: He continuly says the work that I am doing is not good enough. He always has something to say about my driving and asking me to correct things that I cant such as hitting to many potholes
supporter: Well, in my experience, when someone is critical of you -- it says a lot more about their character than anything you did wrong. Is he your coworker or your boss?

seeker: He is a coworker
supporter: Have you tried bringing up your feelings and frustrations to your boss or HR representative?

seeker: I have but he continuely says he will talk to him but its been a month now
supporter: That would certainly be frustrating. Have you tried speaking to the coworker directly and letting him know how his comments are making you feel?

seeker: I have and he seems to just shrug it off
supporter: I had a similar experience at work once. I decided to ask the coworker directly what I could do to improve. Sometimes if you ask them to provide the solution they can see you actively trying. If that doesn't work, maybe you could just ask your boss if there is a possibility of not working with him and instead another coworker?

seeker: hmm that a great strategy! I have never asked him for a solution! I Can do that for sure in regards to talking to my boss and seeing if I just cant work with him!
supporter: Sounds like a great plan of attack. Just remember your own self worth along the way and try not to let him bring you down!

seeker: I face the situation of me being sad because I thought we could let this fight go over time but instead it has lead to us breaking up
supporter: Can you tell me more about the fight?

seeker: Yes, so we had a fight previously over Thanksgiving Break about how I woke her up from her sleep and she kicked me out of her place at like 4 in the morning. Then I pick her up to go try and get breakfast...then she starts punching me while I drive so I pull over. Then she keeps hitting me until I tell her to stop.
supporter: Breakups are usually sad for at least one of the couple.  Is your sadness because of missing her or being alone or something else ?

seeker: It is because I do really miss her. I really hate that our fight got to that level to where we broke up
supporter: Breakups are hard, but it sounds like she was violent

seeker: Yeah she was a little violent. I was honestly a little scared for my life for a second but people make mistakes.
supporter: Have you talked since then?

seeker: We have talked a little bit before hand this month. It was okay but I am still sad about what happened
supporter: If safety is an issue, then I think that maybe moving on is a good decision

seeker: I know but I am so sad because the break up was so quick and we did not really have closure after the whole fight happened between us. I still keep on thinking about her.
supporter: I suggest that you do things that will help you get over her., like going out with friends or a new hobby. Don't be in a hurry to get into a new relationship , but if one happens that would be great too.

seeker: I will definitely try to get over her using those techniques you just said.
supporter: Breakups are not always the end, but they usually happen for a reason, and whenever violence is involved it is usually better to move on

seeker: Maybe you're right! Just need to get productive and get my mind off of her for good since she was violent
supporter: I suggest you start trying to have fun with others and getting yourself out there where there will be new opportunities

seeker: I will definitely try. I know it will be hard because I am upset still but sometimes I guess moving on is the only thing that you can do in this situation
supporter: The sadness will eventually pass and I am sure there is someone out there that will be a good match for you

seeker: Awww I hope so. Just like some people say...there are plenty of fish in the sea. Thank you for the advice. It was really helpful.
supporter: I wish you the very best .

seeker: I am feeling very sad right now, my boyfriend just broke up with me out of the blue
supporter: I am so sorry that happened to you. It can be very difficult to cope with situations that seem they come out of nowhere. Did your boyfriend give you any reason for ending the relationship?

seeker: He said he has been struggling with depression and needed to be alone
supporter: Sometimes having depression can make a person feel that they need to seclude themselves. Were you aware that he felt this way?

seeker: He has been distant recently.
supporter: Unfortunately that can be a sign of depression or that something is going on. Have you been able to communicate with him previously about becoming distant?

seeker: Every time I would bring it up he would dismiss it. I just don't know what to do. How can I get him back?
supporter: Maybe you could try to talk to him about seeking help for depression? Talking to someone close to him or even a professional would help him immensely. Talking to a counselor would help him learn ways to cope with his feelings.

seeker: That is a good idea. I want him to get back to being himself. He is like a different person right now. It's scary.
supporter: I understand completely. Depression runs in my family and if it goes untreated, can scare anyone that is involved. You can try suggesting that he talks to a close friend, family member, or counselor to talk about how he is feeling and ways to cope with it. Sometimes medication could be a good way to fix the chemical imbalance that can cause depression.

seeker: I will try to help him, he just doesn't want to seem to talk to my anymore. Do you have any suggestions on how to approach it with him?
supporter: You could start a conversation by saying that you just want to check on him and see if he is okay and how he is doing. You don't want to start the conversation by immediately telling him to get help, as he might just get defensive.

seeker: That is a good approach. And you don't think I will further upset him?
supporter: I don't believe it will upset him if you ease into suggesting that he should talk to someone he is close to or seeing a professional. Your main goal is to check on him and make sure that he is okay since he seems to want to be alone and not talk to anyone. Once he tells you how he is doing you could mention that even talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings could lift a weight off his shoulders. If he seems that he doesn't really know why he feels the way does, you could suggest that medically speaking, sometimes our brains don't produce the chemicals that we need them to and it could make us feel bad. Seeing a professional to get their opinion would also help greatly.

seeker: I agree, I hope he is agreeable to all of this. I just miss him so much and want him back.
supporter: It's very hard to see someone we care about go through this.

seeker: I just hope he opens up to me, and if not me, someone who can help him.
supporter: Even just trying to talk to him to see how he is doing will show him that care about him. I'm sure that once he is talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings, he will start to get back to his old self.

seeker: Hi to be honest I am very depressed and angry today
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that. What is causing you these feelings?

seeker:
Since helping to raise my grandson and his dad is not helping, or cares how I am feeling.  My grandson has been really difficult lately and I find myself losing my temper quickly
.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that. That sounds like a difficult situation. Have you tried any personal exercises to help you cope with the situation until you find a resolution?

seeker: I do go to a quiet place and try some deep breathing, but my grandson always comes walking in
supporter:
That's certainly a difficult situation. Is there no resolution possible with the father of your grandson? I want to make sure that th
e cause of the depression has properly been addressed by you or someone else.

seeker: I try talking to him, but due to my grandson having some disabilities his dad does not really want to be bothered.  I just want my grandson to succeed and be the best he can be
supporter: I think it's great that you have such care and concern for your grandson. That shows how incredible you are and on behalf of your grandson, I think you are doing a tremendous job. I think you should continue to support him however you can, but it's also important to take care of yourself. Do you have time available for additional self care, or are there any new exercises you can try to try to take care of yourself?

seeker:
Thank you for saying that it means alot having someone tell me I am doing a good job. 
I recently purchased a hot tub and have been thinking that maybe when he goes to bed I could go out and relax, but have not done that yet
supporter: That sounds like a great start. Self care is vitally important in this difficulty time with COVID and the pandemic. I recommend any little bit of time that you can contribute to yourself, this includes reading, relaxing, meditating, exercise, or just resting. Anything that can help you repair so you are better prepared to help your grandson.

seeker: I will try my best to get more time for myself and try to relax more often that I currently am.
supporter: Do you think the anger you are feeling is directly a result of the situation? Do you feel the anger is manifested from somewhere else? I think it is important to get to the underlying source of the anger and take care of that first and foremost.

seeker: I feel that I am having trouble dealing with the fact that I am not able to do all the things I want to do.  It is not an easy thing to lose your abilities when you feel so young but your body says otherwise.
supporter:
I think that's a normal way to feel and a frustrating part of growing older. I think focusing on positives and things you enjoy will help keep your mind away from thinking about "what used to be" or "what once was" - finding passions and joys in new things could help revitalize you. 
Can I help you find new hobbies or passions?

seeker: That is a great idea, I may even have some here that I could use.  I am lucky that I do have two dogs that keep me going as well and am trying to get out and take them on walks more, but not easy when is so cold out lately.
supporter: Totally understandable. I'm a little younger and even I am sick of sub 50F weather, so that's not age holding you back! I think it's important to maintain positivity and find any outlet that keeps that going for you.

seeker: Thank you I will definalty do that and will look for some additional exercises to do.
supporter: You're welcome. Is there anything else I can help you with today, even if it's something as simple as providing suggestions for new things to try?

seeker: I would love some additional suggestions!!
supporter: Meditation has worked wonder for my best friend. The app Headspace is fantastic. I'd also recommend podcasts, using either and app or your computer, and find a series on a topic that you enjoy, weather it's mindfulness, or self-care. There are plenty to choose from and you can go at your own pace.

seeker: Those sound like great ideas, thank you again!!
supporter: You're welcome. I hope you find peace within and happiness again. Your grandson will improve with time, it's inevitable! But stay positive, stay focused, and be sure to not take anything out on him as he relies on you and your input. Have a wonderful day!

seeker: Hello.
supporter: Hello, glad to meet you virtually. How are you?

seeker: Im doing fine. What about you?
supporter: I am good.  How may I help you?

seeker: I have problem with the communication. One of the main problems, is that Im not sociable person, so I dont have a lot of friends, and the situation with Covid, just finished me. Now, I'm siitin at my home, just playing game and study. How can I start to communicate with people?
supporter: I completely get that.  I am thinking that most people are feeling isolated therefore communication with others are feeling even more challenging thank usual.  Playing games can certainly help.  What type of games do you play?  Perhaps there are people that share the same interests

seeker: For example, the games that I'm playing are: Call of Duty, League of Legends. Yes it's multiplayer game, where can communicate throught the discord or voice, but I'm making a lot of cringe staff, that takes away new playes/friends.
supporter: Multi player games help I would assume.  Do you play with people you actually know sometimes?  I am sure that you make a great friend so we can explore areas of meeting new people,  I can tell you that I am not having the easiest time keeping up with friends and I am certainly not meeting new people in person very often myself.

seeker: Almost, I play solo. Yeah, I undertsand your message. You said right things.
supporter: Okay so perhaps play with people as opposed to solo.   Do you think it would be worth a try?

seeker: Yes, I need to try it. I guess it's one of the best way to solve my problem. Thanks
supporter: You are quite welcome.  Perhaps I can play as well.  Is it easy to catch on or are the games you play difficult?

seeker: Yh, it kinda difficult, cause need to know some staff, before you play it.
supporter: Got it! Do you play sports or any other activities where you encounter people?

seeker: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression.
supporter: You've come to a good place to start.

seeker: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job.
supporter: I'm sorry to hear that. Feeling resentment for both your husband's loss of work and your son's loss of his job is entirely understandable.

seeker: I have a hard time not dwelling on the negative things going on.  It's hard to see anything positive or feel hopeful for the future.
supporter: I have an adult son who also lost his job recently, and I understand the added stress that can cause in your household.

seeker: My son is very defiant and argues with us about everything we try and get him to do, but he expects us to give him money for fun things that he wants to do when he isn't willing to work or even help out around the house
supporter: Regardless of what your husband's actions are and your son's, could you possibly make the time to do things to support yourself, that even momentarily would provide you with some positive feelings?

seeker: I try to go for a run every night, that does help.
supporter: That is very hard emotionally, so I am sorry you have to deal with your son's behavior.

seeker: It is hard to keep my emotions separate from what is going on with him
supporter: That is very understandable! Setting boundaries for yourself may help. Even when it's difficult, being clear with your son that you will not be giving him money could help.

seeker: Yes, I could do better at that.  I want him to have fun and do things with friends, but I want him to be willing to work for what he wants, too.
supporter: I completely understand that. Especially when it comes to people we are close to, it can be hard to separate our expectations from theirs.

seeker: I feel guilty sometimes taking time to do things that I like and that are away from my family.  I can see that I need to do that more, though.
supporter: I've had to learn this lesson many times with my own children. It's difficult, but ultimately will give you some relief from your resentment.

seeker: Thank you, it is helpful to know that other people have felt the same way.
supporter: Absolutely! Being a parent is difficult. Remembering to support yourself helps. Making the time to do things to support your wellbeing doesn't make you selfish at all

seeker: Thank you!
supporter: You are certainly not alone.

seeker: hello
supporter: What's on your mind?

seeker: I have real bad anxiety about the possible 2nd shut down due to the rise in Covid
supporter: We are on the same boat

seeker: its extremely draining
supporter: I understand how you feel. I think others feel the same too, that we're exhausted no matter if we're directly  affected or not

seeker: yep.. it just makes me sad, I wish we didnt have to go through this
supporter: It saddens me too because even when we have vaccines, the damage has been done and the aftermath is unimaginable

seeker: I'm not to keen on taking a new vaccine
supporter: Can you tell me why not?

seeker: just like you stated, the damage is done
supporter: You should still take it though. What done is done, the new vaccine will help situation not getting worse

seeker: just because its new, it seems like its being rushed.
supporter: I thin it's rushed because people trying to push it so they voided some troublesome paperwork stage

seeker: i will continue to wear my mask and social distance for sure.
supporter: Frontliners will get it first, you don't have to worry too much about the vaccine

seeker: i still have to worry, because about half of my family are on that line
supporter: Then you should be relieved since the sooner they  get the vaccine, the less worry for your family

seeker: nope, im scared
supporter: It's ok to feel doubtful about it, you can keep wearing mask and social distancing and take the vaccine when you feel ready

seeker: yes, thats what I keep telling myself.
supporter: We need to put an end to this and vaccine is the fastest way. It's gonna take very long to find treatment

seeker: Hello! I'm just here because recently I haven't felt motivated. I miss my friends and I want to see them and do things, but everytime they offer I am too unmotivated to go out even though I want to. And I live with one of my best friends, and I don't even do anything with her
supporter: So you are concerned that you are feeling unmotivated and don't feel like doing anything.

seeker: yes prettu much
supporter: Have you felt like this for a while or has it only been a recent change in your feelings and motivation?

seeker: It's sort of on and off recently. I'll get little bursts of motivation, and then it quickly goes away. Pretty much every other day
supporter: That must be a real challenge and if it is a recent change it is natural to feel concerned about this.

seeker: Oh really? I hope so I'm worried that it isn't natural since I haven't always been like this
supporter: I do not always feel positive and motivated myself and have spoken to a professional in the past which helped me understand why this is, for me it was linked to a lack of sleep.

seeker: Oh so me feeling this way could be a result of other things that maybe aren't at the healthiest in my life?
supporter: People's moods can be regulated by many things. I know for example that sleep and diet can play a big part in some cases.

seeker: I feel like I eat okay and I get enough sleep, but I do work a lot. Very long days and I feel drained at the end of the day. That seems like the obvious reason, but usually I'm still able to do stuff afterwards...
supporter: have you tried talking to your friends and telling them now you feel? They may not know you are feeling this may and might be able to help you and provide support.

seeker: That's true, I haven't really talked to them about it. I usually have a hard time opening up
supporter: What is it about opening up that you find difficult? is it sharing your feelings with others?

seeker: I guess I'm scared I'm going to come across weaker to them
supporter: I think you have reached out for support and so you clearly want to do something about this which is a great first step. I think you can get over these fears and overcome them.

seeker: Yeah. It's just easier for me to do it anonymously but I do need to talk to the people that are important to me
supporter: I can tell you are anxious about it and fear coming across as weak but I think that would be a positive step for you.

seeker: Yeah, I think so too :)
supporter: I think you can do it and overcome this issue!

seeker: Thank you!
supporter: You are welcome

seeker: I'll do my best
supporter: Thanks for talking it through

seeker: I'm having issues with my parents. You can say we are having a conflict
supporter: What kind of issues do you think you are having?

seeker: well they won't allow me to date this girl i met online.
supporter: I understand it can be very difficult at times with parents. Especially since they lived in a life that was very different from today.

seeker: Yes, i tried but it won't get through their head. There are so old school. They want me to date someone close to my age.  is 15 year difference too big of a gap?
supporter: The basic problem is that your parents believe that 15 years is too large of an age gap between you guys.

seeker: They told me she's  gold digger.  Yes i come from money but hey this girl is the one.
supporter: You believe that the girl is not a gold digger, but instead you guys like each other for who you are. Money is not an issue for you guys?

seeker: nope not at all. hmm well she does ask to use my credit card alot. my parents foot the bill.
supporter: Perhaps you should try to talk to your parents around this fact. For example, if money is the problem for your parents, you can set some rules. LIke you can set an allowance for how much money you can use each week.

seeker: Ok, i will talk to them this weekend. what's better on the phone or in person?
supporter: If you want a better communication, I believe in person will be best.

seeker: hate talking to my parents face to face, all they do is yell and i get frustrated
supporter: I apologize and I do agree it is sometimes difficult. Perhaps it will be better to talk to them with another  person present.

seeker: That's a great idiea. i will bring my g.f or is that a bad idea?
supporter: If another person is present, it may make it easier. However, I believe it should be someone that is not invovled in this issue. Perhaps another family member or a close family friend.

seeker: gotcha. i will bring my good friend. i'm sure he can help me out. great advice by the way. i'm so mad though why my parents care who i date. man i'm old enough. let me make my choices
